TITLE: Here are 4 ways the Federal Reserve's big rate cut could change the housing market
SUMMARY: Here's a look at what the Federal Reserve's rate cut will mean for those looking to buy — or sell — a home.

TITLE: Forget tedious paper applications, Americans can now renew passports online
SUMMARY: The State Department announced Wednesday that its online renewal system is now fully operational, after testing in pilot programs, and available to adult passport holders whose passport had expired within the past five years or will expire in the coming year.

TITLE: Vance says Haitian migrants with protected status are 'illegal aliens' to be deported
SUMMARY: The Republican vice presidential nominee continues to rail against Haitian migrants living in Ohio, though many have Temporary Protected Status, as the GOP escalates its hardline immigration stance.

TITLE: Sterlin Harjo didn't see himself in the TV shows he watched – so he made one
SUMMARY:
When Sterlin Harjo was growing up, he didn't see many Native Americans in mainstream media. But Sterlin's TV show, Reservation Dogs, changed that, depicting the lives of four Native teenagers growing up in Oklahoma. Sterlin talks to Rachel about how he thinks fate has guided his life, why people should go to more funerals and how hunting feels like praying.

To listen sponsor-free, access bonus episodes and support the show, sign up for Wild Card+ at plus.npr.org/wildcard

TITLE: Inside the Brooklyn jail where Sean Combs is locked up: violence, squalor and death
SUMMARY: As they fought to keep Sean "Diddy" Combs out of jail after his sex trafficking arrest, the music mogul's lawyers highlighted a litany of horrors at the Brooklyn federal lockup where he was headed.

TITLE: Portugal declares a state of calamity as wildfires rage out of control
SUMMARY: More than 100 wildfires stretched thousands of firefighters to the limit in northern Portugal on Wednesday, with seven deaths as fires spread out of control over the weekend.

TITLE: 2 close calls have the Secret Service facing criticism and an uncertain future
SUMMARY: The Secret Service is again facing criticism following a second apparent attempt on former President Donald Trump's life.

TITLE: COMIC: Can I just wash the stinky bits? And other honest questions about bathing
SUMMARY: Washing your body seems like a no-brainer. But once you get into the details, things get complicated. Dermatologists offer surprising advice on how often to shower, when to toss your loofah and more.

TITLE: Exclusive: Watchdog finds Black girls face more frequent, severe discipline in school
SUMMARY: The Government Accountability Office found that Black girls received nearly half of the most severe punishments, like expulsion, even though they represent only 15% of girls in public schools.

TITLE: Concerns about noncitizen voting drive sweeping new restrictions in New Hampshire
SUMMARY: A new law in New Hampshire will require anyone registering to vote for the first time in the Granite State to provide documentation they are U.S. citizens, like a birth certificate or passport.

TITLE: In a major shift, the U.S. government explores giving renters cash, not vouchers
SUMMARY: Federal housing vouchers are the largest rental aid program, but many landlords reject them. Experiments will test whether cash helps more people sign a lease.

TITLE: 10 undecided voters explain why they haven’t picked a side in this election
SUMMARY: With the presidential election between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump as close as it is, the small percentage of undecided voters could have a big impact on the outcome.

TITLE: Sickle cell gene therapies roll out slowly
SUMMARY: It’s been almost a year since the Food and Drug Administration approved the first genetic treatments for sickle cell disease. So far, only a few patients have received the long-awaited treatments.

TITLE: Venezuela's opposition leader says he was forced to sign letter that admits defeat
SUMMARY: Venezuela's former opposition candidate, Edmundo González, on Wednesday said he was coerced into signing a letter effectively recognizing his defeat in July's presidential election.

TITLE: Why Teamsters won't endorse a candidate for 2024. And, how to avoid credit card debt.
SUMMARY: The Teamsters, a large and prominent union, is not endorsing a presidential candidate this cycle, breaking away from what other labor unions are doing. And, tips on how to avoid credit card debt.

TITLE: Ukraine keeps up the fight against HIV while fighting a war
SUMMARY: Progress in preventing infections was being made in the country with Europe's second-highest number of HIV cases. Then came the Russian invasion.

TITLE: A viral nine-month world cruise saw plenty of drama, but not the kind you'd expect
SUMMARY: The "Ultimate World Cruise" consumed social media, with many comparing it to a reality show. But what was it really like? Passengers spoke with NPR, nine months and 60-plus countries later.

TITLE: New research points to raccoon dogs in Wuhan market as pandemic trigger. It's controversial
SUMMARY: With genetic samples from the infamous Wuhan market, a new study makes the case that raccoon dogs are likely the animal that infected humans. Proponents of the lab leak theory are dubious.

TITLE: Bomb threats followed Trump's false claims about Springfield. Some Haitians may leave
SUMMARY: A Haitian community leader in Springfield, Ohio tells <em>Morning Editio

TITLE: 'Times' reporter Haberman weighs in on Trump, the media and the turbulent election
SUMMARY: Maggie Haberman, who's spent years covering Trump, discusses his behavior on the campaign trail, including his insistence on responding to every slight — even when it undermines his appeal to voters.

TITLE: An ex-CIA officer gets 30 years for drugging, filming and assaulting dozens of women
SUMMARY: Brian Raymond admitting to drugging, filming and assaulting the women, most of whom didn't know until investigators showed them footage. Several shared their experiences in court as he looked on.

TITLE: Truth Social reaches a tricky milestone. Will Donald Trump cash out his stake?
SUMMARY: Trump can now start selling his majority stake in the Truth Social parent company, as a lockup on insider sales expires. But that could tank the price of the stock.

TITLE: Uncommitted movement doesn't endorse Harris, but asks supporters to vote against Trump
SUMMARY: The Uncommitted National Movement announces it will not endorse Vice President Harris but does not want supporters to vote for former President Donald Trump, and discourages third party votes.

TITLE: NASA's 'Hidden Figures' awarded Congressional Gold Medals for pioneering space work
SUMMARY: A group of Black female scientists and mathematicians known as NASA's “Hidden Figures” were honored Wednesday with Congressional Gold Medals, the highest award given to citizens by Congress.

TITLE: FAA investigating cabin pressure problem that injured passengers aboard Boeing plane
SUMMARY: The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating an incident aboard a Delta flight in which a cabin pressurization issue with the Boeing 737 caused some passengers to bleed from the nose and ears.

TITLE: 'Uncommitted' movement doesn't endorse Harris, but asks supporters to vote against Trump
SUMMARY: The Uncommitted National Movement announces it will not endorse Vice President Harris but does not want supporters to vote for former President Donald Trump, and it discourages third-party votes.

TITLE: Retiring Later in China; Getting a Driver's License in Mexico
SUMMARY: In China the government is raising the official retirement age to combat a rapidly shrinking workforce. We hear reaction from Chinese workers. And life in Mexico City presents many challenges for people there. But getting a driving license isn't one of them.

TITLE: A woman sustains leg burns after straying from Yellowstone trail
SUMMARY: The 60-year-old woman, who has not been named, was near the Old Faithful Geyser at the Wyoming national park this week when she stepped through a thin crust over scalding water, park officials said.

TITLE: Shohei Ohtani becomes the first MLB player to top 50 homers and 50 steals in a season
SUMMARY: The Los Angeles Dodgers star reached the 50-50 milestone in his 150th game. He was already the sixth player in MLB history and the fastest ever to reach 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in a season.

TITLE: An iconic Churchill photo stolen in Canada and found in Italy is ready to return
SUMMARY: Canadian and Italian dignitaries marked the successful recovery of a portrait of Winston Churchill known as "The Roaring Lion," stolen in Canada and recovered in Italy after a two-year search.

TITLE: Turkey wants to regulate Germany's beloved döner kebab street food
SUMMARY: Under Turkey's proposal, beef would be required to come from cattle that is at least 16 months old, and be marinated with specific amounts of fat, yogurt or milk, onion, salt, thyme, and pepper.

TITLE: Deadly high blood pressure during pregnancy is on the rise
SUMMARY: More pregnant women are being diagnosed with dangerously high blood pressure, which risks the life of the parent and child. Montana is one of the states improving screening and treatment.

TITLE: Voters are advised to return their ballots early because of mail delay concerns
SUMMARY: Election officials are raising concerns about the U.S. Postal Service's ability to handle this fall’s expected influx of election mail. But USPS say it’s ready to deliver the country’s ballots.

TITLE: 2 former migrant farmworkers reflect on their journey together
SUMMARY: Emma and Rogelio Torres reminisce about how unlikely a pairing they were when they first met as migrant farmworkers in Arizona. They met in the 80s near Yuma — with love the last thing on their minds.

TITLE: Election officials on edge as voting begins. And, Haitians suffer from Trump's claims
SUMMARY: General election voting for 2024 is commencing as election officials worry about the threat level they face. And, the Haitian community is suffering from Trump's false claims that they eat pets.

TITLE: A “golden age” of rat research may be here. What the often unwanted companions can teach us about us
SUMMARY: Rat and human lives have long intersected, but there's little relatively little research about them. Thanks to advances in genomics and paleoarcheology mean a lot more study may be on the horizon.

TITLE: A 'golden age' of rat research may be here. What the often unwanted companions can teach us about us
SUMMARY: Rat and human lives have long intersected, but there's relatively little research about them. Thanks to advances in genomics and paleoarcheology, a lot more study may be on the horizon.

TITLE: Israel fires an airstrike in Lebanon's capital in the latest fighting with Hezbollah
SUMMARY: The attack came hours after Hezbollah fired 140 rockets at northern Israel and follows this week's deadly explosions of pagers and walkie-talkies carried by Hezbollah members.

TITLE: Supreme Court rejects Green Party's appeal to put Jill Stein on Nevada ballot
SUMMARY: The court’s action upheld a decision of the Nevada Supreme Court.

TITLE: Magazine writer Olivia Nuzzi is on leave over an alleged relationship with RFK Jr.
SUMMARY: <em>New York Magazine

TITLE: Announcing NPR's fourth annual College Podcast Challenge
SUMMARY: NPR's national podcasting contest for college students is now open for entries. Submit for a chance to win the $5,000 grand prize. Deadline is January 10.

TITLE: SPRINGFIELD INFLUENCERS
SUMMARY: Right-wing online influencers keep trying to find evidence to back ex-President Trump’s claims that Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, are eating pets. The claims have been repeatedly debunked.

TITLE: Trump tells Jewish voters they have 'no excuse' for supporting Harris
SUMMARY: In a speech to the Israeli-American Council, Trump described himself as Israel's "protector" and warned Jewish voters against voting for Vice President Harris.

TITLE: Lack of facts doesn't deter influencers from looking into debunked Springfield claims
SUMMARY: Right-wing online influencers keep trying to find evidence to back ex-President Trump’s claims that Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, are eating pets. The claims have been repeatedly debunked.

TITLE: A massive baby penguin named Pesto is inhaling fish and winning hearts
SUMMARY: Pesto, who weighs 46 pounds at just nine months old, has been on display at an Australian aquarium since April. As he grew, so did his social media fanbase — especially after a recent gender reveal.

TITLE: Israel says it killed a Hezbollah commander in a strike in Lebanon's capital Beirut
SUMMARY: The airstrike follows a deadly week of attacks that have intensified nearly a year of fighting between Israel and the Iran-backed Lebanese militia Hezbollah.

TITLE: Did exploding pagers attack on Hezbollah in Lebanon violate international law?
SUMMARY: The series of explosions that rocked Lebanon this week, killing dozens and wounding thousands, has prompted debate among legal experts on international humanitarian law.

TITLE: Three Mile Island nuclear plant will reopen to power Microsoft data centers
SUMMARY: Three Mile Island, the Pennsylvania power plant that was the scene of the worst commercial nuclear accident in American history, will reopen and sell power to Microsoft.

TITLE: A massive baby penguin named Pesto is inhaling fish and winning fans
SUMMARY: Pesto, who weighs 46 pounds at just nine months old, has been on display at an Australian aquarium since April. As he grew, so did his social media fanbase — especially after a recent gender reveal.

TITLE: Philip Morris sells asthma inhaler company, citing ‘unwarranted opposition’ to its goals
SUMMARY: Three years ago, the cigarette giant acquired Vectura, a British pharmaceutical firm that makes asthma inhalers, raising health groups’ ire. Now, it’s selling the business for almost $200 million.

TITLE: No needles required: The FDA approves an at-home flu vaccine
SUMMARY: The nasal spray option could encourage more people who have fears of doctors or needles to inoculate themselves against the flu.

TITLE: The Secret Service admits failures in Butler, Pa., Trump shooting
SUMMARY: The acting director of the Secret Service also cited “complacency” from others, as well as over-reliance on mobile devices and flaws in advance planning.

TITLE: Georgia's Republican-led election board OKs controversial rule to hand-count ballots
SUMMARY: Republicans advanced the ballot hand-counting measure over the opposition of Georgia’s Republican secretary of state and attorney general and dozens of local election officials.

TITLE: Israel says it took out a Hezbollah commander in a Beirut strike that killed 12
SUMMARY: The airstrike follows a deadly week of attacks that have intensified nearly a year of fighting between Israel and the Iran-backed Lebanese militia Hezbollah.

TITLE: Israel's Attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon Continue
SUMMARY: A building in a residential neighborhood in Beirut was struck by Israel, killing a senior commander with the militant group Hezbollah and ten other fighters, according to the Israeli military. It was the deadliest attack in Beirut in nearly two decades and it comes in the same week Hezbollah militants were targeted by Israel with thousands of exploding pagers and radios. We go to the scene of the strike in Beirut.

TITLE: Israel says it took out a Hezbollah commander in a Beirut strike that killed 14
SUMMARY: The airstrike follows a deadly week of attacks that have intensified nearly a year of fighting between Israel and the Iran-backed Lebanese militia Hezbollah.

TITLE: Harris says strict abortion laws lead to ‘predictable’ suffering for women
SUMMARY: Speaking in Atlanta Friday, Vice President Harris called tougher abortion laws “immoral” and slammed Republicans for what she called “longstanding neglect” around maternal mortality.

TITLE: In his hometown, Trump's alleged would-be assassin acted like he was 'above the law'
SUMMARY: Neighbors in Greensboro say Ryan Routh, the man accused of pointing a rifle at the golf course where Donald Trump was playing, wasn't someone they knew well. But he <em>was

TITLE: A rare treat getting rarer: Chimayo Red, New Mexico's 'holy chile'
SUMMARY: A beloved heirloom variety of New Mexico red chile commands high prices because of its scarcity. Finding farmers to continue cultivating it has become a challenge.

TITLE: U.K. dads are wrapping baby slings on male statues to push for more paternity leave
SUMMARY: The purpose is to raise awareness on the U.K.'s low paternity leave benefits, which currently stand at two weeks of paid time off for new fathers.

TITLE: Hazardous chemicals in food packaging can also be found in people
SUMMARY: Chemicals used in food packaging and linked with health problems have been detected in the human body. The chemicals can move from packaging into food.

TITLE: How Biden is getting used to life as a lame duck president
SUMMARY: President Biden has been receding from the spotlight as the campaign marches on. But he still holds the highest office in the land for another four months and he’s is trying to make the most of it.

TITLE: As early voting nears in Georgia, all eyes are on whether young voters will turn out
SUMMARY: Gen Z and millennial voters make up nearly half of the eligible voting population in this year’s election. In Georgia, the race is on to get them registered before early voting begins this month.

TITLE: The contest in one New Mexico swing district mirrors a larger, anxious electorate
SUMMARY: Democrats and Republicans both think they can win the state's Second Congressional District —  one of the swingiest in the country — where immigration and abortion rights are dominating the debate.

TITLE: 30 minutes from Springfield, another Ohio city welcomed immigrants — and got a boost
SUMMARY: Springfield has become a lightning rod in a pitched battle over immigration. Meanwhile, Dayton has welcomed immigrants for more than a decade, to fill vacant jobs and revitalize old neighborhoods.

TITLE: Whooping cough cases spike in the U.S., after people missed vaccinations during pandemic
SUMMARY: Infectious diseases experts say many Americans fell behind on their whooping cough vaccinations during the COVID-19 pandemic, which they say has compounded the recent uptick in cases.

TITLE: How Biden is getting used to life as a lame-duck president
SUMMARY: President Biden has been receding from the spotlight as the campaign marches on. But he still holds the highest office in the land for another four months and he’s is trying to make the most of it.

TITLE: DOJ investigates Mississippi sheriff's office following 'Goon Squad' torture case
SUMMARY: Last year, two Black men were beaten and tasered by six officers in a no-warrant house raid. Since then, the Justice Department said it got more complaints regarding similar instances by the deputies.

TITLE: FBI agents board Baltimore ship linked to Singaporean company sued in bridge collapse
SUMMARY: FBI agents boarded a vessel managed by the same company as the cargo ship that caused the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in March.

TITLE: Okinawa's governor strives for regional diplomacy as tensions in Asia-Pacific rise
SUMMARY: Denny Tamaki, governor of Okinawa prefecture, says his personal story is deeply entwined with the U.S. military’s presence on the island.

TITLE: A new 'mini-moon' comes to Earth this fall
SUMMARY: An newly discovered asteroid will be captured by Earth's gravity this fall. The "mini-moon" will spend about two months in Earth's orbit, before being flung back on its normal path around the sun.

TITLE: FTC sues insulin middlemen, saying they pocket billions while patients face high costs
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission said pharmacy benefit managers created a "perverse drug rebate system" that artificially inflated the cost of insulin.

TITLE: New center-right government in France announced 2 months after divisive elections
SUMMARY: The French presidential palace unveiled a new government dominated by conservatives and centrists. A left-wing coalition secured the most seats in June-July elections but failed to win a majority.

TITLE: 'The West Wing' cast visited the White House to celebrate the show's 25th anniversary
SUMMARY: The cast and creators of the hit political drama West Wing celebrated the series' 25th anniversary during a visit to the White House.

TITLE: Dozens of rockets fired into Israel from Lebanon, IDF says
SUMMARY: Over 100 rockets were fired into Israel from Lebanon early Sunday, with some landing near the northern city of Haifa, as Israel and the Hezbollah militant group appeared to be spiraling.

TITLE: Israel raids and shuts down Al Jazeera's bureau in Ramallah in the West Bank
SUMMARY: Israeli troops raided the offices of the satellite news network Al Jazeera in the Israeli-occupied West Bank early Sunday, ordering the bureau to shut down.

TITLE: 'I Don’t Want to Die.' He needed mental health care. He found a ghost network
SUMMARY: Ravi Coutinho bought a health insurance plan thinking it would give him access to mental health providers. But even after 21 phone calls and multiple hospitalizations, no one could find him a therapist.

TITLE: Money for cutting-edge climate technology could dry up in a second Trump term
SUMMARY: A hydrogen plant in Utah could offer a new path to slash fossil-fuel pollution. But federal funding that was critical for projects like this one could dry up if Donald Trump is reelected.

TITLE: Up against a 'ghost network' for mental health care? Here's what you can do
SUMMARY: Insurers’ failures to update their provider directories have led to dire consequences for people seeking mental health care. Here's how you can navigate these challenges to find treatment.

TITLE: In one key swing state, both parties are courting Black men
SUMMARY: With North Carolina now a toss-up this presidential election, both parties are making appeals to Black men. An older farmer and a younger restaurant owner share what's driving their votes.

TITLE: The human cost of ghost networks
SUMMARY: He tried to find a therapist who would take his insurance. He did not succeed.

TITLE: Marxist Dissanayake wins Sri Lanka's presidential election as voters reject old guard
SUMMARY: The election was crucial as the country seeks to recover from the worst economic crisis in its history and the resulting political upheaval.

TITLE: Third-party voters face a tough choice in a tight election
SUMMARY: Single-issue voters dissatisfied with Trump and Harris consider third party candidates in tight election

TITLE: Tufts University lacrosse players hospitalized for days after workout
SUMMARY: Tufts University says it has launched an investigation after members of the men's lacrosse team were diagnosed with a dangerous medical condition.

TITLE: Hezbollah vows a war of 'reckoning' as exchange of fire with Israel escalates
SUMMARY: The Israeli military said 150 rockets, cruise missiles and drones were launched toward Israel. Earlier, exploding electronic devices and an airstrike in Beirut killed dozens and wounded thousands.

TITLE: Speaker Johnson announces plan to keep the government funded until Dec. 20
SUMMARY: The measure does not include any part of the SAVE Act, the election security proposal backed by former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: After a week of attacks, Lebanon braces for more
SUMMARY: After a week of unprecedented Israeli attacks in Lebanon and Hezbollah counterattacks, Lebanon is bracing for more attacks to come.

TITLE: In U.N. vote, countries show willingness to move away from fossil fuels
SUMMARY: The body's call to speed up a transition from fossil fuels is part of a pact designed to bring countries together to tackle challenges in the 21st century.

TITLE: Alcohol-free beer is gaining popularity, even at Oktoberfest
SUMMARY: At Weihenstephan, non-alcoholic wheat beer and lager now make up 10% of the volume. The increase over the last few years mirrors the statistics for the rest of Germany's beer industry.

TITLE: Israel tells Lebanese to leave area where Hezbollah stores arms as it launches strikes
SUMMARY: The Israeli military on Monday called on people in southern Lebanon to immediately evacuate homes and other buildings where Hezbollah stores weapons and said it was carrying out "extensive strikes."

TITLE: AI can generate recipes that can be deadly. Food bloggers are not happy
SUMMARY: Apple, Google and Samsung are all working to integrate AI that can generate recipes into their virtual assistants, like Siri. People who work to develop recipes respond.

TITLE: We're talking to Nevada voters. Here's what role the state could play in the election
SUMMARY: Nevada could be a tipping point for the 2024 presidential election. Here’s what could convince voters to go to the polls and vote for either VP Harris or former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: EVs are cleaner than gas cars, but a growing share of Americans don't believe it
SUMMARY: Electric vehicles are caught up in the culture wars. Data from Ipsos shows the percentage of Americans who believe EVs are better for the environment than gas cars has dropped 5 points since 2022.

TITLE: Israel warns civilians to evacuate as it strikes wide swathes of southern Lebanon
SUMMARY: The Israeli military on Monday called on people in southern Lebanon to immediately evacuate homes and other buildings where Hezbollah stores weapons and said it was carrying out "extensive strikes."

TITLE: From Gaza to Ukraine, why do so many modern wars last so long?
SUMMARY: Russia and Ukraine have fought for a decade. The Israel-Hamas war is part of a conflict dating back generations. NPR’s Greg Myre has covered both wars, and looks at why they seem to defy a solution.

TITLE: Fragile X held him back. An experimental drug is helping him break free
SUMMARY: For 22 years, Jason Mazzola’s life was defined by a genetic condition that can cause autism and intellectual disability. Then he started taking an experimental drug.

TITLE: Nevada's role in the November elections. And, U.N. to discuss Middle East conflict
SUMMARY: Nevada is a crucial state in the presidential elections due to close competition for 270 electoral votes. And, the United Nations is convening to discuss the world's most significant crises.

TITLE: U.S. proposes ban on Chinese auto parts so cars 'can't be used against us'
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has proposed a prohibition on Chinese and Russian automotive hardware and software to protect US drivers from 'disruption and sabotage'

TITLE: Trump says he  wouldn't run for president again in 2028 if he loses this time
SUMMARY: When asked whether he would run again in four years if his current presidential bid is unsuccessful, Trump said “I don’t see that at all.” He would be 82 in 2028 — a year older than Biden is now.

TITLE: Israel's strikes in Lebanon kill more than 180 people, Lebanese officials say
SUMMARY: Fighting is escalated at the Israeli-Lebanese border in one of the deadliest days of nearly a year of conflict in the region.

TITLE: Prosecutors say suspect in Trump shooting attempt wrote a letter detailing his plans
SUMMARY: The man accused in the apparent assassination attempt of Donald Trump at his golf course a week ago in Florida appeared in court for a pre-trial detention hearing. Ryan Routh was captured fleeing the scene.

TITLE: Israel warns civilians to evacuate as it strikes wide swaths of southern Lebanon
SUMMARY: The Israeli military on Monday called on people in southern Lebanon to immediately evacuate homes and other buildings where Hezbollah stores weapons and said it was carrying out "extensive strikes."

TITLE: Pennsylvania college investigates swim team after racial slur is carved on student
SUMMARY: Earlier this month, a Gettysburg College student used a box cutter to write a racial slur on another student's chest during a social gathering on campus. The incident is under campus investigation.

TITLE: A third of former NFL players surveyed believe they have CTE, researchers find
SUMMARY: The degenerative brain disease can only be diagnosed after death. But hundreds of retired players reported symptoms linked to CTE, like depression, mood swings and suicidal thoughts.

TITLE: The 'alpaca' haircut teenage boys and young men are obsessed with — explained
SUMMARY: <em>Morning Edition

TITLE: Israel's strikes in Lebanon kill more than 270 people, Lebanese officials say
SUMMARY: Fighting is escalated at the Israeli-Lebanese border in one of the deadliest days of nearly a year of conflict in the region.

TITLE: Octopuses and fish share leadership--and enforcement--in group hunting
SUMMARY: When octopuses and fish hunt in groups in the Red Sea, the leadership roles are more dynamic than researchers knew — as are some ways the animals enforce cooperation.

TITLE: Stylish Olympic shooter Kim Yeji got an acting gig. She plays an assassin, of course
SUMMARY: Kim Yeji, whose cool style and demeanor made her a "main character" of the Summer Olympics, has landed an acting gig and work with fashion brands. She says her athletic career remains her priority.

TITLE: Crime in the U.S. fell in 2023, FBI data show
SUMMARY: New data released by the FBI show violent crime and property crime both fell in 2023 compared to the previous year.

TITLE: California sues ExxonMobil for misleading public on plastic recycling
SUMMARY: California’s lawsuit alleges that ExxonMobil has known for decades that recycling would not effectively stem the flow of plastic waste.

TITLE: Lebanon raises the death toll from Israeli strikes to 356
SUMMARY: Fighting has escalated at the Israeli-Lebanese border in one of the deadliest days of nearly a year of conflict in the region.

TITLE: Octopuses and fish share leadership — and enforcement — in group hunting
SUMMARY: When octopuses and fish hunt in groups in the Red Sea, the leadership roles are more dynamic than researchers knew — as are some ways the animals enforce cooperation.

TITLE: More forever wars?
SUMMARY:
The US is trying to broker an end to the war between Israel and Hamas. Ceasefire talks begin and end and begin again. Secretary of State Antony Blinken has traveled to the region 10 times in the past year.

And that's not the only war the US hopes to end. Russia and Ukraine have been fighting since 2014 when Russia first attacked. It launched a full-scale invasion in February 2022, more than two and a half years ago.

The US and NATO have been supporting Ukraine's efforts to hold off Russia in a hope to preserve broader security and stability in Western Europe.

The next occupant of the White House looks certain to inherit two major conflicts.

Why are these wars lasting so long with no end in sight?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

TITLE: Lebanon counts nearly 500 people killed in a single day of Israel's strikes
SUMMARY: Analysts say it's Israel's largest aerial strikes against Hezbollah since 2006. Lebanon's Health Ministry say dozens of women and children are among the casualties.

TITLE: Israel Moves Closer to All-Out War With Hezbollah in Lebanon
SUMMARY: Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon kill over 350 and injure more than 1,000. The attacks were mostly in southern Lebanon where Hezbollah militants have been trading fire across the border with Israel since the war in Gaza began. Our correspondent is there in the south of Lebanon where civilians are fleeing the attacks any way they can.

TITLE: Lebanon counts nearly 500 killed in a day of Israeli strikes, with over 1,600 wounded
SUMMARY: Analysts say it's Israel's largest aerial strikes against Hezbollah since 2006. Lebanon's Health Ministry say dozens of women and children are among the casualties.

TITLE: Motel 6 is sold to an Indian hotel company for $525 million
SUMMARY: The sale to Oyo, a travel business, will include the Studio 6 motel brand, which caters to customers seeking extended stays. The all-cash transaction is expected to be finalized by the end of the year.

TITLE: U.S. officials say Russia is embracing AI for its election influence efforts
SUMMARY: The cutting-edge technology makes it easier for Russia as well as Iran to quickly and more convincingly tailor polarizing content aimed at swaying American voters, intelligence officials said.

TITLE: Erik Menendez says Netflix show is full of 'blatant lies' about him and his brother
SUMMARY: In the 1990s, the Menendez brothers were put on trial for their parents' murder, becoming a media sensation that sharply divided public opinion on the brothers' motives.

TITLE: A GOP push to change how Nebraska awards its electoral votes appears to have stalled
SUMMARY: Republicans have sought to have the state switch to a winner-take-all system. The change would block one of Vice President Harris' main paths to the 270 electoral votes needed to win the White House.

TITLE: Boeing makes a 'final offer' to striking workers, but union says it's not good enough
SUMMARY: Boeing said Monday it made a “best and final offer” to striking machinists, but the workers' union said the proposal isn't good enough and there won't be a ratification vote before Boeing's deadline.

TITLE: Israel and Hezbollah continue to trade fire as residents in Lebanon look for safety
SUMMARY: The trade of cross-border missiles came after the deadliest day of conflict in Lebanon since 2006.

TITLE: Voters in a number of states could upend how their elections are run
SUMMARY: Voters in a record number of states — including the battlegrounds of Arizona and Nevada — are set to decide this fall whether to enact far-reaching changes to how their elections are run.

TITLE: MAGA hats, a rodeo, and carnival games: What we saw at a festival west of Las Vegas
SUMMARY: A festival and rodeo in Pahrump, Nevada, offers a glimpse into rural voters in the battleground state and how they could impact the election.

TITLE: Southwest is changing how it boards planes, but don’t expect it to be faster
SUMMARY: Southwest Airlines is expected to say more this week about its major change to assigned seats. It’s part of a larger shift across the industry to maximize revenue, even if it makes boarding slower.

TITLE: Megan's life was falling apart. Then a kind stranger swooped in to help
SUMMARY: After Megan Atherton was evicted from her home, her car broke down. She had a long drive ahead and nowhere to go, until a kind stranger stepped in.

TITLE: Have economists gone out of fashion in Washington?
SUMMARY: Once the high priests of policy, economists may now be seeing lower demand. But who's taking their place?

TITLE: New York City has a rat problem. Officials have a plan to kick it from the curb
SUMMARY: New York City has a well known rat problem. And the city is trying to tackle it — with trash cans and by changing human behavior.

TITLE: Human reviewers can't keep up with police bodycam videos. AI now gets the job
SUMMARY: AI can improve police "professionalism" by monitoring officers' body camera footage, according to the first independent study on the topic. Police aren’t so sure the benefits are worth the cost.

TITLE: ExxonMobil sued over plastic pollution. And, nearly 500 killed in Israeli strikes
SUMMARY: California is suing ExxonMobil for allegedly misleading the public for decades about the recyclability of plastic. And, Israeli strikes in Lebanon yesterday left nearly 500 people dead.

TITLE: Watchdog sheds light on FAFSA fiasco, from a birthday bug to call center failures
SUMMARY: A new review and testimony from investigators with the U.S. Government Accountability Office offer the clearest picture yet of the aid form’s troubled rollout.

TITLE: A boy snatched from a California park in 1951 is found living on the East Coast
SUMMARY: Luis Armando Albino was lured away from a California park at the age of 6. He reunited with his biological family this summer after his niece found him through DNA testing and newspaper clippings.

TITLE: How Trump and Vance's tour of dude influencers might help them win
SUMMARY: Donald Trump has spent the last several months speaking with popular male influencers and podcasters like Logan Paul and Theo Von. The appearances are part of a strategy to turn out young men.

TITLE: Voters in several states could upend how their elections are run
SUMMARY: Voters in a record number of states — including the battlegrounds of Arizona and Nevada — are set to decide this fall whether to enact far-reaching changes to how their elections are run.

TITLE: Mueller investigator says Russia interfered in 2016 -- and in the 2024 election too
SUMMARY: Mueller deputy Aaron Zebley looks back on the investigation of Trump's ties to Russia and explains why his team didn’t indict the president in 2017. Zebley is the co-author of <em>Interference

TITLE: Harris says she would support ending the filibuster to bring back Roe v. Wade
SUMMARY: Harris said that as president she would support eliminating the filibuster in the U.S. Senate to bring back federal protections for a woman's right to an abortion.

TITLE: Push for compensation for U.S. nuclear testing fallout resumes on Capitol Hill
SUMMARY: Dozens of advocates are blanketing Capitol Hill this week to continue their push for Congress to revive a program that provided compensation for people suffering long-standing impacts from US nuclear testing programs.

TITLE: Biden pledges mpox aid to Africa in his valedictory speech to the United Nations
SUMMARY: President Biden talked about the sweeping changes he has seen during his long career, urged an end to wars in Ukraine, Gaza and Sudan, and said "some things are more important than staying in power."

TITLE: Retired NFL Hall of Fame quarterback Brett Favre reveals he has Parkinson's disease
SUMMARY: Favre, 54, revealed the diagnosis while testifying before a U.S. House committee about his role in a controversy over millions of dollars of misspent welfare funds in his home state of Mississippi.

TITLE: A push for compensation for U.S. nuclear testing fallout resumes on Capitol Hill
SUMMARY: Dozens of advocates are blanketing Capitol Hill this week to  push for Congress to revive a program that provided compensation to people with long-standing impacts from U.S. nuclear testing programs.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Helene threatens the U.S., Mexico
SUMMARY: Tropical Storm Helene's trajectory threatens the Florida panhandle, which forecasters say could be hit on Thursday. Meteorologists say this system will be particularly big -- with a wide wind field.

TITLE: Justice Department accuses Visa of stifling competition in the debit card business
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has sued Visa, accusing the giant payments company of seeking to monopolize the debit card business.

TITLE: The state of Maryland sues Dali ship owner and manager over the Key Bridge collapse
SUMMARY: State leaders argue that the cargo ship was not fit to sail on March 26, and its owner, Grace Ocean Private Limited, and manager, Synergy Marine Group, failed to take precautions to prevent the crash.

TITLE: How Do Russians Really Feel About the War in Ukraine?
SUMMARY: In Russia, polls consistently show support for the war in Ukraine somewhere around 70%. But a recent independent study of Russians' opinions indicates the picture is more complex. We hear more from our correspondent in Moscow.

TITLE: Trump vows to 'steal' jobs from other countries in winding speech on economic plans
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump called for a "manufacturing renaissance" in a Savannah, Ga. speech on Tuesday, proposing measures some economists say would raise prices on Americans.

TITLE: A new poll of young voters shows Harris with a commanding 31 point lead over Trump
SUMMARY: The poll from the Harvard Kennedy School's Institute of Politics shows Harris well ahead among likely voters 18 to 29. It’s a promising sign for Harris, who is banking on high levels of youth support.

TITLE: Going once … going twice: Alex Jones’ cameras, mics, Infowars show, vitamin site
SUMMARY: A federal bankruptcy judge has ruled that a plan to sell off the assets of Jones' media company, Free Speech Systems, can move ahead. Net proceeds will go to the Sandy Hook families who Jones defamed.

TITLE: US Capitol statue of Johnny Cash depicts Arkansas' history and progress
SUMMARY: Arkansas unveiled a new statue of Johnny Cash in the U.S. Capitol. Cash, the first musician to be honored in the building, replaces a statue of a Confederate general.

TITLE: Ryan Routh is charged with attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump
SUMMARY: In addition to attempting to assassinate a presidential candidate, Routh was charged with possessing a firearm in furtherance of a violent crime and assaulting a federal officer.

TITLE: US Capitol statue of Johnny Cash depicts Arkansas's history and progress
SUMMARY: Arkansas unveiled a new statue of Johnny Cash in the U.S. Capitol. Cash, the first musician to be honored in the building, replaces a statue of a Confederate general.

TITLE: Haitian group seeks charges against Trump and Vance over false Springfield claims
SUMMARY: Charges brought by private citizens are rare, but not unheard of, in Ohio. State law requires a hearing to take place before the affidavit can move forward.

TITLE: U.S. to hand over pest inspections of Mexican avocados to Mexico
SUMMARY: Threats and violence against inspectors have caused the U.S. to suspend inspections in the past. California growers question Mexico's inspectors would be better equipped to withstand the pressure.

TITLE: Hezbollah fires missile at Tel Aviv after heavy Israeli strikes on Lebanon
SUMMARY: Hezbollah launched a ballistic missile at Tel Aviv early Wednesday, after Israel carried out strikes on Lebanon that killed hundreds of people and the militants fired rockets across northern Israel.

TITLE: Europe's intense rainfall in September twice as likely thanks to climate change
SUMMARY: Extensive early warnings and years of adaptation made the floods less deadly than they otherwise might have been.

TITLE: How a catchy tune became the soundtrack to TikTok's silliest videos
SUMMARY: The song "Monkeys Spinning Monkeys" was released ten years ago and has since become the soundtrack to millions of viral videos. Its story shows how music has shaped — and been shaped by— social media platforms.

TITLE: Harris heads to Pittsburgh (again) to make a manufacturing pitch to voters
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris is trying to win over undecided voters in key swing states like Pennsylvania. Former President Donald Trump also talked about manufacturing policy on Tuesday in Georgia.

TITLE: Missouri executes man prosecutors thought innocent. And, FAFSA’s disastrous launch
SUMMARY: Missouri executed Marcellus Williams yesterday, a man prosecutors believed was innocent. And, why FAFSA’s launch was so disastrous.

TITLE: 'Echoes of Wisdom' review: Zelda leads a worthwhile remix, not a revolution
SUMMARY: Nintendo's latest game is the first to truly star Zelda in the series that has borne her name since 1986. It boasts innovative mechanics but is still a little too linked to the past.

TITLE: Why Nevada's housing crisis is about more than Californians driving up home prices
SUMMARY: As part of NPR’s "We, The Voters" series — we went to Nevada to talk to residents about their housing situation, the state’s affordable housing crisis and what factors are driving it.

TITLE: The nation's first Black country club gets more than love in its coffers
SUMMARY: Shady Rest Country Club in Scotch Plains, N.J., was established in 1921. The sports and entertainment venue is being renovated, with help from a special historic preservation program.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Helene is forecast to become a major hurricane as it nears Florida
SUMMARY: Helene is forecast to intensify rapidly over the Gulf of Mexico before making landfall in Florida on Thursday. Residents are urged to make preparations — and in many counties, evacuate — before then.

TITLE: Iran remains on the sidelines as the Israel-Hezbollah fight intensifies
SUMMARY: As the battle between Israel and Hezbollah intensifies, western nations aim to prevent the conflict from spiraling into a broader regional war –- one that could draw in Iran, Hezbollah’s key backer.

TITLE: Here's who's on ballots in the 7 states likely to decide the presidential election
SUMMARY: With the presidential election considered a toss up, the votes that third-party and independent candidates receive in key states could decide the White House. Here's who's on those state ballots.

TITLE: Zelda review: 'Echoes of Wisdom' is a worthwhile remix, not a revolution
SUMMARY: Nintendo's latest game is the first to truly star Zelda in the series that has borne her name since 1986. It boasts innovative mechanics but is still a little too linked to the past.

TITLE: Helene reaches hurricane strength with no signs of slowing as it approaches Florida
SUMMARY: Helene is forecast to intensify rapidly over the Gulf of Mexico before making landfall in Florida on Thursday. Residents are urged to make preparations — and in many counties, evacuate — before then.

TITLE: The slowest of trailblazers: Better DNA testing means trafficked turtles can go home
SUMMARY: New technology is making it easier to find the origins of trafficked wildlife so they can be released back to the habitat they came from, instead of languishing for decades as sometimes happens.

TITLE: Nursing aides plagued by PTSD after ‘nightmare’ COVID conditions, with little help
SUMMARY: Nursing aides feel abandoned as they grapple with mental and physical troubles that stem from their work during the COVID outbreak.

TITLE: The son of Trump's alleged would-be assassin is charged over child sex abuse images
SUMMARY: Oran Routh, 35, was arrested after the FBI searched his home in connection with another investigation. He's been charged with one count each of receipt and possession of images of child sex abuse.

TITLE: Sudanese refugees fled to Chad with hope. What they found is a bitter irony
SUMMARY: It is the world's largest displacement crisis: 13 million people have fled their homes in war-torn Sudan. In neighboring Chad, both refugees and locals cope with this extraordinary upheaval.

TITLE: California’s first plastic bag ban made things worse. Now it’s trying again
SUMMARY: California and other states -- and some cities -- have learned a lesson: Bans on plastic bags don’t always go as planned. In fact, California's original ban made things worse.

TITLE: In the occupied West Bank, Palestinians struggle to access water
SUMMARY: For Palestinians in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, access to water has been a struggle for years. But since last Oct. 7, water has become even harder for them to obtain.

TITLE: Some don't evacuate despite repeated hurricane warnings — because they can't
SUMMARY: People with disabilities, people who can't afford it and people who don't want to abandon their pets are among the many who can't easily get up and leave before a hurricane.

TITLE: Trying to stay safe in a wildfire? There's an app that can help
SUMMARY: Watch Duty, a free app for tracking wildfires, has taken off in the Western U.S. as more of the region experiences destructive wildfires and the overwhelming task of staying informed.

TITLE: House approves funding bill to avoid government shutdown
SUMMARY: The House of Representatives approved legislation funding federal agencies through December 20. The vote comes days ahead of a September 30 deadline to avoid a shutdown.

TITLE: Three years after the U.S. withdrawal, former Afghan forces are hunted by the Taliban
SUMMARY: The Taliban have been targeting thousands of Afghan National Army soldiers and police officers, accusing them of being American spies.

TITLE: What the U.S. Military is Learning from the Drone War in Ukraine
SUMMARY: As the war in Ukraine drags on, the U.S. military is keeping a close eye on how drones are changing the conflict. They are used by both Russia and Ukraine to watch troop movements, identify targets and drop bombs. We go to the woods of Louisiana to see what lessons the U.S. Army is incorporating into its training and understand what it might mean for future wars.

TITLE: Congress approves funding bill to avoid government shutdown
SUMMARY: The House and Senate both overwhelmingly approved legislation funding federal agencies through December 20.

TITLE: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been indicted, sources say
SUMMARY: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been indicted by a grand jury on federal criminal charges. The indictment detailing the charges against Adams, a Democrat, was still sealed late Wednesday.

TITLE: U.S. and allies call for an immediate 21-day cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah
SUMMARY: The U.S., France and other allies jointly called Wednesday for an immediate 21-day cease-fire to allow for negotiations in the escalating conflict between Israel and Hezbollah.

TITLE: A zoo in Finland is returning pandas to China because they're too expensive to keep
SUMMARY: The zoo has agreed with Chinese authorities to return two giant pandas to China more than eight years ahead of schedule because they have become too expensive to maintain amid declining visitors.

TITLE: A History of Hezbollah (Throwback)
SUMMARY: Hezbollah is a Lebanese paramilitary organization and political party that's directly supported by the Islamic Republic of Iran. In the wake of the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel, and Israel's invasion of Gaza, there have been escalating attacks between Hezbollah and Israel across the border they share.

TITLE: Japanese court acquits a man in a 1966 murder retrial after decades on death row
SUMMARY: A court ruled Thursday that an 88-year-old former boxer was not guilty in a retrial for a 1966 quadruple murder. He spent 48 years behind bars, making him the world's longest-serving death row inmate.

TITLE: How Russia’s RT went from a cable news clone to covert operator
SUMMARY: RT was long known to be a source of Russian propaganda. But a recent indictment of two employees for covertly funneling $10 million to pro-Trump influencers shines a light on its covert activities.

TITLE: Politicians often link crime and homelessness. The reality is more complex
SUMMARY: As the homelessness crisis grows, it’s common for the public and politicians to conflate homeless encampments and criminal activity. But how much do these camps really affect crime in cities?

TITLE: NYC Mayor indicted. And, Hurricane Helene expected to be catastrophic
SUMMARY: NYC Mayor Eric Adams has been indicted on federal charges after a corruption probe into his administration. And, Hurricane Helene is projected to reach a catastrophic Category 4.

TITLE: 'Governor, don’t kill me for the heck of it': Oklahoma prisoner asks for clemency
SUMMARY: Oklahoma’s governor waited until the day of Emmanuel Littlejohn’s execution to announce whether he would grant the prisoner clemency. Littlejohn spoke to NPR.

TITLE: More trans teens attempted suicide after states passed anti-trans laws, a study shows
SUMMARY: Researchers with the Trevor Project analyzed data from 61,000 transgender and nonbinary young people. They found that after states passed anti-LGBTQ+ laws, young people in those states were more like to attempt suicide.

TITLE: An intensifying Helene approaches Florida as southeastern states brace for impact
SUMMARY: Helene strengthened into a Category 2 hurricane as it nears northwest Florida, where it is poised to make landfall late Thursday. It's forecast to bring heavy wind and rain hundreds of miles inland.

TITLE: How to follow the latest local updates on Hurricane Helene
SUMMARY: Hurricane Helene continues to strengthen as it approaches the Florida coast. Member stations across the NPR network are covering the local impact as Helene barrels through the southeast U.S.

TITLE: Read the indictment: NYC Mayor Eric Adams charged with bribery, fraud, foreign donations
SUMMARY: In an extraordinary operation, federal agents descended upon the mayor’s home early Thursday morning.

TITLE: Forecasters warn of 'unsurvivable' storm surge as Helene races toward Florida
SUMMARY: Helene is poised to make landfall on Florida's Big Bend late Thursday. Forecasters warn that the unusually large storm will bring heavy rain and wind as far inland as the Appalachians and Atlanta.

TITLE: Could 'uncommitted' voters sway the election?
SUMMARY: <em>New Yorker

TITLE: 3D mammograms show benefits over 2D imaging, especially for dense breasts
SUMMARY: A new study shows 3D imaging found potentially serious cancers earlier and reduced the need for callback for further screening.

TITLE: “Governor, don’t kill me for the heck of it”: Oklahoma prisoner asks for clemency
SUMMARY: Oklahoma’s governor waited until the day of Emmanuel Littlejohn’s execution to announce whether he would grant the prisoner clemency. Littlejohn spoke to NPR.

TITLE: DOJ watchdog: federal prison not doing enough to prevent inmate suicides
SUMMARY: Lewisburg federal prison, a facility located in central Pennsylvania where thousands of inmates often pass through on their way to other federal institutions, was found to have problems with addressing mental health risks, healthcare quality, leaking infrastructure and employee conduct.

TITLE: Louisiana Rep. Clay Higgins walks back racist comments about Haitians after backlash
SUMMARY: The Republican congressman has been criticized for amplifying false claims about Haitian immigrants. "You never want to intentionally hurt someone’s feelings," he apologized in part on Thursday.

TITLE: Hurricane Helene is upgraded to a 'dangerous' Category 3 storm as it nears Florida
SUMMARY: Helene is poised to make landfall on Florida's Big Bend late Thursday. Forecasters warn that the unusually large storm will bring heavy rain and wind as far inland as the Appalachians and Atlanta.

TITLE: Over 90,000 people in Lebanon had to flee Israel's bombardments this week
SUMMARY: With Israel and Hezbollah locked in the fiercest fighting in decades, many Lebanese have taken refuge in schools, hotels and other shelters.

TITLE: Jordan's Unique Position in a Region at War
SUMMARY: The war between Israel and Hamas in Gaza approaches the one year mark. Violence between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon continues to escalate. And there are fears that Iran will get deeply involved with these conflicts. In a volatile moment in the region, Jordan balances a unique set of relationships with all these countries. We hear from Ayman Safadi, who is Jordan's Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister, about what he thinks it will take to end the conflicts.

TITLE: The FDA is expected to approve a new type of schizophrenia drug
SUMMARY: The Food and Drug Administration is expected to approve KarXT, the first new type of drug for schizophrenia in decades. It appears to be effective, but its main advantage is milder side effects.

TITLE: Voting-tech company settles with right-wing network over false election claims
SUMMARY: Smartmatic sued Newsmax for defamation over false claims related to the 2020 presidential election. The trial was supposed to begin next week.

TITLE: The FDA approves a new type of schizophrenia drug
SUMMARY: The Food and Drug Administration, as expected, approved KarXT, the first new type of drug for schizophrenia in decades. It appears to be effective, but its main advantage is milder side effects.

TITLE: The Pentagon says it wants to prevent Iran from spreading the conflict in the Middle East
SUMMARY: After Israel killed Hezbollah's leader, the U.S. says it wants to stop Iran from "exploiting the situation or expanding the conflict."

TITLE: IDF prepares to invade southern Lebanon as 2 more Hezbollah leaders are presumed dead
SUMMARY: At least 11 people were killed in the latest Israeli airstrikes, according to Lebanon’s National News Agency. The Israeli military, meanwhile, says it’s preparing for a ground invasion into southern Lebanon.

TITLE: Should you vote your feelings? A traveling play helps audiences think that through
SUMMARY: An acclaimed Edinburgh Fringe show encourages the audience to think about why they're voting the way they do.

TITLE: Getting the COVID vaccine during pregnancy protects newborns from hospitalization
SUMMARY: Babies under six months can't be vaccinated directly against COVID. A new study found that most infants hospitalized for COVID had mothers who didn’t get the vaccine while they were pregnant.

TITLE: Why the U.S. government is hailing Israel's killing of Hezbollah's leader as 'justice'
SUMMARY: Hezbollah’s leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed by Israeli airstrike this weekend. The Biden administration said it gives the victims of the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group "a measure of justice."

TITLE: If you want to stress less, join NPR's quest to reclaim your calm
SUMMARY: Life can be stressful, and how you manage it is key. We have science-backed tips to help you cope. Get five weekly newsletters and a master class in stress management: Join us.

TITLE: Hezbollah leader's killing sparks joy and rage across the Middle East
SUMMARY: President Biden called the killing of Hassan Nasrallah "a measure of justice for his many victims," while Iran's supreme leader condemned what he called an Israeli massacre in Lebanon.

TITLE: 'It was like a circus': What Terry Crews learned from his NFL career
SUMMARY: Terry Crews went to college on an art scholarship, played football in the NFL and now stars in movies and hosts <em>America's Got Talent

TITLE: Death toll in Nepal flooding reaches at least 100, dozens still missing
SUMMARY: Dozens were still reported missing as landslides continued across the mountainous country.

TITLE: Longtime Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah killed by Israel
Along Florida's Gulf Coast, residents are reeling from the effects of Hurricane Helene
SUMMARY: The scope of the damage Hurricane Helena caused is still not totally clear.

TITLE: California Gov. Newsom vetoes AI bill, considered strictest in nation
SUMMARY: The measure, known as SB 1047, was one of the nation’s most far-reaching regulations on the booming AI industry. It would have held AI companies legally liable and enabled a "kill switch" if systems went rogue.

TITLE: From pager blasts to Nasrallah’s killing: 12 days that transformed a bloody conflict
SUMMARY: NPR steps back and takes a closer look at the days leading up to the killing of Hezbollah's leader. Experts say this development has transformed an already complex and deadly conflict.

TITLE: The death toll rises as rescue crews respond to Hurricane Helene's devastation
SUMMARY: Power was out for more than 2 million customers across the Southeast and southern Appalachia on Sunday. Residents in hard-hit western North Carolina and Georgia faced water outages.

TITLE: California Gov. Newsom vetoes AI safety bill that divided Silicon Valley
SUMMARY: The measure, known as SB 1047, was one of the nation’s most far-reaching regulations on the booming AI industry. It would have held AI companies legally liable for harms caused by AI and enabled a "kill switch" if systems went rogue.

TITLE: Austrian far-right party wins national vote but its chances of governing are unclear
SUMMARY: The Freedom Party on Sunday secured the first far-right national parliamentary election victory in post-World War II Austria. But political rivals have said they won’t work with the party's leader.

TITLE: Flooding deaths in Nepal approach 200 as recovery work is stepped up
SUMMARY: The number of people killed by flooding and landslides triggered by heavy rainfall over the weekend in Nepal has reached 193, while 31 people were still reported missing.

TITLE: To combat misinformation, start with connection, not correction
SUMMARY: People trust information more when it comes from sources or contexts they’re familiar with. Help counter misinformation in your community by having conversations with your friends and family.

TITLE: An airstrike hits a Beirut residential building as Israel expands attacks in Lebanon
SUMMARY: The first apparent Israeli airstrike on central Beirut in nearly a year of conflict leveled an apartment building early Monday. It came after Israel hit targets across Lebanon and killed dozens of people.

TITLE: Vance and Walz debate in New York City on Tuesday. Here’s what you need to know
SUMMARY: The CBS News vice presidential debate will be the only time Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz get to face off ahead of the 2024 election. Here's what to expect.

TITLE: What Tim Walz's past debate performances reveal about how he may take on JD Vance
SUMMARY: Those who’ve debated Walz before say he has a down-to-earth style that is relatable to voters — but it's an approach that can also cause problems for the Democratic vice presidential nominee.

TITLE: Stressed out? These 8 skills can help boost mood and reduce anxiety
SUMMARY: Life is stressful. Whether it’s work or relationship issues or you’re worrying about politics or global conflict, it can be overwhelming. NPR’s Stress Less: A quest to reclaim your calm aims to help.

TITLE: 3 women from different backgrounds detail why they're voting for Harris
SUMMARY: Is Georgia ready to cast its 16 electoral votes for a woman for president? We put that question to three women who have lived through a few election cycles in the state.

TITLE: 'The Power Broker' at 50 — and what author Robert Caro is still uncovering
SUMMARY: Talking to historian and author Robert Caro is like stepping into a time machine, as NPR discovered on a visit to his New York office recently.

TITLE: Maryland seemed poised this year to legalize medical aid in dying. What happened?
SUMMARY: Most Americans support allowing some terminally ill patients to end their own lives. But a Maryland bill’s narrow defeat shows the issue is still religiously fraught and politically delicate.

TITLE: Helene death toll rises to over 90 as millions remain without power
SUMMARY: At least 91 people across several states were killed. Officials warned that rebuilding from the widespread loss of homes and property would be lengthy and difficult.

TITLE: An NPR investigation: A murder in Hebron
SUMMARY: Was the murder of a young Palestinian man in the West Bank an anti-gay hate crime? NPR identifies the accused killer and explores the parallel systems of justice that have yet to resolve this case.

TITLE: Amazon India workers say they're overworked and mistreated during a brutal heat wave
SUMMARY: Amazon India says it ensures breaks and worker safety, but workers tell NPR they're pressured not to stop for water or to use the toilet, especially while processing same-day orders.

TITLE: Historic flooding strands hundreds in North Carolina. And, Hezbollah leader mourned
SUMMARY: Tropical storm Helene has left western North Carolina with catastrophic damage from historic flooding to a loss of power for thousands. And, Lebanon mourning the loss of Hezbollah leader.

TITLE: Trump turns to darker rhetoric as voting begins
SUMMARY: In a pair of weekend events in key swing states, Trump claimed Harris is "mentally disabled" and went on to suggest police violence could curb crime.

TITLE: Israel conducts intel raids in southern Lebanon ahead of a possible ground invasion
SUMMARY: Israeli commandos are conducting limited intelligence-gathering raids inside southern Lebanon, and that there are indications that Israel will be carrying out a limited ground incursion.

TITLE: San Francisco ramps up policing of homeless camps, with the Supreme Court's blessing
SUMMARY: There are fewer tents on San Francisco sidewalks. The city has ramped up enforcement of anti-camping laws, and police are playing a bigger role.

TITLE: Ryan Routh pleads not guilty to attempting to assassinate former President Donald Trump
SUMMARY: Shackled and dressed in khaki prison garb at a hearing in West Palm Beach, Fla., Routh also requested a jury trial. He faces four other charges, such as possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.

TITLE: Israel conducts raids in southern Lebanon ahead of a larger possible ground invasion
SUMMARY: Israeli commandos are currently conducting a raid inside southern Lebanon, and there are indications that Israel may send more forces into the area, a senior U.S. official told NPR.

TITLE: Helene death toll rises to 120 as millions remain without power
SUMMARY: At least 120 people across several states are reported dead. Officials warned that rebuilding from the widespread loss of homes and property would be lengthy and difficult.

TITLE: A tiny town just got slammed by Helene. It could massively disrupt the tech industry
SUMMARY: Spruce Pine is a major global supplier of high-purity quartz. It’s an essential ingredient for microchips and solar panels.

TITLE: Why the most climate-resistant glaciers are hiding in plain sight
SUMMARY: In the American West, white glaciers and snow fields are outnumbered by long-overlooked “rock glaciers.” The rock covering these vast hunks of ice makes them far less affected by warming temperatures.

TITLE: FAQ: Your house flooded. Now what?
SUMMARY: Experts say the first thing is to make sure it’s safe to go back inside. Then you need to dry things out as fast as possible.

TITLE: Two major student loan grace periods are set to expire this week. Here's what to know
SUMMARY: Two federal programs that helped federal student loan borrowers ease back into payments are ending. It will have the biggest impact on borrowers with defaulted loans or borrowers who miss payments moving forward.

TITLE: Harris talks about marijuana and racial identity in 'All the Smoke' interview
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris made her comments during a wide-ranging conversation with former NBA stars Stephen Jackson and Matt Barnes for their podcast <em>All the Smoke

TITLE: Israel conducts ground raids in southern Lebanon ahead of a larger possible invasion
SUMMARY: Israeli commandos are currently conducting a raid inside southern Lebanon, and there are indications that Israel may send more forces into the area, a senior U.S. official told NPR.

TITLE: 'America's Nobel' goes to a power couple who made a startling discovery about HIV
SUMMARY: This year's Lasker Prize for public service goes to South African researchers Salim and Quarraisha Abdool-Karim. The married couple made a startling discovery about HIV — and did something about it.

TITLE: Israel Widens Its Airstrikes in Lebanon, How Will Iran Respond?
SUMMARY:
Israel began a series of attacks against the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah with pagers and walkie talkies that exploded. They then launched airstrikes targeting the group's leadership. One strike killed Hezbollah's leader of over thirty years, Hassan Nasrallah. The attacks are an effort to prevent Hezbollah from continuing to fire rockets at northern Israel, which it has been doing since the war in Gaza began. Israel's airstrikes are continuing to widen and their military is massing at the border, pointing to a possible ground invasion.

We'll hear from our correspondent in Beirut about the feeling on the ground there. We also hear about whether and how Iran might respond. Iran had been arming Hezbollah to counter Israel, and the weakening of the group is a blow to an important proxy of Iran's.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

TITLE: Israel launches a 'limited' ground offensive in southern Lebanon
SUMMARY: The Israeli military has launched what it called a "limited, localized" ground offensive in southern Lebanon against the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group Hezbollah.

TITLE: Dockworkers go on strike, snarling traffic at East and Gulf Coast ports
SUMMARY: Union dockworkers at ports across the U.S. began walking picket lines early Tuesday, snarling the movement of billions of dollars' worth of goods.

TITLE: Dikembe Mutombo, a Hall of Fame player and tireless advocate, dies at 58
SUMMARY: Mutombo spent his retirement on humanitarian causes. He spoke nine languages and founded the Dikembe Mutombo Foundation, concentrating on improving the quality of life for people in the Congo.

TITLE: Claudia Sheinbaum to be sworn in as the 1st female president of Mexico
SUMMARY: The 62-year-old scientist turned politician campaigned on a promise to protect an expanded social safety net and fight for the poor like her predecessor, but she faces many pressing problems.

TITLE: Japan’s parliament elects Shigeru Ishiba as prime minister
SUMMARY: Ishiba, who chosen as the ruling Liberal Democratic Party's new leader on Friday, replaces Fumio Kishida who stepped down after his government was dogged by multiple scandals.

TITLE: Justice Department No. 3 official pledges to fight hate crimes, fueled by personal story
SUMMARY: The Justice Department's third-in-command talked about the department's pledge to fight hate crimes, and shared he was close in age to Matthew Shepard, whose death inspired a federal law helping to prosecute people fueled by hate.

TITLE: Photos: As Jimmy Carter celebrates his 100th birthday, a look through the decades
SUMMARY: Former President Jimmy Carter is turning 100. Here are images from notable events or parts of his life, both during his presidency and after.

TITLE: When she called a hotline to report abuse, the voice on the other end offered hope
SUMMARY: Nora Durkin called a hotline to report abuse she says she experienced as a child. The woman who answered gave her the validation she had needed for years.

TITLE: How young Republicans and Democrats are whipping up votes in key districts
SUMMARY: As the presidential race ramps up in Georgia, one vital voting demographic is mobilizing and hoping to impact the race: young people.

TITLE: Poll workers can be hard to find. In Nebraska, election officials can draft them
SUMMARY: Nebraska has a unique solution to staffing elections: It allows counties to draft workers. Omaha's Douglas County is the only one to regularly use it. Here’s how the jury duty-like system works.

TITLE: The pipeline of deadly fentanyl into the U.S. may be drying up, experts say
SUMMARY: Street fentanyl has long been viewed as unstoppable. Now many experts say the supply of the deadly synthetic opioid is suddenly drying up in many parts of the U.S. and fatal overdoses are dropping.

TITLE: JD Vance’s time on the trail has often been overshadowed by self-made controversy
SUMMARY: Republican Ohio Sen. JD Vance is prolific on the campaign trail with speeches and talking to reporters, but his messaging has at times been overshadowed by controversy often of his own making.

TITLE: Tim Walz’s state became a ‘trans refuge.’ Here’s what that means and how it happened
SUMMARY: As states around it were passing bathroom bills and trans health care bans, Minnesota, under Gov. Tim Walz, went in the other direction, protecting transgender rights.

TITLE: 5 things to know about Mexico's first female president
SUMMARY: Claudia Sheinbaum is a 62-year old environmental scientist who left academia on a political trajectory that took her from a local mayor, to running Mexico City, to winning the presidency with nearly 60 percent of the vote.

TITLE: Israel begins ground offensive in Lebanon
SUMMARY: The Israeli military pressed its ground incursion into southern Lebanon on Tuesday, calling the operations “limited incursions” that are targeting Hezbollah militants.

TITLE: Vance and Walz are both veterans. Here's what it means to have a vet VP
SUMMARY: For the first time since 1996, both major parties have picked a veteran for vice president -- a fact that some veterans' groups are hoping it leads to greater understanding of military and vet issues.

TITLE: What to know about tonight's VP debate. And, a guide to discussing misinformation
SUMMARY: JD Vance and Tim Walz will have their first vice presidential debate tonight as both parties aim to win over swing state voters. And, Israel invades Lebanon for the first time since 2006.

TITLE: In Nevada, Latinos could pick the next president. They aren't sold on either candidate
SUMMARY: In Nevada, 1 in 5 potential voters are Latino. That is a voting bloc with a lot of political power in a state where elections are won by a few percentage points. And campaigns are paying attention.

TITLE: When she called a hotline to report abuse, the voice on the other end offered hope
SUMMARY: Nora Durkin called a hotline to report abuse she says she experienced as a child. The woman who answered gave her the validation she had needed for years.

SUMMARY: Lebanese Prime Minister Najib Mikati said his country was facing “one of the most dangerous phases of its history” amid Israel’s ground incursion into southern Lebanon, which began late Monday.

SUMMARY: Shailaja Paik faced prejudice because of her family's Dalit caste and her gender. As a historian she's written ground-breaking books on India's Dalits and is now a MacArthur 'genius grant' awardee.

SUMMARY: This year, filmmaker Sterlin Harjo, poet Jericho Brown and disability rights activist Alice Wong are among the recipients of the so-called "genius grants." Each fellow receives $800,000.

SUMMARY: Colin Kaepernick and Nessa Diab wrote a new children’s book inspired by affirmations they share with their daughter and scores of young people they meet through their activism.

SUMMARY: In his first nonfiction book in a decade, Coates reflects on what he learned while visiting three different places: Senegal, South Carolina and the Israeli-occupied West Bank.

TITLE: Jeep recalls 194,000 plug-in hybrid SUVs over fire risk
SUMMARY: Jeep is recalling more than 194,000 plug-in hybrid SUVs because they can catch fire with the ignition turned off. The automaker says the risk of fire is reduced when the battery charge is depleted.

SUMMARY: The Iranian attack comes in the wake of an Israeli ground incursion against the Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah in southern Lebanon.

Iran launched long-range missiles against Israel, just hours after Israeli forces launched a ground offensive into southern Lebanon against Iran's main proxy, Hezbollah. TITLE: Jury in Memphis convicts ex-officers on some charges in beating death of Tyre Nichols

SUMMARY: Devastation left by Hurricane Helene. Escalated tensions in the Middle East. The Harris campaign is navigating a pair of October surprises as Election Day draws closer.

TITLE: Why did Tim Walz call himself a 'knucklehead' this week? Find out in the quiz
SUMMARY: They debated, they wrote memoirs, they got inaugurated, they turned 100. What else did political people do? Plus: wildlife's gonna wildlife

TITLE: At 110 years old, an Alabama woman credits one thing for her long life: faith
SUMMARY: Lillie Cunningham recently celebrated her 110th birthday. She has lived through two pandemics and two world wars and is looking forward to voting in November's presidential election.

TITLE: ARIZONA SCHOOLS AT STAKE
SUMMARY: The November election in Arizona could determine whether a rapidly expanding school voucher program is reined in by the Legislature. That's the goal Democrats have -- if they can get a majority.

TITLE: Dockworkers suspend strike. And, Tyre Nichols' family applauds trial verdict
SUMMARY: Dockworkers suspended their strike yesterday, avoiding an "economic crisis," but a sticking point remains in negotiations. And, Tyre Nichols trial verdict brings hope for police brutality cases.

TITLE: A dad and his 2 teenage sons loved heavy metal so much they started a band: Narbona
SUMMARY: In 2015 Stewart Billie moved his family from the city back to tribal land in the Navajo Nation. Billie’s sons found the lack of noise unnerving until their dad replaced the quiet with heavy metal.

TITLE: School vouchers are one example of the stakes in legislative elections
SUMMARY: The November election in Arizona could determine whether a rapidly expanding school voucher program is reined in by the Legislature. That's the goal Democrats have -- if they can get a majority.

TITLE: Satellite images show dozens of Iranian missiles struck near Israeli Air Base
SUMMARY: Around 30 missiles appear to have landed around Nevatim Air Base in Southern Israel, although damage was limited.

TITLE: 'New American voters have the power to sway the outcome' in Pennsylvania and beyond
SUMMARY: With one in 10 potential voters being a naturalized citizen, the group has enormous political power, especially in key swing states like Pennsylvania, where nearly 80% of those Americans plan to vote.

TITLE: I went on a real life treasure hunt. This is what I discovered
SUMMARY: A golden trophy and pot of prize money worth more than $100,000 was hidden in a forest recently. So of course I joined in the hunt.

TITLE: The U.S. saw stunningly strong growth in jobs last month. Here's what to know
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added more than a quarter million jobs in September, while the unemployment rate fell to 4.1%.  Here's what to know about the data.

TITLE: In swing-state Wisconsin, new districts threaten the GOP hold on the Legislature
SUMMARY: Wisconsin has long been a presidential swing state, but thanks to new maps, it's now also a potential swing state for the legislature for the first time in 15 years.

TITLE: Harris is meeting with a group of Arab Americans in Michigan today
SUMMARY: Arab Americans have been frustrated with the Biden administration’s response to the ongoing war in Gaza and the expanding conflict into Lebanon.

TITLE: The scale of Helene’s devastating impacts are eye-popping, even from space
SUMMARY: Many of Helene’s effects are individual and heartbreaking, such as the deaths of children, grandparents and others. But the storm's impact is also so outsized that it’s clearly visible from space.

TITLE: Storm damage closes N.C. factory that makes vital hospital supplies
SUMMARY: Remnants of Hurricane Helene shut down a North Carolina factory that supplies critical IV fluids to hospitals across the country. There's no timeline for when production will resume at the facility.

TITLE: Satellite images show dozens of Iranian missiles struck near Israeli air base
SUMMARY: Around 30 missiles appear to have landed around Nevatim Airbase in southern Israel, although damage was limited.

TITLE: New American voters have the political power to affect the election in swing states
SUMMARY: With one in 10 potential voters being a naturalized citizen, the group has enormous political power, especially in key swing states like Pennsylvania, where nearly 80% of those Americans plan to vote.

TITLE: Biden says he is worried about violence around the presidential election
SUMMARY: President Biden told reporters he was confident the election “will be free and fair,” before saying, “I don’t know whether it will be peaceful.”

TITLE: What about Grandmas? Global thinkers assess the U.N. 'Summit of the Future'
SUMMARY: The U.N. has adopted a lengthy "pact" of items for the world to address for a better tomorrow. We asked global thinkers if they'd like to add anything or give more emphasis to certain agenda items.

TITLE: Supreme Court refuses, for now, to block new EPA rules to fight climate change
SUMMARY: The justices, in a break from the way they have handled most such cases in the recent past, told the challengers to first litigate their claims in the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia.

TITLE: ‘Touch grass,’ ‘For You page’: See 200 new words and phrases added to Merriam-Webster
