SUMMARY: “Our lexicographers monitor a huge range of sources to select which words and definitions to add,” Merriam-Webster's Peter Sokolowski said. These sources range from academic journals to social media.

TITLE: On the trail in Michigan, Harris hears concerns about Gaza and Lebanon
SUMMARY: Arab Americans and Muslims have been frustrated with the Biden administration’s response to the ongoing war in Gaza and the expanding conflict into Lebanon.

TITLE: A victim of a crypto ‘pig butchering’ scam just got his $140,000 back
SUMMARY: NPR investigated a crypto scam company known as SpireBit, which stole hundreds of thousands of dollars from Russian-speaking seniors. Now, some of the victims are getting their money back after a lawsuit by Massachusetts authorities.

TITLE: In Michigan, Harris hits back against Trump over his electric car attack lines
SUMMARY: The Trump campaign is telling Michigan that Vice President Harris would ban gas-powered cars. At a rally in Flint, she pushed back – and said Trump would be bad for the state’s best-known industry.

TITLE: Biden says small business disaster loan program will soon run out of money
SUMMARY: President Biden says Congress needs to shore up a small business disaster loans fund, and fast. Meanwhile, the response to Hurricane Helene has become a presidential election issue.

TITLE: October 7th: A Year of War Through the Eyes of Those Who Lived It
SUMMARY:
The October 7th Hamas-led attacks on Israel and the subsequent Israeli invasion of Gaza has changed the course of geopolitics and will have far reaching consequences for the world. The events have also upended the lives of countless individuals. Our team of reporters in the region bring us stories of lives changed in Israel, Gaza and the West Bank.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists around the world. Visit plus.npr.org

TITLE: Trump is returning to Butler, the site of the 1st assassination attempt against him
SUMMARY: The rally will mark Trump's first time back in the Pennsylvania city since the failed assassination attempt against him in July. The guest list will include a shooting survivor, as well as Elon Musk.

TITLE: Three states show how abortion, schools and taxes are at stake in legislature races
SUMMARY: New legislatures could overhaul school vouchers in Arizona, give the Democratic governor more clout in Kansas, and counter a progressive trend in Minnesota.

TITLE: A coal power plant demolition serves as a poignant historical moment for the Navajo
SUMMARY: For six decades, coal has provided for — and polluted — the Navajo Nation. Demolition of a power plant brings mixed emotions.

TITLE: As Oct. 7 approaches, synagogues and mosques bolster security
SUMMARY: Mosques and synagogues in the U.S. are bolstering security ahead of Oct. 7, the one-year mark of the Hamas-led attack in Israel.

TITLE: A controversial but effective treatment for meth addiction gains ground
SUMMARY: Policymakers in California embrace a proven but unorthodox treatment for meth and cocaine addiction: Give people gift cards to stay off the drugs.

TITLE: The Menendez brothers' murder case is getting a fresh look. Here's why
SUMMARY: In 1996, Erik and Lyle Menendez were convicted and sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole. Los Angeles prosecutors said this week they are taking another look at the case.

TITLE: Can someone find out who you voted for? No. Here is what you should know
SUMMARY: As Election Day approaches, many Americans are questioning the secrecy of their ballots. We explain what you should know about privacy and casting a ballot.

TITLE: Why Massachusetts loves Nibi the beaver and is fighting to keep her out of the wild
SUMMARY: For the past several weeks, the beloved beaver has been embroiled in a court battle over whether she should return to the wild or stay at the rescue center where she has lived since she was a newborn.

TITLE: Opinion: Political texts are pinging off the rails
SUMMARY: NPR's Scott Simon wishes we could text them back when politicians message us asking for campaign donations.

TITLE: The historic Biltmore Estate, an Asheville icon, works to recover from Helene damage
SUMMARY: The renowned North Carolina landmark and tourist attraction was slammed by the remnants of Hurricane Helene. The estate says parts of the entrance and farm were damaged and some animals were lost.

TITLE: Stunning photos of a vast e-waste dumping ground — and those who make a living off it
SUMMARY: Three photojournalists have created an in-depth report on electronic waste — its negative and ... positive ... consequences.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Milton approaches Florida peninsula, likely to become a hurricane
SUMMARY: A new storm is approaching the west coast of the Florida Peninsula, threatening to inflict heavy rain, strong winds and flash flooding in the already-storm battered state.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Milton approaches Florida, likely to become a hurricane
SUMMARY: A new storm is approaching the west coast of the Florida, threatening to inflict heavy rain, strong winds and flash flooding in the already-storm battered state.

TITLE: Trump returns to rally crowd in Butler, Pa., site of July assassination attempt
SUMMARY: The former President spoke at a campaign rally in the same location that a bullet grazed his ear in July. The shooter killed a man and injured two other people.

TITLE: Israel expands its bombardment in Lebanon as thousands flee widening war
SUMMARY: Powerful new explosions rocked Beirut's southern suburbs late Saturday as Israel expanded its bombardment in Lebanon, also striking a Palestinian refugee camp deep in the north for the first time.

TITLE: In Queens, N.Y., an immigrant street vendor is forced to confront crippling shyness
SUMMARY: New York is known for its street food vendors. NPR spent time with a recently arrived migrant who is hitting the streets to sell for the first time, but has to overcome a huge hurdle: his shyness.

TITLE: 'I’m so grateful to these people.' Latino workers in storm-hit Tennessee feel isolated but hopeful
SUMMARY: There are barriers preventing many Latino farm workers in northeastern Tennessee from trying to get help, but the extended Latino community is bringing the help to them.

TITLE: Margaret Atwood was advised to just find a good man. Her response: 'You're an idiot'
SUMMARY: Margaret Atwood knows that she scares people. She opens up about that perception and also reflects on the bad advice she's received in her career and how she takes vengeance.

TITLE: A strike on a mosque kills 19 as Israel bombards northern Gaza and southern Beirut
SUMMARY: An Israeli airstrike hit a mosque in central Gaza early Sunday. Israeli planes also lit up the skyline across the southern suburbs of Beirut, striking what the military said were Hezbollah targets.

TITLE: Pope names 21 new cardinals, increasing pool who will one day elect his successor
SUMMARY: Pope Francis named 21 new cardinals Sunday, significantly increasing the size of the College of Cardinals who will one day elect his successor.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Milton is expected to make landfall as major hurricane in Florida
SUMMARY: Florida officials prepare for the largest storm evacuation in years, as most counties are issued a state of emergency.

TITLE: Milton intensifies into a hurricane a day early, racing toward Florida
SUMMARY: Florida officials are preparing for the largest storm evacuation in years, as most counties are issued a state of emergency. Milton was about 800 miles off of Florida's west coast on Sunday afternoon.

TITLE: Israeli strike on Gaza mosque kills 19 as conflict widens in Lebanon
SUMMARY: As the expanding Mideast war nears a one-year milestone, Israel launched targeted strikes in Lebanon overnight, where the conflict pushed further north.

TITLE: Hurricane Milton projected to reach category 4 strength before landfall in Florida
SUMMARY: Hurricane Milton is expected to reach maximum wind speeds of 145 miles per hour. The National Hurricane Center urges Florida residents to complete storm preparations and seek safety before Wednesday.

TITLE: Where Gaza protest voters stand ahead of Election Day
Hurricane Milton projected to reach Category 4 strength before landfall in Florida
SUMMARY: Hurricane Milton is expected to reach maximum wind speeds of 145 miles per hour. The National Hurricane Center urged Florida residents to complete storm preparations and seek safety before Wednesday.

TITLE: LeBron and Bronny James play together for first time in preseason game for the Lakers
SUMMARY: LeBron James and his son, Bronny, are the first father and son to play in any NBA game at the same time, let alone on the same team.

TITLE: Trump's plan would add $4 trillion more to U.S. debt compared to Harris', analysis says
SUMMARY: Neither former President Donald Trump nor Vice President Harris have plans to fix the national debt, risking "an eventual fiscal crisis," a budget nonprofit group found in its analysis.

TITLE: In Mexico, the mayor of a state capital has been killed less than 1 week after he took office
SUMMARY: Alejandro Arcos was sworn in last Monday as mayor of Chilpancingo, the capital of Guerrero state, where Acapulco is located.

TITLE: Guns, transgender rights, porn: The Supreme Court begins another term
SUMMARY: For the most part, the justices still try to portray the court as amicable, but you don’t have to be a genius to see that they are not exactly happy campers.

TITLE: One possible housing crisis solution?  A new kind of public housing for all income levels
SUMMARY: Maryland's Montgomery County is building mixed-income apartments in which people who can afford to pay market rate allow other renters to pay less. Cities and states nationwide are taking up the idea.

TITLE: This year’s Electoral College map may show another ‘blue shift.’ Here’s why
SUMMARY: Differences in how quickly each state’s counties can report this year’s election results may lead to another “blue shift” or “red mirage” on the presidential electoral map.

TITLE: Medical debt snares millions of people. States, red and blue are passing laws to help
SUMMARY: State lawmakers from both parties are expanding protections for patients burdened by medical debt.

TITLE: His car stalled and he was filled with dread. Then help came from all around
SUMMARY: Corey Widmer says the experience has made him think more about how he can help others.

TITLE: It’s a close race for Michigan. These factors could decide it for Harris or Trump
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris needs to win back Michigan voters President Biden looked poised to lose. Donald Trump’s appeal remains strong here, but he’s not without his own struggles.

TITLE: The Israeli village grieving the biggest loss from Oct. 7, one year later
SUMMARY: At Kibbutz Be'eri, where Hamas-led militants killed more than 100 people last Oct. 7, residents are grieving, reburying their loved ones — and returning to live in their old homes.

TITLE: Nobel Prize in medicine honors two Americans for discovery of microRNA
SUMMARY: The Nobel Assembly said that their discovery is "proving to be fundamentally important for how organisms develop and function."

TITLE: Vigils and protests mark one year since Hamas attacks on Israel as fighting rages on
SUMMARY: Vigils are taking worldwide to commemorate the approximately 1,200 killed in the Hamas attacks a year ago. Protests are planned to demand a cease-fire to the war that has killed nearly 42,000 in Gaza.

TITLE: How a year of Israel-Hamas war disrupted lives. And, key factors for Michigan voters
SUMMARY: Today marks one year since Hamas ambushed Israel, which sparked the ongoing war in Gaza. Now we take a look at how people have been impacted. And, how the Middle East conflict impacts Michigan voters.

TITLE: Helene recovery is more political online than on the ground
SUMMARY: On social media, people are spreading false rumors that FEMA has abandoned victims of Tropical Storm Helene for political reasons. The reality on the ground looks a lot less partisan.

TITLE: NPR wants to know: What are some of your Halloween traditions?
SUMMARY: As Halloween approaches, it's time to start thinking about costumes for the upcoming festivities. But first, NPR wants to hear about your favorite unique holiday traditions.

TITLE: Hurricane Milton reaches Category 4 strength days before it's poised to hit Florida
SUMMARY: Milton rapidly intensified into a Category 4 storm Monday morning and is forecast to make landfall in Florida midweek. The state could see its largest evacuation orders since 2017.

TITLE: Vigils and protests mark 1 year since Hamas attacks on Israel as fighting rages on
SUMMARY: Vigils are taking worldwide to commemorate the approximately 1,200 killed in the Hamas attacks a year ago. Protests are planned to demand a cease-fire to the war that has killed nearly 42,000 in Gaza.

TITLE: It’s a close race for Michigan. These factors could decide it for Harris or Trump
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris needs to win back Michigan voters President Biden looked poised to lose. Donald Trump’s appeal remains strong here, but he’s not without his own struggles.

TITLE: 1 year after Hamas attacked Israel, the conflict grows more dangerous than ever
SUMMARY: The Hamas-led assault that killed 1,200 people triggered a devastating Israeli military response in Gaza. Now the war has engulfed Lebanon and threatens to bring Israel and Iran into direct conflict.

TITLE: Trump and his faithful followers return to Butler, Pa., to energize the flock
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump credited the "grace of God" for his survival of the assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania on July 13 in his return to the site for a rally on Saturday.

TITLE: Fast-growing Hurricane Milton is officially a Category 5 storm as it nears Florida
SUMMARY: Milton grew quickly into a Category 5 storm Monday morning and is forecast to make landfall in Florida midweek. The state could see its largest evacuation orders since 2017.

TITLE: Supreme Court ducks cases involving everything from abortion to Elon Musk
SUMMARY: The  justices also left in place a Michigan state constitutional amendment that barred the use of public funds for private schools.

TITLE: Despite mixed reviews, 'Joker 2' is on track to be one of the biggest comic-book-film flops
SUMMARY: Many film critics and comic book fans say they felt the sequel felt short of their expectations. Others argue that was the whole point all along.

TITLE: Fact checking falsehoods about FEMA funding and Hurricane Helene
SUMMARY: Rumors, misinformation and lies about the federal government’s response to Hurricane Helene have run rampant since the storm made landfall, especially around FEMA funding.

TITLE: Gospel great Cissy Houston has died at the age of 91
SUMMARY: Renowned soul and gospel singer Cissy Houston has died. She was part of a extraordinary musical family that included Dionne Warwick and her superstar daughter, Whitney Houston.

TITLE: Photos: A look back at the year since Oct. 7
SUMMARY: A year has passed since the Oct. 7 attack on Israel and the start of its war in Gaza. Here's a look at some key moments from photojournalists on the ground.

TITLE: Hurricane Milton intensifies 'explosively' into a Category 5 storm as it nears Florida
SUMMARY: Milton grew quickly into a Category 5 storm Monday morning and is forecast to make landfall in Florida midweek. The state could see its largest evacuation orders since 2017.

TITLE: Harris and Trump marked 1 year since the Oct. 7 attacks with tributes to the victims
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris remembered the victims of the attack by planting a memorial tree at her residence at the Naval Observatory in Washington, D.C., while former President Trump visited a sacred site for Hasidic Jews in Queens, N.Y.

TITLE: 'All this blood, all this death': Palestinians protest Israel war with no end in sight
SUMMARY: For Palestinian civilians caught in the middle of the ongoing conflict between Israeli forces and the Hamas militant group, the consequences have been unremittingly difficult, and deadly.

TITLE: A European spacecraft launches to perform a crash scene investigation on an asteroid
SUMMARY: A NASA spacecraft knocked into an asteroid two years ago to test planetary defense. Now, a new mission will inspect the damage, with the goal of helping future asteroid deflection.

TITLE: Harris is pressed for more specifics in a wide-ranging interview with '60 Minutes'
SUMMARY: The interview followed criticism from former President Donald Trump that Harris has been unwilling to sit for hard interviews. She was pressed on everything from her economic proposals to immigration.

TITLE: Tunisia's President Saied wins reelection after cracking down on the opposition
SUMMARY: Opposition parties boycotted the election, calling it a sham amid a deteriorating political climate and authoritarian drift in the birthplace of the Arab Spring more than a decade ago.

TITLE: Harris proposes help for the 'sandwich generation': a Medicare benefit for home care
SUMMARY: Harris is using ABC’s <em>The View

TITLE: Here's how to turn climate change anxiety into action
SUMMARY: More than half of young adults feel anxious, angry and powerless over climate change, a recent survey found. But there are ways to help turn that distress around. Here's how to give them a try.

TITLE: This mountain hamlet hit by Helene flooding preps for a winter without power
SUMMARY: Most of the people who live in Poplar, N.C, are seniors. One priority is securing propane and kerosene heaters to keep them warm when it turns cold.

TITLE: Can ghost guns be regulated as firearms? The Supreme Court will decide
SUMMARY: The government contends that ghost guns kits count as a firearm under a 1968 law. But those challenging the rule contend “a kit of parts is not a weapon.”

TITLE: Harris is trying to reach new voters with a media blitz both traditional — and not
SUMMARY: Harris has already appeared on 60 Minutes and the popular podcast Call Her Daddy. Next up, appearances on The View, The Late Show with Stephen Colbert and The Howard Stern Show.

TITLE: Hurricane Milton poses an 'extremely serious threat' as it barrels toward Florida
SUMMARY: Communities in Florida are bracing for the impact of Hurricane Milton, which quickly went intensified from a tropical storm to a powerful, life-threatening hurricane much faster than predicted.

TITLE: LGBTQ+ women face disproportionate rates of mental health issues and barriers to care
SUMMARY: A new report finds that LGBTQ+ women in the U.S. experience high rates of trauma, mental illness, and other health conditions. And they're less likely to seek medical care.

TITLE: Nobel Prize in physics awarded to 2 scientists for discoveries in machine learning
SUMMARY: John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton were awarded the Nobel Prize in physics Tuesday for discoveries and inventions that formed the building blocks of machine learning.

TITLE: Americans are using AI at fairly high rates. What does this mean for the economy?
SUMMARY: A new study finds that Americans have adopted generative AI faster than personal computers and the internet. Does this mean we're about to see a long-awaited increase in productivity growth?

TITLE: Fact-checking lies about FEMA funding. And, turn climate anxiety into action
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has made several claims about FEMA's disaster response. NPR has fact-checked them ahead of Hurricane Milton. And, how you can turn climate anxiety into collective action.

TITLE: The end of smallpox was ... the beginning for mpox
SUMMARY: Wiping out smallpox had an unintended consequence: the rise of mpox in the past few years. Here's the story — starting with patient zero for mpox back in 1970.

TITLE: One boy's story shows the impact of rising Israeli settler violence in the West Bank
SUMMARY: After his father was killed by Israeli settlers raiding his village in the central West Bank, he says, 15-year-old Noor Assi sometimes envies other teens, but says, "I have a family to take care of."

TITLE: Are hurricanes getting worse? Here’s what you need to know
SUMMARY: Climate change hasn't increased the total number of hurricanes hitting the U.S., but it is making dangerous storms more common.

TITLE: A jellyfish with a superpower - it can fuse with another and become one
SUMMARY: Researchers found that two individuals of a type of comb jelly can fuse and become one with a shared nervous system and digestive system — which has implications for animal regeneration and immune systems.

TITLE: More than a dozen states sue TikTok, alleging it harms kids and is designed to addict them
SUMMARY: Lawsuits filed by more than a dozen state attorneys general argue that TikTok knowingly exacerbates the youth mental health crisis and places profits over child safety.

TITLE: How to follow the latest local updates on Hurricane Milton
SUMMARY: As of Tuesday morning, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2024/10/08/nx-s1-5145557/hurricane-milton-florida">Hurricane Milton was just over 500 miles southwest of Tampa, Fla

TITLE: A misplaced arm position can skew blood pressure readings
SUMMARY: Blood pressure readings are a key to evaluating your risk of cardiovascular disease. But a new study finds that even small missteps in how they are taken can significantly skew the results.

TITLE: Mortgage rates have dropped. Should you refinance your home?
SUMMARY: Interested in seeing if you can save money on your mortgage? Here’s what to know about refinancing – and how to think about timing.

TITLE: 250 companies, schools and organizations pledge to provide overdose antidote naloxone
SUMMARY: The White House says big companies like Amazon, the NHL, and United Airlines are joining the push to prevent overdoses by making naloxone widely available.

TITLE: A jellyfish with a superpower — it can fuse with another and become one
SUMMARY: Researchers found that two individuals of a type of comb jelly can fuse and become one with a shared nervous system and digestive system — which has implications for animal regeneration and immune systems.

TITLE: Alive on paper but dead in reality--why fewer people may be reaching advanced age
SUMMARY: Research into some areas of the world that have a lot of centenarians shows that some of those people are no longer alive. Sometimes the fault is bad record-keeping and sometimes it’s outright fraud.

TITLE: Family of Hostage Held in Gaza Still Has Hope
SUMMARY:
A year ago, a Hamas-led attack on Israel caused a horrific loss of life, started a war and now the aftermath threatens to further destabilize the region. In that attack, five of Abby Onn's family members were taken hostage. Two were killed, two were released, one remains in captivity. We hear how she and her family are marking the occasion and keeping hope that their final family member will be returned safe.

Listen to a special episode

TITLE: Floridians reconsider staying home as Hurricane Milton edges closer
SUMMARY: Communities along Florida's west coast are bracing for a life-threatening storm. Many residents are taking Milton very seriously, heeding calls to evacuate to higher ground. Others are staying put.

TITLE: Alive on paper but dead in reality — why fewer people may be reaching advanced age
SUMMARY: Research into some areas of the world that have a lot of centenarians shows that some of those people are no longer alive. Sometimes the fault is bad record-keeping and sometimes it’s outright fraud.

TITLE: Two Jewish Democrats reflect on Congressional efforts to combat surge in antisemitism
SUMMARY: On the anniversary of Hamas’ attacks on Israel, Jewish lawmakers reflect on what role Congress can play in addressing rising antisemitism in the U.S.

TITLE: Hurricane preparedness: Expert guidance on flooding, power outages and more
SUMMARY: The Atlantic hurricane season isn't over yet. Get ahead of the next storm with these emergency preparedness tips to protect you, your family and your home.

TITLE: Some Indian American Democrats see themselves in Harris. Others see the limits
SUMMARY: In swing states like Georgia, growing numbers of South Asians could make a difference this election. So how do they feel about the woman some call "Lotus POTUS?"

TITLE: Musk's X to be reinstated in Brazil after complying with Supreme Court demands
SUMMARY: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice authorized the restoration of the social media platform's service in Brazil, over a month after its nationwide shutdown, according to a court document.

TITLE: Supreme Court majority may embrace ATF's ghost gun rule
SUMMARY: The ATF classifies the kits as firearms under the 1968 Gun Control Act, but kit manufacturers and sellers challenged the rule in court, asserting that the ATF had exceeded its authority.

TITLE: Azerbaijan’s human-rights record is under fire as it prepares to host UN climate talks
SUMMARY: Azerbaijan has carried out an “escalating crackdown” on government critics and activists over the past two years, according to Human Rights Watch and Freedom Now.

TITLE: Trump secretly sent Putin COVID-19 tests during pandemic shortage, a new book reports
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris is criticizing Trump over the reported shipment, which is detailed in a new book by the journalist Bob Woodward. The president's campaign has denied the reporting.

TITLE: Lots of kids wear Crocs, but are they bad for young feet?
SUMMARY: Crocs — those colorful clog like shoes - are popular with many kids and teens. But doctors say foot problems could be possible if they're worn constantly. Here's what to know if your kid wears Crocs.

TITLE: The FBI arrested an Afghan man who officials say was planning an Election Day attack
SUMMARY: The Justice Department said the man was inspired by the Islamic State militant organization and was plotting an Election Day attack targeting large crowds in the U.S.

TITLE: Luis Tiant, charismatic Cuban who pitched the Red Sox to the brink of a title, dies at 83
SUMMARY: The charismatic Cuban with a horseshoe mustache and mesmerizing windup pitched the Red Sox to the brink of a World Series championship and pitched himself to the doorstep of the Hall of Fame.

TITLE: Justice Department calls for sanctions against Google in landmark antitrust case
SUMMARY: After a federal judge ruled in August that Google is illegally monopolizing the search engine market, the Department of Justice is now saying the company must be reined in.

TITLE: Climate change made Helene more dangerous. It also makes similar storms more likely
SUMMARY: Researchers found that Hurricane Helene was stronger, rainier, and significantly more likely because of climate change. The U.S. can expect more such storms in the future as warming continues.

TITLE: Biden sets 10-year deadline for U.S. cities to replace lead pipes nationwide
SUMMARY: President Biden on Tuesday set a 10-year deadline for cities across the nation to replace their lead pipes, finalizing an approach aimed at ensuring that drinking water is safe for all Americans.

TITLE: Two Palestinian writers on the right to share their stories
SUMMARY: In the year since the devastating Oct. 7 attacks on Israel, tens of thousands of Palestinians have been killed. Even more have been injured or displaced. Still, many Palestinians across the diaspora feel that they aren't allowed to share their stories — that the fullness of their humanity is too often reduced to a few soundbites on the news, or images of people dying. So on this episode, we're revisiting conversations with Fady Joudah and Tariq Luthun — two Palestinian American poets who have tried to carve out space to expand the kind of stories that Palestinians are allowed to tell.

TITLE: In a rematch, mama bear Grazer defeats rival that killed her cub to win Fat Bear Week
SUMMARY: The annual Fat Bear Week honors bears that have sufficiently bulked up in the months before entering hibernation.

TITLE: They came to Asheville looking for a 'climate haven.' Then came Hurricane Helene
SUMMARY: When Mary Ann Roser and her husband moved to Asheville four months ago they introduced themselves to neighbors as “climate refugees from Austin.” After Helene, she has thoughts on “climate havens."

TITLE: Evacuation windows narrow as Hurricane Milton approaches Florida
SUMMARY: The National Hurricane Center predicts the storm surge can get as high as 15 feet in some places, and rainfall totals could reach 18 inches.

TITLE: Many people in jail have the right to vote. So do many felons
SUMMARY: People who are in jail and haven't been convicted of a crime — and even many who have been convicted — retain their right to vote. But it's often challenging for them to exercise it.

TITLE: In battleground states, it's not just about winning — but also losing by less
SUMMARY: In a state where every vote matters, both Democratic and Republican campaigns are not only trying to win in counties where they’re strongest, they’re also trying to lose by less.

TITLE: True crime drama at Supreme Court pits Oklahoma against its top criminal court
SUMMARY: Richard Glossip has had nine execution dates set over the years. He's eaten his last meal three times. He was tried twice and has had multiple appeals, including one at the Supreme Court.

TITLE: Nobel Prize in chemistry awarded to scientists for work on proteins
SUMMARY: The Nobel Prize in chemistry was awarded Wednesday to David Baker, Demis Hassabis and John Jumper for their work with proteins. The awards continue with the literature prize on Thursday.

TITLE: Only 2% of charitable giving goes to women. Can Melinda French Gates change that?
SUMMARY: The philanthropist is spending $1 billion — and leveraging her ever-growing celebrity — to call more attention to the systemic problems facing women and girls. Now she's focusing even more on women's health.

TITLE: Time is short to evacuate for Hurricane Milton. And, EPA mandates lead pipe removal
SUMMARY: Hurricane Milton is expected to make landfall in Florida late tonight as a dangerous storm, and time is running out for people to evacuate. And, the EPA has mandated a nationwide lead pipe removal.

TITLE: Researchers work to make pitch-perfect turf for the 2026 World Cup
SUMMARY: Researchers work to grow grass that will offer the same level playing field for athletes at the various soccer venues that will be used during the 2026 FIFA World Cup

TITLE: How could hurricanes impact the election? What we can learn from 5 recent storms
SUMMARY: The election and Atlantic hurricane seasons are overlapping with dramatic effect, and not for the first time. Here's what we can learn from other storms that shaped elections, from Katrina to Maria.

TITLE: Evacuation windows narrow as Hurricane Milton's heavy rains hit Florida
SUMMARY: With a storm surge potentially as high as 15 feet, the National Hurricane Center says, "Milton has the potential to be one of the most destructive hurricanes on record for west-central Florida."

TITLE: The swing-state counties hit by Hurricane Helene mostly voted for Trump in 2020
SUMMARY: The key presidential states of Georgia and North Carolina were hit particularly hard by Hurricane Helene. NPR compared which counties qualify for FEMA aid with 2020 election results. The area is largely Republican.

TITLE: How to follow the latest local updates on Hurricane Milton
SUMMARY: As of Tuesday morning, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2024/10/08/nx-s1-5145557/hurricane-milton-florida">Hurricane Milton was just over 500 miles southwest of Tampa, Fla

TITLE: Tornado touches down in southern Florida as Hurricane Milton approaches
SUMMARY: With a storm surge potentially as high as 15 feet, the National Hurricane Center says, "Milton has the potential to be one of the most destructive hurricanes on record for west-central Florida."

TITLE: Honda recalls nearly 1.7M vehicles for steering problem that could lead to crashes
SUMMARY: The vehicles covered in the recall were from model years 2022 to 2025 and include certain Acura Integras, Honda Civics, Honda CR-Vs and Honda HR-Vs.

TITLE: A bidding war is brewing for Alex Jones’ media empire
SUMMARY: Infowars is on the auction block, and would-be-buyers have opposite agendas.

TITLE: How FEMA tries to combat rumors and conspiracy theories about Milton and Helene
SUMMARY: The emergency management agency has long tried to respond to rumors that might delay recovery efforts. But a former FEMA official says the current information environment has never been so bad.

TITLE: Lynx, tiger and tadpoles, oh my: See the Wildlife Photographer of the Year winners
SUMMARY: A lynx stretching in the sun, tadpoles swimming beneath lily pads and an investigator dusting a tusk for prints are among the winning images from the newest Wildlife Photographer of the Year awards.

TITLE: Implosion brings down Tropicana casino in Vegas to make way for baseball stadium
SUMMARY: The Tropicana, the third-oldest casino on the Las Vegas Strip, closed in April after welcoming guests for 67 years. An elaborate implosion reduced it to rubble on Wednesday.

TITLE: Brown says no to pro-Palestinian students' demands for divestment
SUMMARY: Supporters of divestment ended their encampment last spring in exchange for a promise that their proposal for divestment would get a vote from the board this fall.

TITLE: Why Tampa Bay is at such high risk for hurricane damage
SUMMARY: The area has not taken a direct hit from a hurricane in over 100 years. But its topography and dense population make it especially susceptible to severe damage from storm surges.

TITLE: Keep calm and hunker down: Floridians brace for Hurricane Milton's impact
SUMMARY: In spite of the very real threat to their homes, belongings and livelihoods, many Floridians in Milton's potential path remained in good spirits hours before its expected landfall.

TITLE: On the frontline of Israel's invasion of Lebanon
SUMMARY: Just over a week ago, the Israeli military sent ground troops into Lebanon to push the militant group Hezbollah back from the border. Our correspondent got as close a look at this invasion as possible, from a town ten miles from the border. He tells us what he saw.

TITLE: Okla. AG seeks new trial for death row inmate, but Supreme Court seems split
SUMMARY: At issue is whether the state court wrongly refused to accept the attorney general’s findings that a death row inmate is entitled to a new trial.

TITLE: Photos: Hurricane Milton slams Florida
SUMMARY: Milton is expected to produce dangerous storm surges of up to 13 feet.

TITLE: The death toll in a gang attack on a Haitian town rises to at least 115
SUMMARY: The attack on residents of Pont-Sondé on Oct. 3 was one of the biggest massacres that Haiti has seen in recent history. The U.N. had previously said that at least 70 people were killed.

TITLE: Severe solar storm may stress power grids as U.S. deals with major hurricanes
SUMMARY: A severe solar storm is headed to Earth that could stress power grids even more as the U.S. deals with major back-to-back hurricanes, space weather forecasters said Wednesday.

TITLE: Millions without power as Milton churns across Florida
SUMMARY: Florida residents are being encouraged to shelter in place, as hazards such as storm surges, tornadoes and high winds and flash flood warnings were extended into early Thursday morning.

TITLE: 'The Apprentice' director talks about the film Donald Trump doesn't want you to see
SUMMARY: Ali Abbasi's new film <em>The Apprentice

TITLE: Tesla is expected to unveil a robotaxi tonight: 5 things to know
SUMMARY: On Thursday night, Tesla is holding a splashy event it’s calling “We, Robot.” CEO Elon Musk says fully autonomous vehicles are key to Tesla’s future, and for years he has promised they are coming.

TITLE: These maps and images show what's left of Gaza, 1 year into the Israel-Hamas war
SUMMARY: Israel's war with Hamas has destroyed much of Gaza. Recent analyses find that nearly 60% of buildings, nearly 70% of orchards and 68% of roads have been damaged or destroyed by the conflict.

TITLE: Some students are fighting to stay in college after the FAFSA delayed financial aid
SUMMARY: Students had to make all kinds of decisions about college before knowing how much financial aid they would get. Now, many of them are scrambling to stay in school.

TITLE: Taylor Lorenz leaves 'Washington Post' after rift with editors
SUMMARY: <em>Washington Post

TITLE: Tracking Hurricane Milton's destruction. And, why more Black men are backing the GOP
SUMMARY: Hurricane Milton made landfall last night as a Category 3 storm with 120 mph winds. Today, we track its aftermath through Florida. And, why the GOP is gaining more Black male voters.

TITLE: Photos: Hurricane Milton brings devastation across Florida
SUMMARY: High winds from Hurricane Milton tore off the fiberglass roof of Tropicana Field in St. Petersburg, Florida, home of the Tampa Bay Rays.

TITLE: What matters to key swing state voters in Wisconsin? A single road offers a glimpse
SUMMARY: A team from NPR speaks with voters along a 15-mile road that cuts through the Milwaukee area's segregated neighborhoods as election season continues in this crucial swing state.

TITLE: Politicians say health plans should cover IVF. Currently only 1 in 4 employers do
SUMMARY: This election, the future of health coverage for fertility treatments has been a hot political issue. A new report highlights what coverage looks like for American workers right now.

TITLE: Han Kang becomes the first South Korean writer to win the Nobel Prize in literature
SUMMARY: The citation commended Han Kang's "intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life." She won the International Booker Prize for <em>The Vegetarian

TITLE: 'That’s a bloodbath': How a federal program kills wildlife for private interests
SUMMARY: A federal program kills hundreds of thousands of wild animals a year. Documents obtained by NPR show that many of those animals were killed in places where no wildlife damage was reported.

TITLE: Internationally acclaimed Israeli writer Etgar Keret looks back on a year of war
SUMMARY: Keret, who lives in Tel Aviv, reflects on the protests in Israel and the U.S. over the hostages and Gaza. The son of Holocaust survivors, he has left- and right-wing political views in his own family.

TITLE: Ethel Kennedy, social activist and widow of Robert F. Kennedy, dies at age 96
SUMMARY: Ethel Kennedy, the widow of Sen. Robert F. Kennedy who raised their 11 children after he was assassinated and remained dedicated to social causes for decades thereafter, died Thursday.

TITLE: Amid airstrikes and armed conflict, Lebanese musicians hit a somber note
SUMMARY: Lebanon is a cultural hub for Arab music. Lebanese music writer Danny Hajjar has been talking with musicians there about how they're dealing with escalating conflict in the region.

TITLE: Rafael Nadal announces his retirement from tennis after 22 Grand Slam titles
SUMMARY: The 38-year-old tennis legend, who has been dealing with injuries in recent years, said he will step away from the sport after next month’s Davis Cup finals.

TITLE: Why does it feel so weird to ride in a driverless car?
SUMMARY: Driverless cars are expanding into more markets across the country. In San Francisco they’re already ubiquitous, but the robo-taxis' behaviors are unsettling riders.

TITLE: Rare comet to streak across night sky. Here’s how you can see it
SUMMARY: Your unusual chance to see a comet in the sky is here. C/2023 A3 Tsuchinshan-ATLAS was discovered by astronomers in 2023 — and will appear to the naked eye over the next couple weeks.

TITLE: Are you shopping for a home? Or bought one recently? We want to hear from you.
SUMMARY: Buying a home these days isn't easy. We want to hear from you about what it's like to shop for a home right now.

TITLE: Hello Diwali Barbie! What is India saying about your skin tone and your vibe?
SUMMARY: The new doll is being scrutinized for the color of her skin, her facial features and her garb. Early reviews are Barbie-tastic.

TITLE: There’s been 38 eyewitness-reported tornados in Florida: Why did Milton cause so many?
SUMMARY: “We ended up with 126 tornado warnings” in Florida, Matthew Elliott, the warning coordination meteorologist at the National Weather Service’s Storm Prediction Center, told NPR.

TITLE: Floridians survey Milton's damage and get ready for a lengthy recovery
SUMMARY: More than 3 million Floridians were without power after Milton. In some areas like Siesta Key, damage was severe. In Sarasota, many residents were thankful things were not worse.

TITLE: What a Hospital in War-torn Sudan Looks Like
SUMMARY: Sudan's war has displaced more than 10 million people and half the country faces starvations. The country's medical services have collapsed leaving a patchwork of charities, local groups and the Sudanese diaspora to try to provide what health care they can. NPR's Africa correspondent takes us to one of the few remaining hospitals, near the Sudanese capital.

TITLE: Are you in the process of buying or selling a home? We want to hear from you.
SUMMARY: The housing market these days isn't easy. We want to hear from you about what it's like to buy or sell a home right now.

TITLE: Diwali Barbie has arrived! What Indians are saying about the doll's skin tone and vibe
SUMMARY: The new doll is being scrutinized for the color of her skin, her facial features and her garb. Early reviews are Barbie-tastic.

TITLE: Fisher-Price recalls 2 million Snuga Swings after infant deaths
SUMMARY: The deaths of five infants ages 1-3 months old occurred from 2012 to 2022. It's not the first time the New York-based company has had to remove products from the market following infant fatalities.

TITLE: Obama, in blunt terms, tells Black men to get over their reluctance to support Harris
SUMMARY: Lack of enthusiasm for Harris “seems to be more pronounced with the brothers," Obama said while campaigning for her in Pittsburgh. He said Black men need to get behind Harris and get out to vote.

TITLE: There’s been 38 eyewitness-reported tornadoes in Florida: Why did Milton cause so many?
SUMMARY: “We ended up with 126 tornado warnings” in Florida, Matthew Elliott, the warning coordination meteorologist at the National Weather Service’s Storm Prediction Center, told NPR.

TITLE: Harris uses town hall to show empathy with Latino voters
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris took questions on inflation, immigration and the way she became the Democratic nominee from undecided voters in her first town hall.

TITLE: Gunmen kill 20 miners in southwest Pakistan attack ahead of Asian security summit
SUMMARY: It's the latest attack in Pakistan's restive Balochistan province and comes days ahead of a major security summit being hosted in the capital. No group claimed immediate responsibility for the attack.

TITLE: TD Bank to pay $3 billion in money-laundering settlement with the Justice Department
SUMMARY: Canada-based TD Bank pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit money laundering, the largest bank in U.S. history to do so, Attorney General Merrick Garland said.

TITLE: States probed TikTok for years. Here are the documents the app tried to keep secret
SUMMARY: In communications newly revealed, TikTok executives discuss being aware of the harms caused by their app. TikTok officials were warned of the app’s dangers to minors.

TITLE: Here’s everyone caught in the web of the Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs allegations so far
SUMMARY: Since last November, 12 lawsuits have been filed against Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs for sexual and physical assault. Here's who is officially involved in the allegations.

TITLE: How we know voter fraud is very rare in U.S. elections
SUMMARY: “Research has been consistent over time that voter fraud is infinitesimally rare,” one expert tells NPR.

TITLE: Worst U.S. whooping cough outbreak in a decade has infected thousands
SUMMARY: America is experiencing its worst whooping cough outbreak in a decade. Experts say there's a cyclical nature to outbreaks like this but that the timing was altered by the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Manufacturers and feds work to stabilize supply of IV fluids for hospitals
SUMMARY: After Hurricane Helene flooded an IV fluid factory in North Carolina, the government and industry are trying to mitigate shortages.

TITLE: What did Trump secretly send Putin, according to a new book? Find out in the quiz
SUMMARY: Also, who is playing Trump in a movie? Who's hitting the podcast circuit? Will any of this matter in 80,000 years? Plus: TWO questions about Nobel Prizes!

TITLE: Her last memory is by the window with her baby in Gaza. Then, Israeli airstrikes hit
SUMMARY: Israel’s military dropped tens of thousands of bombs on Gaza in a year. This is a look at one airstrike, the lives it upended and the rights group's investigation saying it's a possible war crime.

TITLE: SpaceX wants to go to Mars. To get there, environmentalists say it’s trashing Texas
SUMMARY: With each launch, SpaceX has been discharging tens of thousands of gallons of industrial wastewater into sensitive wetlands. Environmentalists say an increase in launches will only make things worse.

TITLE: Japanese organization of atomic bombing survivors wins 2024 Nobel Peace Prize
SUMMARY: The Japanese grassroots group Nihon Hidankyo, an organization of World War II atomic bombing survivors, has won the 2024 Nobel Peace Prize for its efforts to create a world free of nuclear weapons.

TITLE: Award-winning Ukrainian journalist dies in Russian captivity, Kyiv says
SUMMARY: Ukrainian officials on Thursday confirmed the death of freelance journalist Victoria Roshchyna, though the circumstances surrounding her death were unclear.

TITLE: Florida airports, amusement parks reopen as officials weigh damage from Hurricane Milton
SUMMARY: Theme parks and the airport in Orlando announced reopenings Friday, but officials warned more flooding could continue in the region over the coming days.

TITLE: The documents TikTok wanted to keep secret. And, the concerns with SpaceX's rocket
SUMMARY: NPR has reviewed the documents TikTok didn’t want you to see regarding children's safety. Here's what we found. And, the environmental concerns behind Elon Musk’s rocket Starship.

TITLE: Beyond books: How a public library in Ohio's Rust Belt is spurring economic growth
SUMMARY: The public library in Toledo, Ohio, is one of a number across the U.S. that have become entrepreneurial hubs. Business-specialist librarians are helping aspiring small-business owners and nonprofits for free.

TITLE: A teacher recalls  when his students schooled the Pentagon
SUMMARY: John Hunter, the teacher in Charlottesville, Va., who invented the World Peace Game, talks about a memorable trip his fourth graders took to the Pentagon.

TITLE: These missionaries have volunteered at a dozen disaster sites this year
SUMMARY: Volunteers from across the country are in southern Appalachia to help with recovery from Hurricane Helene. Among them are a Texas couple who have volunteered at a dozen disaster sites this year.

TITLE: Remembering baseball legend Pete Rose
SUMMARY: Rose, who died Sept. 30, was one of MLB's most accomplished players — and one of the most controversial. Rose was banned from the league in 1989 for betting on baseball. <em>Originally broadcast in 2004.

TITLE: TikTok executives know about app’s effect on teens, lawsuit documents allege
SUMMARY: In communications newly revealed, TikTok executives discuss being aware of the harms caused by their app. TikTok officials were warned of the app’s dangers to minors.

TITLE: ‘We were ecstatic:’ Coast Guard rescues a man clinging to a cooler in open water
SUMMARY: "We couldn't believe it, honestly, that he was OK," a pilot said as he described finding a man who spent the night of Hurricane Milton's landfall 30 miles from land.

TITLE: In separate strikes, Israel kills 2 Lebanese soldiers and injures 2 U.N. peacekeepers
SUMMARY: The Israeli attack on the Lebanese army came hours after Israeli troops fired on the headquarters of U.N. peacekeepers in southern Lebanon, injuring two peacekeepers for the second time this week.

TITLE: The northern lights dazzle night skies across U.S. and Europe
SUMMARY: The aurora borealis did not disappoint on Thursday night, with stargazers reporting seeing the stunning light show from across the U.S. — as far south as Texas and Florida — and Europe.

TITLE: A Mother and Newborn from Gaza Reunited After Months Apart
SUMMARY:
Raneem Hijazi was eight months pregnant when an Israeli airstrike on her apartment in Gaza buried her in rubble, killing eight family members including her young son. Hijazi survived and gave birth that day to a healthy baby girl. But then she was separated from her newborn for months. We hear the story of their difficult time apart.

Listen to a special episode

TITLE: How one woman is seeking atonement this year during Yom Kippur
SUMMARY: As Yom Kippur approaches, many Jews are engaging in self-reflection and a process of atonement. One woman shares her story of seeking repair.

TITLE: ‘This outfit isn’t flattering’ 5 Common style gripes and how to fix them
SUMMARY: Do you have a tendency to criticize your personal style or your body in the dressing room? Minimize the negative self-talk with these positive and constructive mindsets from stylist Sophie Strauss.

TITLE: Florida dog found tied to fence and abandoned before Milton is safe with rescue group
SUMMARY: The pooch was left on the side of I-75, with a third of his body submerged in water, just hours before Hurricane Milton made landfall. A rescue organization said the dog was stressed but recovering.

TITLE: Trump is rallying in Aurora -- a city he has demonized as overrun by migrant crime
SUMMARY: Trump has repeatedly name-checked the Colorado on the campaign trail in recent weeks — likening the Denver suburb to a “war zone.” Local officials say his claims are overblown.

TITLE: From Hurricane Milton to world hunger: How to make your donations count
SUMMARY: The world is facing a devastating array of disasters. If you want to donate to a charity to make a difference, how can you make sure your dollars will do the most good?

TITLE: Stellantis, maker of Jeep and Ram, lays off more than 1,000 Detroit workers
SUMMARY: The international company that owns the American brands is struggling with a glut of unsold cars and smaller profits. The layoffs could have ripple effects through its U.S. workforce of 52,000.

TITLE: Trump rallies in Aurora -- a city he has demonized as overrun by migrant crime
SUMMARY: Trump has repeatedly name-checked the Colorado on the campaign trail in recent weeks — likening the Denver suburb to a “war zone.” Local officials say his claims are overblown.

TITLE: What is the U.N. peacekeeping force stationed in Lebanon?
SUMMARY: The mission was created in 1978 to help restore order after Israel's first invasion of Lebanon. Decades later, it's still there but has come under fire during a new Israeli invasion in Lebanon.

TITLE: TikTok executives know about app's effect on teens, lawsuit documents allege
SUMMARY:
For the first time, internal TikTok communications have been made public that show a company unconcerned with the harms the app poses for American teenagers. This is despite its own research validating many child safety concerns.

The confidential material was part of a more than two-year investigation into TikTok by 14 attorneys general that led to state officials suing the company on Tuesday.

The lawsuit against the popular video sharing platform claims it was designed to keep young people hooked on the service. Documents uncovered by Kentucky Public Radio show that the company's internal research may help support this accusation.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: Senators call on TikTok to produce documents in response to NPR report
SUMMARY: Two senators, who have pushed online child safety legislation in Congress, demanded that TikTok executives share all materials the company has about the dangers kids may encounter on the wildly popular service.

TITLE: The Justice Department says Virginia is illegally striking voters off of voter rolls
SUMMARY: The lawsuit filed Friday alleges that an executive order issued in August by Republican Gov. Glenn Youngkin requiring daily updates to voter lists to remove ineligible voters violates federal law.

TITLE: Boeing will lay off 10% of employees as a strike shuts down airplane production
SUMMARY: Boeing has been losing money for over five years and is now dealing with a strike that has shut down factories in the Seattle area. The staff cuts will include executives and managers, the CEO said.

TITLE: National Geographic team may have discovered the foot of a famed Mount Everest climber
SUMMARY: A National Geographic team found the boot and foot of whom it suspects to be Andrew "Sandy" Irvine, a 22-year-old climber who went missing on Mount Everest a century ago.

TITLE: 6 facts about false noncitizen voting claims and the election
SUMMARY: All the available evidence suggests that a miniscule number of noncitizens vote illegally in federal elections and not in numbers that would sway the outcome of any race.

TITLE: Fisher-Price recalls parts of over 2 million 'Snuga Swings' following 5 infant deaths
SUMMARY: Fisher-Price is recalling parts of over 2 million infant swings across the U.S., Canada and Mexico due to a serious suffocation risk.

TITLE: Why was a Kentucky judge killed? So far, it remains a mystery
SUMMARY: The one-of-a-kind killing of a Kentucky judge, allegedly by the local sheriff, has shaken tight-knit Letcher County, leaving people baffled and unnerved as police try to figure out a motive.

TITLE: New rules should make methadone easier to get, but change is slow in many places
SUMMARY: An effective treatment for opioid addiction is easier to get after the Biden administration changed rules. That's making a difference for some people battling opioid use disorder, but access is still limited.

TITLE: The Cuyahoga River was so polluted, it used to catch fire. Now it's making a comeback
SUMMARY: The plight of the river, which empties into Lake Erie at Cleveland, helped inspire the Clean Water Act. Now it attracts kayakers and anglers and could soon be removed from an EPA watchlist.

TITLE: Opinion: Remembering Ethel Kennedy
SUMMARY: NPR's Scott Simon remarks on the legacy of Ethel Kennedy, widow of Robert F. Kennedy. She died Oct. 10 at the age of 96.

TITLE: Passing down tradition on Navaratri
SUMMARY: The Hindu holiday of Navaratri involves some complicated dance moves, passed down from parents to children. But as one mother discovered, the line between passing on cultural traditions and mortifying your teenager daughters can be perilously thin.

TITLE: The war is in Gaza, but Palestinians in the West Bank are targeted with violence too
SUMMARY: In the year since the Hamas-led attacks on Israel, the occupied West Bank has seen an increase in Israeli military raids and attacks by Israeli settlers. More than 600 Palestinians have been killed.

TITLE: Harris releases medical report, drawing another contrast with Trump
SUMMARY: The two-page letter says that Vice President Harris is in excellent health and has “the physical and mental resiliency required to successfully execute the duties of the presidency.”

TITLE: What the Harris campaign is doing to try to win over more Black men
SUMMARY: Former President Barack Obama bluntly told Black men this week that they need to get over it if they "just aren't feeling the idea of having a woman as president."

TITLE: How to pass along religious traditions (without embarrassing your teenagers)
SUMMARY: The Hindu holiday of Navaratri involves some complicated dance moves, passed down from parents to children. But as one mother discovered, the line between passing on cultural traditions and mortifying your teenager daughters can be perilously thin.

TITLE: 7-Eleven to close over 400 stores in North America
SUMMARY: The ubiquitous convenience store owed its recent revenue drops to inflation, declining cigarette sales and a shift in palates toward fresh food and specialty drinks.

TITLE: Harris releases her medical report -- and uses it to raise questions about Trump
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris' campaign is using the report to underscore the fact that she is younger than her Republican rival — who has not released much information about his health.

TITLE: A cheese shop owner in Florida describes recovery efforts after her shop lost power
SUMMARY: NPR’s Scott Simon speaks to Louise Kennedy Converse, whose cheese shop in Sarasota, Fla., lost power during Hurricane Milton.

TITLE: Harris releases her medical report — and uses it to raise questions about Trump
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris' campaign is using the report to underscore the fact that she is younger than her Republican rival — who has not released much information about his health.

TITLE: With no running water, Asheville finds other ways to flush thousands of toilets
SUMMARY: Since the remnants of Hurricane Helene hit Asheville, most of the city has been without running water. The people of Asheville have devised elaborate systems to stay clean and flush their toilets.

TITLE: The stark divide between Harris and Trump on voting rights
SUMMARY: Harris wants to make it easier for eligible voters to cast ballots and rebuild Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination, while Trump pushes for more restrictions to voting access.

TITLE: 'There is no home:' Floridians find helping hands after floods
SUMMARY: Many residents impacted by inland flooding near Tampa can't return home as floodwaters slowly recede. One church in Valrico is providing food and other resources to residents in the neighborhood.

TITLE: There’s a wrinkle — or many — in the story behind an elephant’s trunk
SUMMARY: A bump in the elephant brain stem pointed scientists to the wrinkles on their trunks and the role those folds play in the animal’s life.

TITLE: My parents once worked 7 days a week. Now, they’re reclaiming their joy in life
SUMMARY: Aging can be a lifeline for immigrants, like my parents, whose life was defined by work.

TITLE: This year's 'October surprise' may be no surprise at all
SUMMARY: It is not uncommon for political commentators to call a late-breaking story during a presidential election an "October surprise" — even when there is little evidence that it mattered all that much.

TITLE: Gael García Bernal believes that nothing ends — it just transforms
SUMMARY: Gael García Bernal was basically fated to be an actor. He talks to NPR's <em>Wild Card

TITLE: Inside the TikTok documents: Stripping teens and boosting ‘attractive’ people
SUMMARY: A trove of secret documents show teens’ increasingly reliant on TikTok and how executives were acutely aware of the potential harm the app can cause young people, but appeared unconcerned.

TITLE: Deep inside a Norwegian fjord, a dream of farming salmon sustainably
SUMMARY: In Norway, one man's solution to the threat posed by farmed salmon and the impact on the fjords they swim in.

TITLE: SpaceX rocket booster successfully 'caught' on first attempt during flight test
SUMMARY: SpaceX conducted its fifth flight test of Starship, its most powerful spacecraft.

TITLE: 'There is no home': Floridians find helping hands after floods
SUMMARY: Many residents impacted by inland flooding near Tampa can't return home as floodwaters slowly recede. One church in Valrico is providing food and other resources to residents in the neighborhood.

TITLE: Inside the TikTok documents: Stripping teens and boosting 'attractive' people
SUMMARY: A trove of secret documents show teens’ increasing reliance on TikTok and how executives were acutely aware of the potential harm the app can cause young people, but appeared unconcerned.

TITLE: U.S. to send air defense system and troops to Israel
SUMMARY: The Pentagon said it will deploy the Terminal High-Altitude Area Defense battery and crew to Israel after recent Iranian missile attacks.

TITLE: Biden surveys Milton damage in Florida and announces funding for electric grid
SUMMARY: President Biden touched down in St. Pete Beach, on one of Florida's barrier islands hit hard by the storm. He announced a $600 million investment in shoring up parts of the nation's electric grid.

TITLE: How one Afro-Colombian community honors their ancestry
SUMMARY: In the town of Juntas, in the city of Buenaventura, Colombia, the community gathers for Holy Week every year to celebrate the Manacillos festival, an ancestral ritual originating in the upper part of the Yurumangui River.

TITLE: Ruth Chepngetich breaks women's world record by almost 2 minutes at Chicago Marathon
SUMMARY: The 30-year-old Kenyan became the first woman to break a marathon time of 2 hours 10 minutes, and cut almost 2 minutes off the previous women's record.

TITLE: Hezbollah claims responsibility for drone strike that injured more than 60 Israelis
SUMMARY: The assault, which took place in the central Israeli city of Binyamina, is one of the most serious mass casualty attacks the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group has caused in Israel.

TITLE: Man with guns arrested near Trump rally in Coachella, sheriff says
SUMMARY: Shotgun, handgun and magazines were found in car of man arrested on Saturday, according to authorities

TITLE: 4 Israeli soldiers killed in Hezbollah drone attack that leaves dozens injured
SUMMARY: The Lebanese militant group targeted an Israeli army base near the central city of Binyamina, in one of the most serious mass casualty attacks the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group has caused in Israel.

TITLE: UK Ditches Coal Power, Embraces Elvis
SUMMARY: Britain has closed it's last coal-fired power plant, making the country that pioneered coal power, the first to give it up in favor of cleaner options. We hear about the transition. And a small town in Wales has become the unlikely site of a world-renowned Elvis festival.

TITLE: Indian politician known for his close ties with Bollywood is killed in Mumbai
SUMMARY: Baba Siddique was close to several Bollywood superstars and known for throwing lavish parties.

TITLE: China holds large military exercises surrounding Taiwan to warn against independence
SUMMARY: China deployed ships and warplanes in large-scale military exercises surrounding Taiwan Monday, simulating the sealing off of ports in a move that underscores the tense situation in the Taiwan Strait.

TITLE: The U.S. gets a new national marine sanctuary, the first led by a tribe
SUMMARY: Over 4,500 square miles of ocean will be protected off the California coast. It will also be managed in partnership with the indigenous groups that fought to create it.

TITLE: Come hurricane or high water, Florida island residents promise to stay
SUMMARY: As climate change makes hurricanes stronger and more intense, island communities like Longboat Key are particularly susceptible to catastrophic damage from hurricanes. Residents say they are sticking around.

TITLE: 60 years ago, a jet-powered tricycle shattered the land speed record
SUMMARY: Craig Breedlove became the first person to drive faster than 500 miles per hour. But his record-breaking run almost ended in disaster.

TITLE: A spacecraft headed to one of Jupiter's moons is set to launch
SUMMARY: Europa Clipper will make a six-year journey to Jupiter to study Europa, an icy-surfaced moon that scientists believe has “ingredients for life.”

TITLE: 'You're not alone:' A teen podcaster sends message to kids with incarcerated parents
SUMMARY: Eden Alonso-Rivera of Grandville, Mich. is the high school winner of NPR's Student Podcast Challenge. Her winning entry, "A Relationship Behind Bars," is about her father's incarceration.

TITLE: In outreach to Black men, Harris to vow to legalize weed, protect crypto
SUMMARY: Polls show that some Black men may be gravitating toward former President Trump or not vote at all. Vice President Harris and other prominent Democrats are trying to counter that.

TITLE: Are political disagreements stressing you out? Here are tips to bridge the divide
SUMMARY: With only weeks to a divisive election it can be hard to talk politics. Polarization can damage our relationships and our health.  We have strategies to reduce election stress, starting with ourselves.

TITLE: To curb polio outbreak, children in Gaza are receiving a booster vaccine dose
SUMMARY: The World Health Organization said a second dose will be crucial in order to stop the spread of the virus in Gaza and internationally.

TITLE: Bob Woodward takes NPR behind the headline-grabbing moments in his new book
SUMMARY: Bob Woodward speaks to NPR about the revelations in his new book, and recounts how key moments and meetings in recent years played out behind closed doors.

TITLE: Highlighting Indigenous voices across NPR’s network
SUMMARY: NPR is celebrating Indigenous Peoples' Day by acknowledging Indigenous people's accomplishments and delving into their culture and the issues they face with stories from our network.

TITLE: In an election race this close, Asian American voters have become a force
SUMMARY: Asian Americans are the fastest growing-voting group in the country. That means parties are courting them in tight races in states like Pennsylvania.

TITLE: In Chile a language on the verge of extinction, stirs into life
SUMMARY: Ckunsa, an indigenous language in Chile, was declared dead 70 years ago. But groups in northern Chile are successfuly reviving the language and teaching it to a new generation.

TITLE: Nobel Prize goes to 3 economists who study the wealth and poverty of nations
SUMMARY: The award is shared by Daron Acemoglu and Simon Johnson of MIT and James Robinson of the University of Chicago for their research on the institutional roots of national wealth and poverty. They will split the prize money of 11 million Swedish krona or about $1.058 million.

TITLE: August 2024 Monthly Content Review Memo
SUMMARY: A 10-person cohort met to discuss NPR's three-week run of coverage from the day of the Biden-Trump debate until the day President Biden withdrew from the 2024 presidential race.

TITLE: Lilly Ledbetter, the activist who inspired fair pay act, dies at 86
SUMMARY: Lilly Ledbetter, a supervisor at a Goodyear tire plant in Alabama, discovered she was receiving less pay than men who worked the same position. Her case led to a monumental law on pay equity.

TITLE: Native Voters could swing Arizona. Both parties want their votes.
SUMMARY: Both Republicans and Democrats are trying to marshal Native American voters in Arizona, which could prove decisive to winning the key state.

TITLE: Native voters could swing Arizona. Both parties want their votes
SUMMARY: Both Republicans and Democrats are trying to marshal Native American voters in Arizona, which could prove decisive to winning the key state.

TITLE: 6 people accuse Sean 'Diddy' Combs of sexual assault in new lawsuits
SUMMARY: The lawsuits filed Monday accuse the hip-hop mogul of raping women, sexually assaulting men and molesting a 16-year-old boy.

TITLE: Lilly Ledbetter, the activist who inspired Fair Pay Act, dies at 86
SUMMARY: Lilly Ledbetter, a supervisor at a Goodyear tire plant in Alabama, discovered she was receiving less pay than men who worked the same position. Her case led to a monumental law on pay equity.

TITLE: Harris brings a bit of Trump into her rally to try to show him as ‘unhinged’
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris wants voters to pay more attention when Trump talks about "the enemy within." On Monday, she played a highlight reel to paint him as “increasingly unstable and unhinged.”

TITLE: Giant pandas will arrive at D.C.'s National Zoo this week
SUMMARY: After an 11-month wait, giant pandas will populate the zoo once again. A pair of pandas, which left China on FedEx's "Panda Express" cargo jet, are expected to arrive in the D.C. area on Tuesday.

TITLE: Migrant deaths in New Mexico have increased tenfold
SUMMARY: Experts say smugglers are treating migrants more harshly and bringing them on paths that could be more dangerous in extreme summer temperatures.

TITLE: Canada expels India's top diplomat and alleges wider diplomatic involvement in crimes
SUMMARY: Canada expelled India’s top diplomat in the country and five others over last year's killing of a Sikh activist in British Columbia. India rejected the charges and said it would expel Canadian envoys.

TITLE: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean roads as tensions with South Korea soar
SUMMARY: Destroying the roads would be in line with Kim Jong Un's push to cut off ties with South Korea and abandon the decades-long objective to seek a peaceful unification.

TITLE: Petroleum drilling technology is now making carbon-free power
SUMMARY: A new technique for harvesting geothermal energy being pioneered in Utah has passed a significant milestone: Southern California Edison has contracted for enough of the energy to power 400,000 homes.

TITLE: Ukraine is amping up drone production to get an edge in the war against Russia
A Nobel prize for an explanation of why nations fail
SUMMARY: A trio of economists just won a Nobel prize for their insights into how democratic and other inclusive institutions are critical for a nation’s prosperity.

TITLE: Harris courts Black male voters. And, worries that Israel is starving north Gaza
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris will discuss her new proposals to win over Black male voters today at a town hall event. And, aid groups fear Israel is starving people in northern Gaza.

TITLE: A new way to support grandparents raising kids affected by the addiction epidemic
SUMMARY: A pilot program in Alabama will distribute $280,000 from opioid settlement funds to support ‘grandfamilies’ formed to raise kids affected by the opioid epidemic.

TITLE: Nintendo plays the extravagant host in 'Super Mario Party Jamboree'
SUMMARY: 'Jamboree' feels scattered and altogether too eager to please. But while the game's a mixed bag, it's still one of the best in the chaotic Nintendo series.

TITLE: U.N. officials and rights groups warn Israel may seek to starve north Gaza
SUMMARY: United Nations aid officials and Israeli human rights groups say Israel’s latest offensive in north Gaza forces residents to choose between leaving or starving. Israel allowed in food after Vice President Kamala Harris showed concern.

TITLE: Trump town hall ends with 'musical-fest' while he stands on stage
SUMMARY: At a town hall in Oaks, Pennsylvania, on Monday Trump ended the Q-and-A portion to ask the audience to remain and listen to music with him.

TITLE: Local board members in Georgia can't refuse to certify election results, judge rules
SUMMARY: Local election board members in Georgia cannot refuse to certify election results in any scenario, even if they report concerns about fraud or errors, a state judge has ruled.

TITLE: Walgreens will close 1,200 stores, hoping for a turnaround
SUMMARY: Walgreens says about a quarter of its stores are unprofitable. Big pharmacy chains are struggling with growing retail competition and lower prescription payouts.

TITLE: Lufthansa agrees to a record $4 million fine for its treatment of Jewish passengers
SUMMARY: The German airline barred 128 Jewish passengers from their May 2022 connecting flight based on the alleged misconduct of a few. The U.S. government considers that discrimination; Lufthansa disagrees.

TITLE: ‘My losses started the day I was born’: A poet on what it’s like to call Gaza home
SUMMARY: Mosab Abu Toha was able to escape Gaza, along with his wife and three young children. The award-winning poet talks about parenting in war and the devastation of leaving his family and friends behind.

TITLE: U.S. woman wins conkers world title, as men's champ faces metal nut cheating charges
SUMMARY: An autumn tournament for conkers, a traditional English game, has drawn people to a country pub for years. But now a scandal — or conkerversy — is brewing after an accusation of cheating.

TITLE: Wise words from Sister Rosita, age 79: A math lover wins U.N. prize for refugee relief
SUMMARY: Rosita Milesi was honored with the U.N. Refugee Agency's Nansen Award for 40 years of activism. The U.N. calls her a “formidable refugee champion.” And she has life lessons to share.

TITLE: Victoria's Secret fashion show returns following a 6-year hiatus
SUMMARY: Winged Victoria's Secret models will once again take the runway for the first official show since 2018.

TITLE: Trump town hall ends with extended 'musical-fest' while he stands onstage
SUMMARY: At a town hall in Oaks, Pa., on Monday, Trump ended the Q&A portion to ask the audience to remain and listen to music with him.

TITLE: Israel threatens to starve out northern Gaza, U.N. aid agencies say
SUMMARY: Israel has allowed almost no food aid into north Gaza for two weeks. Humanitarian groups say it leaves 400,000 people with the choice of eventual starvation or fleeing their homes to the south.

TITLE: Harris is pressed on the concerns of Black voters in Charlamagne tha God town hall
SUMMARY: Harris’ town hall with the influential radio host came at a crucial moment in the campaign, as polls show her struggling to cement the level of support she may need from Black men to win the White House.

TITLE: Georgia judge counters GOP-led state election board on certification and hand counts
SUMMARY: Local election board members in Georgia cannot refuse to certify election results in any scenario, even if they report concerns about fraud or errors, a state judge has ruled.

TITLE: Pentagon to give honorable discharges to some kicked out from 'don't ask, don't tell'
SUMMARY: The Pentagon said more than 800 military personnel have seen their records upgraded to honorable discharges after being kicked out of the military under its former “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy.

TITLE: In Michigan, Arab Americans weigh the power of a vote
SUMMARY: We travel to the swing state of Michigan — in order to speak to some of the most influential and misunderstood voters in the country: Arab Americans in Dearborn. The Dearbornites we met said that the war in Gaza is the key issue on their minds as they consider how to cast their ballots. What these voters ultimately decide could have huge consequences for the whole country.

TITLE: Maui wildfire survivors will get an additional year of housing help from FEMA
SUMMARY: Survivors of last year's deadly wildfire that decimated a historic Maui town will receive an additional year of housing assistance from the Federal Emergency Management Agency.

TITLE: 'Cheat Code to Life': Jailhouse lawyers help incarcerated people—and themselves, too
SUMMARY: A new trove of letters and oral histories is shining a light on the successes and challenges of jailhouse lawyers: people in prison who help themselves and others navigate the legal system.

TITLE: Archaeologists discover 12 skeletons at a buried tomb in Petra, Jordan
SUMMARY: The Treasury in Petra, Jordan, is a famous tourist site and features in an Indiana Jones movie. Now archaeologists say they've found a remarkable 12 complete skeletons in a hidden tomb beneath it.

TITLE: Hakeem Jeffries could be the first Black speaker of the House. First, he needs to win
SUMMARY: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries is campaigning in competitive districts across the U.S. with the goal of flipping control of the House of Representatives in the November election.

TITLE: Swing state map: Polls move in Trump’s direction, but the race remains tight
SUMMARY: The polling averages show Vice President Kamala Harris’ lead has dropped in every swing state in recent weeks.

TITLE: Christopher Columbus may have been a Spanish Jew, according to a new documentary
SUMMARY: A recently televised documentary in Spain rekindles competing versions of the famed explorer's origins, but the scientific community is viewing it with caution.

TITLE: Small business disaster loan program is out of money until new funds are approved
SUMMARY: The SBA’s disaster loan program has run out of money, it announced on Tuesday. The agency expects to receive new funding from Congress, and will continue to accept applications in the meantime.

TITLE: 'Cheat Code to Life': Jailhouse lawyers help incarcerated people — and themselves, too
SUMMARY: A new trove of letters and oral histories is shining a light on the successes and challenges of jailhouse lawyers: people in prison who help themselves and others navigate the legal system.

TITLE: Trump gains momentum in the election. And, how to handle political disagreements
SUMMARY: New NPR data shows former President Donald Trump edging out Vice President Harris in the race for the White House. And, a full list of tips on how to handle political disagreements and destress.

TITLE: CVS and Walgreens are ailing. Here’s why
SUMMARY: America’s biggest pharmacy chains are closing hundreds of stores, laying off thousands of workers and rethinking their role in our lives.

TITLE: COMIC: Science-backed mood boosters to (almost instantly) snap you out of a funk
SUMMARY: Six techniques to energize you when you feel sluggish and relax you when you feel stressed. Feel the transformation in 15 minutes or less.

TITLE: Ukraine says North Korea is sending soldiers to help Russia in the war
SUMMARY: Ukraine says North Korean military engineers have been sent to Russia to check how well missiles are launching.

TITLE: Tom Brady is now a part owner of the Las Vegas Raiders
SUMMARY: The seven-time Super Bowl champion purchased a minority stake in the Las Vegas Raiders, a deal unanimously approved by NFL team owners at the league's annual fall meeting.

TITLE: More than 140 people die and dozens are injured in a Nigeria gasoline tanker explosion
SUMMARY: More than 140 people, including children, were killed and dozens were injured after an overturned tanker truck exploded in flames while they were trying to scoop up fuel pouring from the vehicle.

TITLE: Harris backs slashing medical debt. Trump’s ‘concepts’ worry advocates
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has taken significant steps to address the medical debt problem that burdens 100 million people in America, but gains would be jeopardized by a Trump win, advocates say.

TITLE: Canceling subscriptions has to be as easy as signing up, FTC says in a new rule
SUMMARY: The "click-to-cancel" rule, now finalized by the Federal Trade Commission, aims to make it easier to cancel subscriptions and memberships. Companies argue the agency overstepped its authority.

TITLE: Millions of pounds of meat are being recalled. Here's what to look for in your fridge
SUMMARY: Over 11 million pounds of ready-to-eat meat and poultry were recalled over listeria concerns, affecting salads, wraps, frozen meals and more from popular chains like Target, Trader Joe's and Walmart.

TITLE: Trump focuses on women's issues in front of all-woman audience in Fox News town hall
SUMMARY: The former president took questions on immigration, the economy and abortion in the hour-long town hall in front of a friendly crowd of women in suburban Atlanta.

TITLE: Where do things stand with reproductive rights as we head into the election?
SUMMARY: Historian Mary Ziegler talks about the legal battles shaping reproductive rights across the U.S. — including the scope of abortion access and the fate of invitro-fertilization.

TITLE: A world of women: Portraits from a refugee camp where the men are missing
