SUMMARY: In one refugee settlement in Chad, estimates are that 97% of the Sudanese residents are women and children. Here's how four women there are mourning the loss of a partner and struggling to get by.

TITLE: A federal judge has ordered Alabama to stop trying to purge voters before Election Day
SUMMARY: A judge temporarily blocked Alabama’s voter removal program after finding the state violated federal law by systematically purging voters too close to this fall’s election.

TITLE: Trump focuses on women's issues in front of all-women audience in Fox News town hall
SUMMARY: The former president took questions on immigration, the economy and abortion in the hour-long town hall in front of a friendly crowd of women in suburban Atlanta.

TITLE: Nebraska Supreme Court clears the way for people with felony convictions to vote
SUMMARY: Nebraska’s highest court ruled against top state officials as it upheld a law providing felons with a path to register to vote after completing their sentences.

TITLE: Former county official gets at least 28 years in prison for killing Las Vegas reporter
SUMMARY: Robert Telles, a former Las Vegas-area official, was sentenced for killing Jeff German, who wrote articles critical of his conduct in office and exposed an intimate relationship with a coworker.

TITLE: Supreme Court refuses to interfere in EPA litigation, for now
SUMMARY: Justice Clarence Thomas dissented while two other conservatives wrote that they may be sympathetic to the case were it to be brought after a lower court ruling.

TITLE: Elon Musk has given $75 million, so far, to put Donald Trump back in the White House
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is among the largest financial supporters of Donald Trump's reelection efforts, new FEC filings show. He and two other megadonors collectively gave $300 million to support Trump.

TITLE: Four Americans allegedly killed by Israeli forces, why isn't the U.S. investigating?
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has urged Israel to conduct credible, transparent investigations into the Americans' deaths, so far Israel has not prosecuted anyone. We hear from families of those killed, and a member of congress, who think the U.S. Justice Department should be doing more.

TITLE: The meaning behind Israel's right to defend itself.
SUMMARY:
"Israel has a right to defend itself and its people." It's a phrase that's been spoken by Israel's allies – and American presidents – for decades, especially in the days after Israel launched its war in Gaza after the October 7th attack by Hamas.

But what do those words actually mean in a historically, politically and in the midst of Israel's incursions into Gaza and Lebanon.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: Harris interview on Fox gets testy -- but also gives her a do-over
SUMMARY: The interview was the vice president's first formal sit-down with Fox. She faced questions on immigration, and was given a chance to answer again what she would do differently from President Biden.

TITLE: New records show Texas judge on X case didn't sell his Tesla shares after taking the suit
SUMMARY: The judge, Reed O’Connor, in Fort Worth, Tex., has rejected calls for him to step down from the high-profile case Musk filed against Media Matters, a watchdog group.

TITLE: JD Vance says 'no,' he does not think Trump lost in 2020
SUMMARY: Vance has faced repeated questions on the campaign trail about whether Trump lost in 2020. On Wednesday, he gave his most direct answer to date, answering "no" in response to a reporter's question.

TITLE: Trump tried a friendlier pitch with Latino voters at a Univision town hall
SUMMARY: During a town hall outside Miami, Trump touted his record on the economy, yet called Jan. 6 a "day of love" and would not back off false claims about Haitian migrants eating pets in Springfield, Ohio.

TITLE: Archdiocese of Los Angeles agrees to pay $880 million to settle sexual abuse claims
SUMMARY: The Archdiocese of Los Angeles has agreed to pay $880 million to victims of clergy sexual abuse in what an attorney said was the largest single child sex abuse settlement with a Catholic archdiocese.

TITLE: 'End of an era': Biden heads for a farewell trip to Germany. Here's what to know
SUMMARY: It's expected to be a meeting of great political importance — especially for Europe.

TITLE: ‘Horrifying’ mistake to harvest organs from a living person averted, witnesses say
SUMMARY: At a hospital in Kentucky, witnesses say, a man who had been declared dead after a drug overdose was moving and visibly crying as he was prepped for surgery to donate his vital organs. The surgery was stopped and the man is alive three years later.

TITLE: From rodeos to radio, inside the Arizona fight against misinformation
SUMMARY: Radio Campesina has a big goal this year: combat misinformation about elections among Arizona Latinos.

TITLE: How to avoid sharing election misinformation
SUMMARY: The 2024 election season is here. As we’re waiting to learn the final results, it can be easy to be duped by false or misleading information. Here are four tips to help you avoid spreading election related misinformation.

TITLE: Harris interview on Fox gets testy — but also gives her a do-over
SUMMARY: The interview was the vice president's first formal sit-down with Fox. She faced questions on immigration, and was given a chance to answer again what she would do differently from President Biden.

TITLE: Harris vies for GOP votes while Trump courts Latinos in the race for the White House
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris worked to woo Republican voters yesterday with an interview on Fox News and a speech in Pennsylvania. Meanwhile, Trump worked to gain the Latino vote at a Univision town hall.

TITLE: ‘Horrifying’ mistake to take organs from a living person averted, witnesses say
SUMMARY: At a hospital in Kentucky, witnesses say, a man who had been declared dead after a drug overdose was moving and visibly crying as he was prepped for surgery to donate his vital organs. The surgery was stopped and the man is alive three years later.

TITLE: The flu shot is different this year, thanks to COVID
SUMMARY: A strain of influenza appears to have disappeared from the planet since COVID. As a result, U.S. flu vaccines have been redesigned.

TITLE: China ends international adoption. Reactions range from shock to relief
SUMMARY: The decision has sent shockwaves through the adoption community and angered families still in the process of adopting children from China. We interviewed adoptees in the U.S. to hear their reaction.

TITLE: Israel is investigating whether it killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar in Gaza
SUMMARY: The Israeli military says three militants were killed in an operation in Gaza and intelligence agents are examining whether Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar was one of them.

TITLE: ‘Horrifying’ mistake to take organs from a living person was averted, witnesses say
SUMMARY: At a hospital in Kentucky, a man who had been declared dead after a drug overdose was moving and visibly crying as he was prepped for surgery to donate his vital organs. The surgery was stopped, and the man is alive three years later.

TITLE: Who was Yahya Sinwar?
SUMMARY: Yahya Sinwar is widely considered to have been the masterminded behind Hamas’ cross-border assault on Israel a year ago.

TITLE: A former inspector general shares stories of government waste, fraud and abuse
SUMMARY: As IG, Glenn Fine oversaw investigations of the mishandling of documents in the Oklahoma bombing case, the treatment of detainees at Guantanamo and corruption in the Navy. His book is <em>Watchdogs

TITLE: Israel says Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is dead
SUMMARY: The Israeli military says three militants were killed in an operation in Gaza and intelligence agents are examining whether Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar was one of them.

TITLE: Mitzi Gaynor, star of the big-screen musical ‘South Pacific,’ dies at 93
SUMMARY: Mitzi Gaynor, the effervescent dancer and actor, starred as Nellie Forbush in the 1958 film of "South Pacific" and appeared in other musicals with Bing Crosby, Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly.

TITLE: Who was Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar?
SUMMARY: Yahya Sinwar is widely considered to have been the masterminded behind Hamas’ cross-border assault on Israel a year ago.

TITLE: Judge unseals Ruben Gallego divorce filing that has hovered over Arizona senate race
SUMMARY: An Arizona judge unsealed Gallego divorce filings Wednesday, rejecting efforts to keep the records hidden. Yet the filings did not offer the October surprise the Democratic Senate candidate's rival, Kari Lake, was hoping it would.

TITLE: A father and son are indicted on murder charges in Georgia high school shooting
SUMMARY: The grand jury indicted 14-year-old Colt Gray on 55 counts, including murder, aggravated assault and cruelty to children. His father, Colin Gray, faces 29 counts including second-degree murder.

TITLE: Helene’s damage to North Carolina’s Green River affects businesses that depend on it
SUMMARY: In western North Carolina, tubing, rafting and kayaking shops are assessing whether the rivers will be safe enough to open by next Summer following the devastating damage from the remnants of Hurricane Helene.

TITLE: Israel says it killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar in Gaza
SUMMARY: The Israeli military says three militants were killed in an operation in Gaza and intelligence agents are examining whether Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar was one of them.

TITLE: Fentanyl deaths in the U.S. have dropped faster than expected, CDC says
SUMMARY: If the downward trend holds, this year is expected to be the first since 2020 to see overdose deaths fall below the 100,000 mark. However, Black and Native American communities remain vulnerable.

TITLE: Israel Kills the Leader of Hamas
SUMMARY:
Yahya Sinwar was the mastermind of the October 7th attack on Israel that lead to the war in Gaza. Israel says its forces killed him in an operation in Gaza. We'll hear reaction to his death, more about who he was, and how his killing might affect the future of the war.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

TITLE: Phoenix police allegedly beat, repeatedly tased deaf Black man who has cerebral palsy
SUMMARY: The August incident is under investigation by the police department's internal affairs division and is being reviewed by the Maricopa County Attorney's Office.

TITLE: Prada and Axiom Space reveal modernized NASA spacesuits for the 2026 moon landing
SUMMARY: The suits will be used for NASA’s Artemis III mission, marking humankind’s first return to the moon since 1972. It will see the first woman and the first person of color walk on the moon.

TITLE: The DOJ charged a former Indian intelligence official in a foiled assassination plot
SUMMARY: The indictment against Vikash Yadav points to a direct link between the Indian government and what prosecutors say was a murder-for-hire scheme on American soil.

TITLE: King Charles III's visit rekindles Australia's debate on ending ties to the British monarchy
SUMMARY: While the welcome will be warm, Australia's national and state leaders want the royals removed from their constitution.

TITLE: Alabama executes man who killed 5 and asked to be put to death
SUMMARY: Alabama executed a man Thursday who admitted to killing five people with an ax and gun during a drug-fueled rampage in 2016 and dropped his appeals and asked to be put to death.

TITLE: A Canadian former Olympic snowboarder is wanted in a U.S. drug trafficking case
SUMMARY: A former Olympic snowboarder for Canada has been charged with running a drug trafficking ring that shipped vast amounts of cocaine across the Americas and killed four people, authorities said.

TITLE: Barbed wire, high fences: some election spots in Arizona close, but others step up
SUMMARY: Some election locations in Arizona are shutting their doors in the face of security threats — but others are expanding their footprint.

TITLE: This week's news quiz has skeletons (though sadly not the political kind)
SUMMARY: If you've paid attention to incoming presidents and incoming pandas you can ace at least half of this week's quiz.

TITLE: Emo music not only still exists — it's thriving
SUMMARY: If you had any doubts, we can clear them up now. Emo music not only still exists — it's thriving.

TITLE: AI-generated images have become a new form of propaganda this election season
SUMMARY: This election cycle, AI-generated images have proliferated on social media platforms after politically charged news events. They often spread partisan narratives rather than facts.

TITLE: Mortgage rates were supposed to come down. Instead, they're rising -- here's why
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates are ticking up even after the Federal Reserve has started cutting interest rates. Here's why, and where rates — and home sales — could go from here.

TITLE: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is dead. Can Israel seal a hostage deal now?
SUMMARY: The leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, is dead, the Israeli military confirmed. This leaves behind very important questions about what is next for the group and whether a cease-fire deal could progress.

TITLE: PHOTOS: How 9 families cope when they can't afford 3 healthy meals a day for the kids
SUMMARY: "Severe child food poverty" is on the rise, affecting 181 million young kids. Here's how families cope when their kids are hungry and they can't afford to put 3 nutritious meals a day on the table.

TITLE: Mortgage rates were supposed to come down. Instead, they're rising. Here's why
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates are ticking up even after the Federal Reserve has started cutting interest rates. Here's why, and where rates — and home sales — could go from here.

TITLE: What does Yahya Sinwar's death mean for the Middle East?
SUMMARY: What does the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar mean for the war in Gaza and the region beyond, and will it revive the chances of cease-fire and the release of the remaining hostages?

TITLE: Ozempic shows promise for treating alcohol and drug abuse, study finds
SUMMARY: The weight-loss drugs are linked with reduced rates of excess drinking and opioid overdoses, suggesting they may tamp down substance use cravings too.

TITLE: NOAA's annual winter forecast is here. These are the weather predictions for your area
SUMMARY: Large swaths of the South and the East Coast are favored to see warmer-than-average temperatures, while the Pacific Northwest has greater odds of cooler-than-normal conditions this winter.

TITLE: CVS Health CEO Lynch steps down as the drugstore chain struggles to right its path
SUMMARY: CVS Health CEO Karen Lynch has stepped down, with company shares sinking 19% this year and the health-care giant struggling on several fronts. CVS Health also warned of disappointing third-quarter earnings and said investors should not rely on guidance it laid out in August. Lynch will be replaced by veteran CVS Health executive David Joyner.

TITLE: Former Canadian Olympian is accused of being a fugitive drug lord
SUMMARY: Ryan Wedding was once an Olympic snowboarder. But now he faces federal charges of operating a sprawling cocaine trafficking ring -- and ordering several murders.

TITLE: Cuba plunged into an island wide blackout as power grid fails
SUMMARY: Cuban government declares an "energy emgergency" after the failure of one of its few power plants plunges it into an islandwide blackout.

TITLE: Kentucky Tiktok suit says company considered using KY creators to sway Sen. Mitch McConnell
SUMMARY: The suit says videos by Kentucky small businesses were identified as possibly of interest to the senator, who has expressed concern about the app's effect on kids

TITLE: Harris and Trump hold competing rallies in Michigan
SUMMARY: While the two candidates have been crisscrossing the swing states for weeks, this is the first time they are literally crossing paths, with each of them holding events in the suburbs north of Detroit.

TITLE: U.S. to probe Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system after pedestrian killed
SUMMARY: The U.S. government's road safety agency is investigating Tesla's “Full Self-Driving” system after getting reports of crashes in low-visibility conditions, including one that killed a pedestrian.

TITLE: Japan's ruling party headquarters is attacked with firebombs and suspect is arrested
SUMMARY: A man threw firebombs into the headquarters of Japan’s ruling party in Tokyo, then crashed his car into the fencing of the prime minister's residence, police said. There were no reported injuries.

TITLE: Moldova accuses Russia of meddling ahead of its elections and an EU referendum
SUMMARY: Moldovans will vote for a new president and on a constitutional amendment regarding its path to the EU. Both votes will take place amid accusations of Russian meddling, vote buying and disinformation.

TITLE: GOP ads on transgender rights are dominating airwaves in the election's closing days
SUMMARY: The ad spending, which includes at least $17 million by the Trump campaign, is part of a broader Republican strategy casting the Democratic Party as taking transgender rights to extremes.

TITLE: Trump is promising deportations under the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. What is it?
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump says if reelected, he will invoke a centuries-old law to expedite the removal of undocumented immigrants. Can he? Here's what to know about the Alien Enemies Act of 1798.

TITLE: Medicaid will cover traditional healing practices for Native Americans in 4 states
SUMMARY: The new coverage includes practices such as music therapy, sweat lodges, and drumming, which are integral to Native healing traditions and have proved helpful for addiction among other health issues.

TITLE: Opinion: 'YER OUT!' Eric Adams' fashion faux pas
SUMMARY: New York City Mayor Eric Adams, no stranger to controversy, has ignited another with a hat. NPR's Scott Simon explains.

TITLE: Kentucky TikTok suit says company considered using Ky. creators to sway Sen. Mitch McConnell
SUMMARY: The suit says videos by Kentucky small businesses were identified as possibly of interest to the senator, who has expressed concern about the app's effect on kids

TITLE: Israel says drone targets Benjamin Netanyahu’s house; strikes in Gaza kill 50
SUMMARY: The Israeli government said a drone targeted the prime minister’s house, though there were no casualties, as Iran’s supreme leader vowed Hamas would continue its fight.

TITLE: Cuba's power grid collapses again - why does this keep happening?
SUMMARY: Cuba’s power grid has ground to a halt for a second time in as many days, leaving 10 million on the island without power and the Caribbean island in a growing sense of crisis.

TITLE: Moldova accuses Russia of meddling ahead of its elections and EU referendum
SUMMARY: Moldovans will vote for a new president and on a constitutional amendment regarding its path to the EU. Both votes will take place amid accusations of Russian meddling, vote buying and disinformation.

TITLE: Frozen waffles sold at Walmart, Target and supermarkets are recalled over listeria risk
SUMMARY: The recall includes various certain frozen waffles sold in Walmart, Target, Publix and other stores. Some waffles for brands like Kodiak Cakes, Simple Truth and Food Hold have also been recalled.

TITLE: Cuba's power grid collapses again. Why does this keep happening?
SUMMARY: Cuba's power grid has ground to a halt for a second time in as many days, leaving 10 million on the island without power and the Caribbean island in a growing sense of crisis.

TITLE: Who was Yahya Sinwar, the Hamas leader killed by Israel?
SUMMARY: A look back on the life and politics of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, a key player for the last several years in the Israel-Gaza conflict.

TITLE: The killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar may escalate war in Lebanon
SUMMARY: The future of Hamas and the war in Gaza now that the organization's leader is dead.

TITLE: Boeing union is set to vote on a new contract deal, possibly ending strike
SUMMARY: The latest proposal includes a 35% general wage increase over four years — bringing it closer to the union's original ask for 40%. Boeing previously offered a 25% raise over the life of the contract.

TITLE: Israel says a drone targeted Netanyahu’s house; Israeli strikes in Gaza kill over 50
SUMMARY: Israel said a drone targeted the prime minister’s house; there were no casualties. Hezbollah said it carried out rocket attacks on Israel, while Israel launched airstrikes on Beirut's suburbs.

TITLE: Why the stakes for who caught Ohtani's 50/50 ball are bigger than ever
SUMMARY: The auction for Shohei Ohtani's iconic 50/50 baseball is almost over. But three men are still fighting in court over who will get the proceeds.

TITLE: A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah
SUMMARY: Israel said a drone targeted the prime minister’s house; there were no casualties. Hezbollah said it carried out rocket attacks on Israel, while Israel launched airstrikes on Beirut's suburbs.

TITLE: U.S. cybersecurity chief says election systems have 'never been more secure'
SUMMARY: Jen Easterly, director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, told NPR that election officials across the U.S. have made big improvements to bolster both physical and cyber security.

TITLE: U.S. investigating unauthorized release of classified documents on Israel attack plans
SUMMARY: The U.S. is investigating an unauthorized release of classified documents that assess Israel's plans to attack Iran, three U.S. officials told The Associated Press.

TITLE: At least 7 dead after ferry dock gangway collapses on Georgia's Sapelo Island
SUMMARY: Authorities said part of a ferry dock collapsed on Georgia's Sapelo Island, where crowds had gathered for a fall celebration by the island's tiny Gullah-Geechee community of Black slave descendants.

TITLE: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inducts Cher, Foreigner, Mary J. Blige, Ozzy and more
SUMMARY: Inductees this year also included A Tribe Called Quest and Dave Matthews Band, and posthumous recognition for Jimmy Buffett, MC5, Alexis Korner, John Mayall, Norman Whitfield and Big Mama Thornton.

TITLE: Trump kicks off a Pennsylvania rally by talking about Arnold Palmer's genitalia
SUMMARY: Trump was campaigning Saturday in Latrobe, Penn., where Palmer was born in 1929 and learned to golf from his father, who suffered from polio and was head pro and greenskeeper at the local country club.

TITLE: Stanford psychologist behind the controversial 'Stanford Prison Experiment' dies at 91
SUMMARY: Philip G. Zimbardo, the psychologist behind the controversial experiment that was intended to examine the psychological experiences of imprisonment, has died.

TITLE: What to know about Republican challenges to overseas and military voting
SUMMARY: In three swing states, GOP groups are suing to challenge the ballots cast by U.S. citizens living abroad, including military members. Many voting experts say these cases are likely to go nowhere.

TITLE: Catholic bishops are donating millions less to defeat abortion this year. Here’s why
SUMMARY: In recent years, Catholic bishops have spent millions on campaigns to defeat abortion rights at the ballot box. This year, they're taking a dramatically different approach.

TITLE: Israeli strikes on north Gaza leave at least 87 dead or missing: Gaza health ministry
SUMMARY: Israeli strikes on multiple homes in the northern Gaza Strip overnight and into Sunday left at least 87 people dead or missing, the territory's Health Ministry said.

TITLE: Harris says Trump is 'cruel' at Georgia rally as she spotlights abortion restrictions
SUMMARY: Kamala Harris has said former President Trump is “cruel” for how he talked about the family of a Georgia mother who died after waiting for treatment for complications from an abortion pill

TITLE: Trump's restless week on the trail ends with a rally riff about Arnold Palmer's manhood
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump circuitously referenced golfer Arnold Palmer's genitalia but more directly insulted Vice President Harris at a winding rally in Latrobe, Pa., Saturday.

TITLE: What does it take to run a free, fair and peaceful election?
SUMMARY:
Millions of ballots are tabulated at the Maricopa County Tabulation Center in Phoenix, Arizona. Inside and out, the building is a fortress.

It's the legacy of the 2020 election when armed protestors gathered outside the building on election night. After Arizona was called for Joe Biden there were months of allegations about voter fraud.

At a time when election results are routinely challenged, candidates cry foul and protesters threaten violence...what does it take to run an election?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: Why Catholic bishops are donating less to oppose abortion rights measures this year
SUMMARY: In recent years, Catholic bishops have spent millions on campaigns to defeat abortion rights measures at the ballot box. This year, they're taking a dramatically different approach.

TITLE: Gov. Shapiro calls Musk's $1M offer to Pennsylvania voters 'deeply concerning'
SUMMARY: Trump supporter Elon Musk says the daily prize money is meant to “support the Constitution,” but an election law expert calls it “clearly illegal.”

TITLE: Israel launches airstrikes on Beirut, saying it's targeting Hezbollah's financial arm
SUMMARY: Israel's military said it was targeting a Hezbollah financial unit that's used to pay operatives and buy arms. The nonprofit provides financial services and is also used by ordinary Lebanese.

TITLE: Hackers steal information from 31 million Internet Archive users
SUMMARY: The digital library's website was defaced earlier this month with a message boasting its theft of Internet Archive users' sensitive records. The nonprofit said it's working to bolster security.

TITLE: The New York Liberty defeat the Minnesota Lynx to win its first WNBA championship
SUMMARY: Two games in the series went to overtime.

TITLE: Putin hosts a summit in a bid to show the West it can't keep Russia off the global stage
SUMMARY: The Kremlin will be able to talk to major players like India and China about expanding trade and bypassing Western sanctions.

TITLE: Georgia authorities investigate a deadly dock gangway collapse on a historic island
SUMMARY: Georgia authorities say they are investigating the collapse of a dock gangway that killed seven people on an island where crowds gathered for a celebration by the island’s community of Black slave descendants.

TITLE: Iraqi Kurds go to the polls with a flagging economy top of mind
SUMMARY: Parliamentary elections were postponed several times amid disputes over the election law and procedures.

TITLE: Oscar brings winds, heavy rains to eastern Cuba after striking the Bahamas
SUMMARY: Tropical Storm Oscar brought heavy rains and winds to Cuba, an island already beleaguered by a massive power outage, late Sunday after brushing the Bahamas.

TITLE: Introducing "A Good Guy" from NPR
SUMMARY: Sergeant Joshua Abate says that he's not a rioter or an insurrectionist. Those closest to the active-duty Marine call him "a good guy." But he was part of the mob that attacked the Capitol on January 6th, 2021. On the eve of a new presidential election, what does his case tell us, as the nation still grapples with the legacy of that day? As they look into the military's reckoning with extremism in the ranks, NPR's Tom Bowman and Lauren Hodges examine Abate's main line of defense: Don't focus on what he did; focus on his promising career as a Marine, instead. Embedded's new two-part series "A Good Guy" drops Thursday, October 24. To listen to this series sponsor-free and support NPR, sign up for Embedded+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: 'Give us what you stole from us,' Indigenous Australian senator yells at King Charles
SUMMARY: Sen. Lidia Thorpe was escorted out of a parliamentary reception for the royal couple after shouting that British colonizers have taken Indigenous land and bones.

TITLE: What it’s like to care for some of the most endangered animals on Earth
SUMMARY: Hawaii's native tree snails, known as the "jewels of the forest," are rapidly disappearing. Some of the most imperiled only live in human care now, safeguarded 24 hours days.

TITLE: Why Pennsylvania could be the key to the White House
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris and former president Donald Trump are in a tight race in Pennsylvania. The state could go either way and it’s why both candidates are working so hard to appeal to voters.

TITLE: To save nature, world leaders aim to turn words into action at biodiversity summit
SUMMARY: The United Nations effort to achieve “harmony” with the natural world kicks off in Colombia this week. Recent reports show there's a lot of work to do to achieve that goal.

TITLE: The race is so close. Here's what happens if there's a 269-269 Electoral College tie
SUMMARY: It’s very unlikely — but theoretically possible — that the presidential election ends with an Electoral College tie. If it did come to pass, here's how the next president would be determined.

TITLE: Biden administration proposes a rule to make over-the-counter birth control free
SUMMARY: Health insurers would be required to cover all recommended over-the-counter contraception products, such as birth control and condoms, without a prescription and at no cost, for those with insurance.

TITLE: Stress isn't all bad. Here's when it can help
SUMMARY: You can't eliminate stress, but you can manage it better and sometimes even make it a force for good. That means reframing how you think about it.

TITLE: Self-exiled Turkish spiritual leader Fethullah Gülen dies in Pennsylvania
SUMMARY: The reclusive U.S.-based Islamic cleric who inspired a global social movement while facing accusations he masterminded a failed 2016 coup in his native Turkey was in his eighties.

TITLE: This farmer 'planted blindly' in a changing climate. A weather app came to his rescue
SUMMARY: “I kept on guessing and just taking risks,” says farmer Stephen Nzioka of Kenya. A weekly text message has been a game changer as he copes with a changing climate.

TITLE: What's important to Pennsylvania voters. And, Israel targets Hezbollah finances.
SUMMARY: Why Pennsylvania is being closely watched this election. And, Israeli strikes on Lebanon hit branches of a Hezbollah-run financial institution.

TITLE: Lebanon assesses the damage after Israel strikes Hezbollah-linked banks
SUMMARY: Israel's military carried out airstrikes overnight on targets in Lebanon that the military says belong to Al-Qard Al-Hassan, a financial institution that undergirds the militant group Hezbollah.

TITLE: A frustrated Supreme Court to look at one version of judge shopping
SUMMARY: Both liberal and conservative lawyers have judge-shopped, but in recent years, some conservative-leaning groups have been laser focused on bringing their challenges  in the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals.

TITLE: Multiple people dead after helicopter crash in Houston
SUMMARY: Houston officials say the helicopter was flying from Ellington Airport when it crashed into a radio tower.

TITLE: Supreme Court declines challenge to CPSC's structure, for now
SUMMARY: The court left in place a 90-year old landmark decision that declared that presidents cannot fire members of a multi-member independent agency, except in cases of bad behavior.

TITLE: Local voter guides: Find candidate information and resources in your community
SUMMARY: What you need to know about the races, issues and decisions being made in your community.

TITLE: GOP candidate for NC schools chief has spread conspiracy theories, ‘groomer’ rhetoric
SUMMARY: Michele Morrow has a track record of falsehoods - for example, saying Islam is a cult and that the plus in LGTBTQ+ stands for pedophilia.

TITLE: As the WNBA's historic season comes to an end, players say it's time for higher pay
SUMMARY: Record-breaking TV ratings helped the WNBA secure a more lucrative media rights deal this year. Now, the players' union has opted out of its contract, a move aimed at better salaries and benefits.

TITLE: Russia Versus the West in Moldova's Election
SUMMARY: The former Soviet republic of Moldova narrowly passed a referendum to pursue membership in the European Union. That puts it at odds with Russia, which is accused of meddling in the election. Our correspondent in Moscow tells us what the vote could mean.

TITLE: A Michigan judge tosses out a Republican lawsuit over overseas and military voting
SUMMARY: A Michigan state judge has dismissed a Republican lawsuit that challenged the swing state’s long-standing process for voting by U.S. citizens living abroad, including military members.

TITLE: GOP candidate for NC schools chief has spread falsehoods, ‘groomer’ rhetoric
SUMMARY: Michele Morrow has a track record of falsehoods - for example, saying Islam is a cult and that the plus in LGTBTQ+ stands for pedophilia.

TITLE: Moldova barely approves its EU referendum amid allegations of Russian interference
SUMMARY: Moldova voted in favor of adding a path to the European Union to its constitution, and gave the incumbent president the most votes in elections Sunday, but neither result was the win leaders wanted.

TITLE: Fake bomb threats disrupt travel for scores of flights on Indian airlines
SUMMARY: Bomb threats are causing disruptions, diversions and delays for scores of flights on multiple Indian airlines. Indian authorities said they were looking to increase punishments for perpetrators.

TITLE: Republican lawsuits over overseas and military voting hit setbacks in 2 swing states
SUMMARY: In Michigan and North Carolina, two Republican legal challenges to the legitimacy of ballots cast by U.S. citizens living abroad, including U.S. military members, hit setbacks Monday.

TITLE: 4 people are dead after a helicopter crash in Houston
SUMMARY: Houston officials say the helicopter was flying from Ellington Airport when it crashed into a radio tower.

TITLE: Trump and Harris' closing message to Republicans are as different as they come
SUMMARY: With two weeks to go until voting closes on Election Day, former President Donald Trump and Vice President Harris made two separate but equally important pitches to Republicans on the campaign trail Monday.

TITLE: Tropical Storm Oscar heads toward the Bahamas after leaving at least 6 dead in Cuba
SUMMARY: Tropical Storm Oscar was heading toward the Bahamas late Monday after dumping heavy rain across eastern Cuba. A tropical storm warning was in effect for the central and southeastern Bahamas.

TITLE: Hundreds mourn Catholic priest and Indigenous peace activist killed in southern Mexico
SUMMARY: Marcelo Pérez continued to work as a peace activist despite threats. Advocates say he did not receive the government protection he needed.

TITLE: Akron to pay $4.8 million to Jayland Walker's family over police shooting
SUMMARY: The family of Jayland Walker, a Black man who was fatally shot by eight police officers, will receive a $4.8 million settlement from the city of Akron, the mayor's office said.

TITLE: Peru’s ex-president Toledo gets more than 20 years in prison in case linked to corruption scandal
SUMMARY: Peru’s former President Alejandro Toledo was sentenced to 20 years and six months in prison in a case involving construction giant Odebrecht that became synonymous with corruption in Latin America.

TITLE: 2 naval aviators died in a plane crash after returning from a tour in Yemen
SUMMARY: Lt. Cmdr. Lyndsay “Miley” Evans and Lt. Serena “Dug” Wileman were both 31 and from California, and recently served nine months on a tour in Yemen.

TITLE: As Ukraine's birth rate plunges, here's what one doctor is doing to reverse the trend
SUMMARY: Ukraine is suffering from more than a Russian invasion. Births have plummeted. But many families with help from the government and doctors are trying to buck the trend and have a child in wartime.

TITLE: She was terrified waiting for surgery. Then her anesthesiologist began to sing
SUMMARY: As Samantha Hodge-Williams waited on the operating table for emergency surgery, she felt alone and scared. Then the anesthesiologist appeared.

TITLE: An organization has novel way to get members to vote. But is it legal?
SUMMARY: The Neighborhood Assistance Corporation of America, which helps members get affordable mortgages, says its 3.7 million members must vote or risk losing membership — and the financial benefits.

TITLE: Trump has made more than 100 threats to prosecute or punish perceived enemies
SUMMARY: An NPR investigation has found that since 2022, Trump has repeatedly threatened to investigate, prosecute, jail or otherwise punish his political opponents, rivals and even private citizens.

TITLE: What your mammogram can tell you about your cardiovascular health
SUMMARY: Some clinics will now check your breast scan for arterial calcification, which can be a sign of heart disease risk. But questions remain about the approach.

TITLE: Pennsylvania election results may take days to count. And, ACLU fighting Louisiana law
SUMMARY: As results roll in on election night, Pennsylvania's may take a while longer. Here's why that is. And, the ACLU challenges Louisiana's Ten Commandments law saying it harms children.

TITLE: The son of Singapore's founder says he has been granted political asylum in the U.K.
SUMMARY: Lee Hsien Yang, the brother of Singapore's former prime minister, said he is a "political refugee" after the U.K. government granted him asylum from what he described as persecution at home.

TITLE: Why election results from the battleground state of Pennsylvania may take a while
SUMMARY: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Pennsylvania's top elections official, Al Schmidt, about how the commonwealth is preparing for the Election Day vote count.

TITLE: Honda recalls 700,000 Accords, Civics and CR-Vs for fuel pumps that can leak
SUMMARY: Honda said there are no reports of injuries or deaths related to the issue. It is the second major call this month at Honda, after 1.7 million vehicles were found to have potential steering issues.

TITLE: What do Elon Musk and other billionaires want in return for backing Trump?
SUMMARY: <em>New Yorker

TITLE: A divided country agrees: The election is stressing everyone out
SUMMARY: A new poll from the American Psychological Association shows 7 out of 10 adults say the future of the Nation is a significant source of stress in their lives. And the results cross party lines.

TITLE: Former Abercrombie CEO Mike Jeffries is arrested in federal sex trafficking case
SUMMARY: Several men who made bombshell allegations against Jeffries were male models who described a dynamic in which money and potentially legitimate jobs were used as leverage to exploit them.

TITLE: Pennsylvania's top elections official on conspiracies, the voting process and what to expect on election night
SUMMARY: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Pennsylvania's top elections official, Al Schmidt, about how the commonwealth is preparing for the Election Day vote count.

TITLE: U.S. intel officials says Russia is behind attempts to smear Tim Walz
SUMMARY: A video making lurid and false claims about the Democratic presidential candidate was spread by pro-Trump accounts. Intelligence officials say Russia was behind the video.

TITLE: Sexual Assault in the DRC report
SUMMARY: A pair of new reports from Physicians for Human Rights document a "massive influx" and an "explosion" of rape cases in the eastern DRC.  After three decades of war, the question is what's behind this and what can be done. The situation is even more urgent given a serious outbreak of mpox in the same region which is sexually transmitted.  Reporter: Gabrielle Emanuel. Editor: Rebecca Davis. Digital: Marc Silver. Digital publishing Tuesday morning when embargo lifts at 9a.m.. Radio piece for ATC  HFR spot filed.

TITLE: 5 people are dead and a teenager is in custody after a shooting in Washington state
SUMMARY: Five people, including three teenagers, are dead after a Monday morning shooting in a home in Fall City, Wash. A 15-year-old male was taken into custody.

TITLE: Olivia Nuzzi and 'New York Magazine' have split over her relationship with RFK Jr.
SUMMARY: The magazine said the two parties agreed to part ways, though an investigation found no inaccuracies or bias in Nuzzi’s reporting. Meanwhile, Nuzzi and her ex-fiancé are blaming each other in court.

TITLE: Why this country is seeing a 'staggering' increase in the number of rapes
SUMMARY: New reports from Physicians for Human Rights and Doctors Without Borders document a "massive influx" of sexual violence in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. What can be done to stop it?

TITLE: U.S. intel officials say Russia is behind attempts to smear Tim Walz
SUMMARY: A video making lurid and false claims about the Democratic presidential candidate was spread by pro-Trump accounts. Intelligence officials say Russia was behind the video.

TITLE: Israel says it killed a top Hezbollah official expected to be the group's next leader
SUMMARY: The Israeli military said that one of its airstrikes earlier this month killed Hashem Safieddine. There was no immediate confirmation from the militant group about the fate of top official.

TITLE: A Nightclub Turned Shelter in Beirut
SUMMARY:
More than a fifth of Lebanon's population is now displaced, mostly fleeing from the country's south as Israel carries out airstrikes against the Iran-backed group Hezbollah there. With so many people out of their homes, they're taking refuge anywhere they can, including in one of Beirut's most popular nightclubs. Our reporter in Lebanon introduces us to some of the displaced.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

TITLE: 1 dead, dozens sickened in E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounders
SUMMARY: E. coli food poisoning linked to McDonald’s Quarter Pounder hamburgers has sickened at least 49 people in 10 states, including one person who died, federal health officials said.

TITLE: Rudy Giuliani ordered to turn over NYC apartment, 26 watches to Georgia election workers
SUMMARY: A federal judge has ordered Rudy Giuliani to turn over his New York City apartment and various other assets to two Georgia election workers who won a $148 million defamation judgment against him.

TITLE: Latino voters in focus as Trump and Harris sketch out the campaign's final 2 weeks
SUMMARY: As the campaign entered its final two weeks, former President Trump held a roundtable with Latino men in Florida, Vice President Harris sat for two interviews and early voting kicked off in Wisconsin.

TITLE: Denny's says it expects to close 150 locations by the end of 2025
SUMMARY: Denny’s says it’s closing 150 of its lowest-performing restaurants in an effort to turn around the brand’s flagging sales. About half of the closures will happen this year and the rest in 2025.

TITLE: Egypt has been declared malaria-free by the World Health Organization
SUMMARY: Egypt has been fighting malaria for nearly 100 years. WHO declares a country malaria-free when the disease has not been present for at least three consecutive years before the designation.

TITLE: Canadian Cabinet voices support for Trudeau as some Liberals prepare to confront him
SUMMARY: Canada's deputy prime minister said she believes Justin Trudeau has the support of a majority of Liberals in Parliament as some prepare to confront him Wednesday in the hopes of convincing him to step down.

TITLE: Boeing workers vote on a new contract, but the company’s problems are far from over
SUMMARY: Striking machinists at Boeing vote Wednesday on a new contract offer. Even before the strike, the company was grappling with production and quality control problems that led to billions in losses.

TITLE: Harris needs young voters of color to win. A new poll finds cracks in her support
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris is banking on the support of young voters. But new polling shows potential roadblocks for Harris in replicating the historically high youth support President Biden received in 2020.

TITLE: These are the 2 paths either Trump or Harris has to follow to become president
SUMMARY: With seven states up for grabs, here are the likely scenarios that would put either candidate in the White House.

TITLE: 'A light went off in my head': A professor honors his high school civics teacher
SUMMARY: Malcolm Campbell remembers Don Lawson, the high school civics teacher who helped him understand the true value of education.

TITLE: These teachers often live in poverty. A pay raise could help — but there’s a cost
SUMMARY: A new Biden administration effort to raise Head Start teacher wages could force the federally funded preschool program to serve fewer children.

TITLE: U.S. Steel’s decline nearly killed this town. Its sale could save it
SUMMARY: Braddock, Pennsylvania lost most of its population over the past almost 100 years, due largely to U.S. Steel's decline. Here's how some locals feel about the company's potential sale to the Japanese.

TITLE: Jailed reporters, silenced networks: What Trump says he'd do to the media if elected
SUMMARY: On the campaign trail, former President Donald Trump has threatened to jail reporters who won't give up the sources of leaks and to strip networks of their broadcast licenses for fact-checking him.

TITLE: American Airlines fined $50 million for its treatment of passengers with disabilities
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Transportation penalty against American Airlines comes after "numerous serious violations of the laws protecting airline passengers with disabilities" over a four-year period.

TITLE: The 2 paths deciding the presidency. And, California could determine House control
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Harris are taking on vastly different approaches to their campaigns as Election Day nears. And, California could determine who controls the House.

TITLE: Why the garment workers of Bangladesh are feeling poorer than ever
SUMMARY: Their wages have always been low. With rising inflation and falling prices paid by Western companies for clothing, they're protesting for better pay — and hoping the new government will spur change.

TITLE: An attack on Turkey's aerospace company has left people dead and injured, minister says
SUMMARY: Turkey's interior minister says an attack on the premises of the Turkish state-run aerospace and defense company TUSAS left a number of people dead or injured.

TITLE: Boeing posts a $6 billion loss as striking workers vote on a new contract
SUMMARY: Boeing reported a staggering loss of $6 billion dollars in the third quarter. The disappointing earnings report comes the same day as striking machinists are voting on a new contract offer.

TITLE: When Steamboat goes WHOOSH, scientists look for answers
SUMMARY: What triggers geysers to go off is still not well understood. A new paper shows that one small earthquake likely triggered an eruption of the world's tallest active geyser, Steamboat.

TITLE: Trump’s ex-chief of staff warns his former boss would rule like a ‘fascist’
SUMMARY: John Kelly is one of several Trump-era White House officials to publicly criticize their former boss, arguing that Trump is not fit to hold office again.

TITLE: An attack on a Turkish defense company has killed 4 people
SUMMARY: Assailants set off explosives and opened fire in an attack on the premises of the Turkish state-run aerospace and defense company TUSAS, causing a number of casualties.

TITLE: Mass trial shines a light on rape culture in France
SUMMARY: A harrowing and unprecedented trial in France is exposing how pornography, chatrooms and men’s disdain for or hazy understanding of consent is fueling rape culture.

TITLE: Teammates LeBron and Bronny James make history as the NBA's first father-son duo
SUMMARY: The Jameses, who both play for the L.A. Lakers, shared the court for several minutes on the NBA's opening night. They join a very small club of father-son teammates in American professional sports.

TITLE: Trump's former chief of staff called him a 'fascist.' Harris is campaigning on that
SUMMARY: John Kelly, a retired Marine general who was Trump's chief of staff, said his former boss fits the definition of a fascist. Now Vice President Harris is running on it.

TITLE: McDonald's tries to reassure customers after deadly E. coli outbreak
SUMMARY: A preliminary investigation by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration suggests fresh onions that are served raw on McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers were a likely source of contamination.

TITLE: Israeli Settlers Want to Permanently Occupy Gaza
SUMMARY:
Even as the war in Gaza is still on-going, there are calls from inside Israel's right-wing government for a permanent occupation of the Palestinian territory and to allow Jewish settlements there. While the Prime Minister says this is not the government's policy, some say the military's latest moves make it possible. Our correspondent tells us more from the Israel-Gaza border.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

TITLE: Apple and Goldman Sachs ordered to pay $89 million over Apple Card failures
SUMMARY: Regulators say the companies hurt hundreds of thousands of users of the credit card, which Apple launched in 2019.

TITLE: Turkey suspects Kurdish PKK carried out the attack on a defense company, killing 5
SUMMARY: Assailants set off explosives and opened fire in an attack on the premises of the Turkish state-run aerospace and defense company TUSAS, causing a number of casualties.

TITLE: Come hell or high water, early voting is happening in storm-ravaged North Carolina
SUMMARY: Hurricane Helene left destruction in its wake in western North Carolina. But elections officials are also moving heaven and earth to bring back a sense of normalcy, one vote at a time.

TITLE: Turkey hits Kurdish militant targets after a deadly attack on defense company
SUMMARY: Turkey’s air force struck Kurdish militant targets in Iraq and Syria in apparent retaliation for an attack at a state-run defense company that killed five people and wounded more than a dozen others.

TITLE: With dueling rallies this week, Georgia is on the mind for Trump and Harris
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris and former President Donald Trump are both in Georgia this week, competing for votes in a crucial swing state where polls show a razor thin margin separating the two candidates.

TITLE: Boeing machinists reject latest proposal, and a bruising six-week strike continues
SUMMARY: Striking machinists voted to reject an agreement that would have boosted wages by 35%. It’s another blow for Boeing, which reported a $6 billion quarterly loss on Wednesday.

TITLE: Los Angeles Times editor resigns after newspaper withholds presidential endorsement
SUMMARY: The Los Angeles editorials editor Times resigned after the newspaper’s owner blocked the editorial board’s plans to endorse Vice President Kamala Harris for president, a journalism trade publication reported.

TITLE: U.S. says North Korea has sent troops to Russia for training
SUMMARY: The deployment raises the potential for the North Koreans to join Russian forces in Ukraine and suggests expanded military ties between the two nations as Moscow seeks weapons and troops.

TITLE: North Carolina government calculates Hurricane Helene damages, needs at least $53B
SUMMARY: The estimate includes damages and potential investments to prevent similar destruction in future storms.

TITLE: A Good Guy: 279 Hours
SUMMARY: "Have you ever tried to overthrow the U.S. government?" Marine Sgt. Joshua Abate was in the middle of a routine polygraph test to receive top-secret clearance when he made an extraordinary admission: He had followed the crowd that broke into the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021. This admission leads to a different kind of January 6 story. Abate says he's not an insurrectionist. So why did it take him so long to talk openly about that day? <em>To listen to this series sponsor-free and support NPR, sign up for Embedded+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: 'Los Angeles Times' editor resigns after newspaper withholds presidential endorsement
SUMMARY: The editorials editor of the <em>LA Times

TITLE: Texas attorney general's statement rejects supporters of death row inmate's appeal
SUMMARY: The statement from Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton "corrects falsehoods" from critics who say death row inmate Robert Roberson was unjustifiably convicted in the death of his toddler child.

TITLE: Some colleges are targeting financial aid to middle-class families
SUMMARY: Many middle-income families are frustrated by the cost of higher education, feeling they earn too much for financial aid, but not enough to pay for it themselves.

TITLE: Want to understand the dramatic shift in Latino views on abortion? Go to Arizona
SUMMARY: Arizona has seen rising support for abortion rights among Latinos. The reasons are varied and complicated.

TITLE: Senior sprinter Julia 'Hurricane' Hawkins dies at 108
SUMMARY: Hawkins became a darling of the track and field world when she took up running at 100 years old. She died in Baton Rouge, La., this week.

TITLE: A Pennsylvania farming family struggles to find their place in Trump's GOP
SUMMARY: On a visit to a sprawling history-rich farmer's market and a family farm, NPR asks people with agricultural and rural interests, what's on your mind as you cast your vote?

TITLE: Youth cheerleading is getting more athletic — and riskier
SUMMARY: As the female-dominated sport gets more acrobatic, girls are racking up more concussions and other injuries. A new pediatricians' report calls for change.

TITLE: A Pennsylvania farming family redefines 'conservative'
SUMMARY: On a visit to a sprawling history-rich farmer's market and a family farm, NPR asks people with agricultural and rural interests, what's on your mind as you cast your vote?

TITLE: Young voters’ elation for Harris may be plateauing. And, redefining 'conservative'
SUMMARY: Harris initially generated renewed enthusiasm as a presidential candidate, but that may be leveling off among young voters. And, a rural family is redefining what it means to be conservative.

TITLE: The story of the American migrant — from Dust Bowl to a new life
SUMMARY: Pat Rush and her family left Arkansas in the wake of one of the largest migrations in U.S. history, in the hope of making a better life for themselves out west.

TITLE: Beyond campuses and churches, can Charlie Kirk turn out votes for Trump?
SUMMARY: Conservative influencer Charlie Kirk has focused his political organization on winning Trump another turn. But many longtime Republicans are concerned about the group's effectiveness.

TITLE: How is the world doing on climate change? Not great
SUMMARY: Greenhouse gas emissions continue to rise and the world is still on track for severe climate change impacts, a new U.N. report finds. Countries will meet for international climate talks next month.

TITLE: Black Americans still suffer worse health. Here's why there's so little progress
SUMMARY: The United States has made almost no progress in closing racial health disparities despite promises, research shows. The government, some critics argue, is often the underlying culprit.

TITLE: N.C. State quarterback Grayson McCall retires from football at 23 after concussions
SUMMARY: McCall was carted off the field earlier this month after a hit to the head. After consulting with brain specialists, he wrote on Instagram that the injury was "one that I cannot come back from."

TITLE: South Korea warns it may send Ukraine weapons after North Korea sent troops to Russia
SUMMARY: So far, South Korea has helped Ukraine by providing arms to the U.S. and other countries. But South Korea's government said that could change with North Korean troops deploying for Russia.

TITLE: BeyHive meets KHive: Beyoncé set to perform at Houston rally for Harris
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris will have a special guest at her rally in Houston on Friday: Beyoncé.

TITLE: 2024 Student Podcast Challenge Honorable Mentions
SUMMARY: Here are the honorable mentions from the 2024 Student Podcast Challenge. Congratulations!

TITLE: 'Gate lice' begone? Airline seeks to enforce order in boarding process
SUMMARY: What’s a traveler with a carry-on bag to do as they watch scores of people file onto a plane with limited overhead bin space? Wait their turn, American Airlines says.

TITLE: Police and poll workers train for possible election threats
SUMMARY: How to keep polling places safe is becoming part of regular police training in Georgia.
