TITLE: Facing fallout, Trump claims no president did more for Puerto Rico than he did
SUMMARY: The Republican nominee's remarks come days after jokes about Puerto Ricans at his New York rally prompted backlash.

TITLE: Family releases video of final moments before Black man's death in Missouri prison
SUMMARY: A criminal complaint alleges that guards pepper-sprayed Othel Moore Jr., placed a mask over his face and left him in a position that caused him to suffocate.

TITLE: China launches new crew to its space station as it seeks to expand exploration
SUMMARY: China declared a “complete success” after it launched a new three-person crew to its space station early Wednesday as the country seeks to expand its exploration of outer space.

TITLE: Judge continues to block Florida from threatening TV stations over abortion ads
SUMMARY: The order extends a previous one that bars Florida's surgeon general from coercing or intimidating broadcasters that run commercials for an abortion rights amendment.

TITLE: Americans bet $100 million on Trump v. Harris, but at what cost?
SUMMARY: Political prognosticators legally bet over $100 million on the 2024 presidential election, favoring Harris over Trump.

TITLE: Kids in Iowa's capital will trick-or-treat on Halloween for the 1st time since 1938
SUMMARY: Kids in the greater metro area of Iowa's capital city typically go trick-or-treating the night before Halloween, a tradition that began in the 1930s as a way to help prevent vandalism.

TITLE: America's first Native American cabinet secretary says she's righting historical wrongs
SUMMARY: As the nation's first ever indigenous cabinet secretary, Deb Haaland has made it her priority to right the US government's historical wrongs in Indian Country, a monumental task that's not been without controversy.

TITLE: Rain is coming, but not enough after punishing Amazon drought
SUMMARY: The world’s longest river is at its lowest levels ever due to devastating drought conditions. The dry conditions in Brazil's Amazon rainforest, have left tributaries and the vital waterway parched, stranding river communities, affecting commerce and livelihoods.

TITLE: Voting officials face ‘an uphill battle’ to fight election lies
SUMMARY: The deck is stacked against election officials online, maybe even more so than in 2020. Conspiracy theories can quickly get millions of views while debunks gather a fraction of the attention.

TITLE: Central Asia’s Ticking Time Bomb: Water
SUMMARY: The Aral Sea has nearly disappeared over the last 60 years. Now, its source rivers are depleting.

TITLE: The rules of war aren't protecting civilians. Can they be enforced?
SUMMARY: The Geneva Conventions recently marked their 75th anniversary, yet the rules of war are being widely violated. NPR’s Greg Myre reports from two ongoing wars, Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Hamas.

TITLE: When it comes to improving U.S. health care, what 20 years of war can teach us
SUMMARY: At a hospital in Charlotte, N.C., military doctors serve alongside civilian doctors. It’s a model some hope will improve medical care in peace — and wartime.

TITLE: Faced with obstacles to abortion, military women have built their own support system
SUMMARY: Abortion access has long been difficult for women in the military, but the end of Roe v. Wade has made it even tougher. Some 40% now serve in states with abortion bans or expanded restrictions.

TITLE: Young women are challenging the stigma of sex and love addiction support groups
SUMMARY: On social media, young women are increasingly open about attending 12-step sex and love addiction programs. Sex and Love Addicts Anonymous reports 1,200 meetings in more than 50 countries.

TITLE: With much at stake, labor unions knock on millions of doors in final campaign push
SUMMARY: With much at stake on Election Day, labor unions have deployed canvassers to knock on doors in swing states. With polling tight, the focus is on turning out the vote.

TITLE: A baseless voting claim is being amplified by a network of social media accounts
SUMMARY: It’s unclear who runs the network of social media accounts that has gotten millions of views amplifying trending claims about alleged voting fraud.

TITLE: Why are some Evangelicals drawn to — and sticking by — Trump? This pastor weighs in
SUMMARY: NPR sits down with North Carolina pastor Chad Harvey to talk about Donald Trump, religion and politics.

TITLE: Millions of people to celebrate Diwali this week. Here is what you should know
SUMMARY: Known as the “Festival of Lights,” Diwali is one of the most widely celebrated holidays in India and across the Indian diaspora, including in the U.S. Many celebrate it with food, gifts and fireworks.

TITLE: Republicans pounce on Biden's 'garbage' remarks
SUMMARY: The White House clarified the president's comments, noting that his remarks were directed at a joke made by a comedian who disparaged Puerto Rico.

TITLE: The rules of war aren't protecting civilians. Can they be enforced?
SUMMARY: The Geneva Conventions recently marked their 75th anniversary, yet the rules of war are being widely violated. NPR’s Greg Myre reports from two ongoing wars, Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Hamas.

TITLE: When it comes to improving U.S. health care, what 20 years of war can teach us
SUMMARY: At a hospital in Charlotte, N.C., military doctors serve alongside civilian doctors. It’s a model some hope will improve medical care in peace — and wartime.

TITLE: 988 crisis hotline counselors are sometimes targeted by sexually abusive callers
SUMMARY: The 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline is now operational nationwide. Some of the phone counselors say they need help dealing with abusive callers who keep them on the line and sexually harass them.

TITLE: Harris courts undecided voters. And, is Trump’s mass deportation plan feasible?
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris delivered the closing pitch in her campaign yesterday, reaching out to undecided voters in swing states. And, a look at whether Trump's mass deportation plan is feasible.

TITLE: Biden's 'garbage' remarks give Trump and GOP new fodder on the trail
SUMMARY: It sounded like the president was calling Trump supporters "garbage." But the White House said he was talking about a joke made by a comedian at a Trump rally who disparaged Puerto Rico.

TITLE: Supreme Court allows Virginia to purge individuals from voter rolls
SUMMARY: The U.S. Supreme Court put on hold a lower court order that stopped Virginia from purging its voter rolls. The order comes less than a week before Election Day.

TITLE: Shortage of IV fluids leads to canceled surgeries
SUMMARY: IV fluids used in hospitals remain in short supply, after Hurricane Helene shut down a key North Carolina factory. The closure has hospitals scrambling to stretch supplies and prioritize care.

TITLE: Spain flooding: Photos show the devastation in Valencia
SUMMARY: Authorities in the region report at least 70 people have been killed after torrential rain overpowered the area.

TITLE: Harris urged unity in her closing argument. Biden's 'garbage' line undercut that
SUMMARY: It sounded like the president was calling Trump supporters "garbage." But the White House said he was talking about a joke made by a comedian at a Trump rally who disparaged Puerto Rico.

TITLE: Worried about your 2024 ballot being counted? These states let you track it online
SUMMARY: “There's no need to panic,” an elections expert tells NPR. All but three states have free tracking sites that send updates to voters as their ballot goes through the system.

TITLE: Handsy fans disrupted a World Series game. Here are 5 notable MLB interference cases
SUMMARY: Two Yankees fans were ejected from Game 4 of the World Series for trying to pry a ball out of a Dodgers player’s glove. It's a particularly brazen instance of fan interference, but far from the first.

TITLE: How a little-known organization is poised to shape a second Trump administration
SUMMARY: New York Times reporter Ken Bensinger says the America First Policy Institute, which has nearly 300 executive orders ready to be signed, would influence a Trump second term more than Project 2025.

TITLE: The U.S. economy is growing solidly. Here's what's working — and what's not
SUMMARY: The U.S. economy grew at an annual rate of 2.8% in the third quarter, led by strong consumer spending. The news comes days before a presidential election in which the economy has been top of mind for many voters.

TITLE: ‘Witches marks’ and curses found carved into the walls of historic England manor
SUMMARY: About 20 carvings in “a wide range of designs” including some meant to trap demons or to seek help from the Virgin Mary have been found at Gainsborough Old Hall in Lincolnshire, England.

TITLE: Enforcement was considered discriminatory. Now New Yorkers can jaywalk legally
SUMMARY: The NYPD can no longer ticket jaywalkers, after years of protest that enforcement unfairly targeted Black and Hispanic New Yorkers.

TITLE: What could happen at the Supreme Court under Harris and Trump
SUMMARY: Depending on who wins the presidential election and the Senate, the conservative supermajority could remain the same, be trimmed or expand to an even larger and more lopsided conservative majority.

TITLE: The World's Largest River is Running Low
SUMMARY: The region drained by the Amazon River, including the Amazon Rainforest, is in the second year of a punishing drought. That has lead to the lowest water levels in more than 100 years for the Amazon and its major tributaries. Millions of people and an array of wildlife depend on those quickly disappearing waters. We travel to the region to see the effects.

TITLE: An Elon Musk-backed political group is posting fake Kamala Harris ads on Facebook
SUMMARY: Ads seemingly advocating for Vice President Kamala Harris on Facebook are really part of an effort by a dark money group to mislead voters. The messages have been viewed millions of times.

TITLE: Harris will spend election night at Howard University, the HBCU that helped shape her
SUMMARY: Harris is the first vice president to be an alum of a historically Black college, and if she wins, would make history as the first president to be an HBCU graduate.

TITLE: Bird flu has been found in a pig for the first time in the U.S.
SUMMARY: The discovery of an infected pig at a backyard farm in Oregon raises concerns about bird flu's potential to become a human threat.

TITLE: Dodgers overcome a 5-run deficit to win the World Series against the New York Yankees
SUMMARY: The Los Angeles Dodgers won their second World Series championship in five seasons Wednesday night, overcoming a five-run deficit to defeat the New York Yankees in five games.

TITLE: After setting a home run record, the Dodgers' Freddie Freeman named World Series MVP
SUMMARY: The Dodgers' first baseman was already a hero after Game 1, which ended with his historic walk-off grand slam. But his heroics didn't stop there.

TITLE: North Korea launches a new intercontinental ballistic missile designed to threaten US
SUMMARY: North Korea confirmed the launch hours after its neighbors detected the firing of what they suspected was a new weapon.

TITLE: At least 95 people die in devastating flash floods in Spain
SUMMARY: Spain's national weather service said it rained more in eight hours in Valencia than it had in the preceding 20 months.

TITLE: Arnold Schwarzenegger has endorsed Kamala Harris for president
SUMMARY: Schwarzenegger served as the governor of California from 2003 to 2011. He said he is frustrated with both parties, and does not trust either, but felt compelled to speak out.

TITLE: North Korea launches new intercontinental ballistic missile designed to threaten U.S.
SUMMARY: North Korea confirmed the launch hours after its neighbors detected the firing of what they suspected was a new weapon.

TITLE: A Good Guy: Under Oath
SUMMARY: There's a promise that all Marines make to defend the Constitution. After Sgt. Joshua Abate participated in the events on January 6, the Corps has to decide: Did he break his oath when he entered the Capitol that day? And what does his case say about the changing narrative around January 6? <em>To listen to this series sponsor-free and support NPR, sign up for Embedded+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: In this school’s election, it’s pizza vs. chicken nuggets, with democracy as the winner
SUMMARY: At an Arizona tribal school, it's a fierce campaign to pick the top school lunch, as students learn about making their voice count

TITLE: Millions of low-cost homes are deteriorating, making the U.S. housing shortage worse
SUMMARY: Older homes are the only ones many Americans can afford, but they are costly to fix and maintain, especially for seniors. A patchwork of programs to help are underfunded and have years-long waitlists.

TITLE: Pregnant women and babies face 'terrifying' threat from xylazine addiction
SUMMARY: In parts of the U.S., more than half of pregnant women facing severe addiction are also exposed toxic to the toxic animal tranquilizer xylazine, a threat to them, their fetuses and newborns.

TITLE: After a chaotic vote count in 2020, here's what Detroit will do differently this year
SUMMARY: Four years ago, Trump supporters, motivated in part by false election fraud claims, loudly protested at a Detroit counting facility. Election officials are determined to avoid a repeat of the chaos.

TITLE: Harris and Trump will bring their closing arguments to 2 key Southwest swing states
SUMMARY: With five days left until Election Day, the candidates are expected to make a pitch to Latino voters in Arizona and Nevada — and talk about border security, one of the biggest issues for the campaign.

TITLE: Crowdsourced voting fraud claims could become grist for Republican lawsuits
SUMMARY: One hub for rumors and conspiracies about voting is X, the social media site once known as Twitter. There, users are floating unverified and false claims about voting that can quickly go viral.

TITLE: Caregiving can be a tough, lonely mission. One daughter found ways to reconnect
SUMMARY: Some 106 million people provide unpaid care for an adult in the U.S. Many feel invisible and profoundly lonely. But some are creating new ways to support each other.

TITLE: Debunking voter fraud conspiracy theories. And, presidential power over abortion
SUMMARY: Conspiracy theories connected to voter fraud have increased on social media. And, how both presidential candidates, who have different views on abortion access, could implement their plans if elected.

TITLE: Why abortion referendums are also about the economy
SUMMARY: Abortion is on the ballot in 10 states. The vote results will have consequences beyond women's reproductive rights.

TITLE: Dear Life Kit: Is it a faux pas to create a 'happy graduation' registry for myself?
SUMMARY: An NPR listener is graduating soon with her MBA. She wants to know if it's OK celebrate her achievement by asking loved ones to buy her gifts from a registry, similar to what people do for weddings.

TITLE: VP Harris pledges to listen to experts in contrast to Trump's previous actions
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Tom Nichols, a staff writer at <em>The Atlantic

TITLE: Millions of low-cost homes are deteriorating, making the U.S. housing shortage worse
SUMMARY: Older homes are the only ones many Americans can afford, but they are costly to fix and maintain, especially for seniors. A patchwork of programs to help are underfunded and have years-long waitlists.

TITLE: This agency is trying to protect elections from adversaries like Russia and Iran
SUMMARY: <em>New Yorker

TITLE: A mother and baby from Gaza are reunited 11 months after being separated at birth
SUMMARY: After an Israeli airstrike left mom-to-be Raneem Hizaji badly injured, doctors performed an emergency C-section. It took nearly a year for mom and baby to be reunited.

TITLE: A hunter in Alaska is found dead after being mauled by a bear
SUMMARY: The 50-year-old had been reported overdue from a deer hunting trip. At least 30,000 brown bears are estimated to be in Alaska and mainly live along the southern coast.

TITLE: It's not just D.C.: Satirical Trump statues are appearing in cities across the U.S.
SUMMARY: Trump statues appeared next to sculptures of nude women in Portland and Philadelphia. The plaques bear the title In Honor of a Lifetime of Sexual Assault and quote Trump's Access Hollywood

TITLE: How parrot plumage gets its dazzling reds and yellows
SUMMARY: Parrots are unique among birds in how they produce the pigmentation that makes their vibrant feathering. It turns out a single enzyme calibrates the reds and yellows of a parrot’s brilliance.

TITLE: An Ecological Disaster in the Past and One in the Making
SUMMARY: We go to the borders between Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan to see the dried up shores of what was once one of the largest lakes in the world, the Aral Sea. Mismanagement of the rivers that fed the sea because of demand for irrigation in the dry region, caused the Aral Sea to slowly disappear. And now an irrigation project being undertaken by the Taliban government in Afghanistan threatens to disrupt the ecological and economic balance of one of the main sources of water in the region.

TITLE: 50 years on, D.R. Congo commemorates boxing's 'Rumble in the Jungle'
SUMMARY: The historic fight between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman is still revered as a cherished moment in the central African country's troubled history and has spurred an enduring love of boxing.

TITLE: Israel strikes Lebanon’s ancient city of Baalbek, as tens of thousands of people flee
SUMMARY: As Israel intensified attacks in the Lebanese city of Baalbek, residents fled to an ancient Roman temple, hoping the site’s UNESCO status might save them.

TITLE: U.S. calls on a silent China to use its sway over Russia and North Korea
SUMMARY: The U.S. says 8,000 North Korean soldiers are in Russia preparing to fight against Ukrainian troops in the coming days.

TITLE: Boeing cleaned up on Air Force parts, including soap dispensers marked up 8,000%
SUMMARY: Boeing overcharged the Air Force nearly $1 million for spare parts on C-17 cargo planes, including an 8,000% markup for simple lavatory soap dispensers, according to the Pentagon's inspector general.

TITLE: OpenAI is rolling out a web search feature for ChatGPT
SUMMARY: The function can be used manually or automatically. It is available now for certain users, and will be accessible for other users on a rolling basis.

TITLE: Meet the Democrats using porn ads to convince Trump voters to stay home
SUMMARY: Two friends launched a political action committee to run anti-Trump ads in perhaps the last untouched advertising market in politics: pornographic websites.

TITLE: Boeing’s striking machinists union will vote Monday on a new contract offer
SUMMARY: Boeing’s machinists union leaders are endorsing the company’s latest contract offer, setting the stage for a vote on Monday that could end the seven week-long strike.

TITLE: Who said 'I hate politics' — then endorsed Harris? Find out in the quiz
SUMMARY: This week's news quiz mixes celebrities and politics. But hey, they started it. Were you paying attention?

TITLE: Support from rural Democrats will be crucial for Harris to win this swing state
SUMMARY: North Carolina has more rural voters than any other 2024 presidential swing state, and canvassing groups are working to turn out voters in one purple county as early voting continues in the state.

TITLE: How to find lost objects: 6 techniques that really work
SUMMARY: We asked visual search scientists, a metal-detecting enthusiast and a detective to share the most effective strategies to find missing objects.

TITLE: Here are the key Electoral College dates to keep in mind ahead of Inauguration Day
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump's efforts to overturn the last election put a spotlight on what are essentially ministerial steps between Election Day and Inauguration Day. Here are the key dates ahead.

TITLE: First Gaza, now Lebanon: How support for Israel’s war is influencing Michigan voting
SUMMARY: Many Muslim and Arab American voters are leaning toward third-party candidates or not voting, feeling neither main candidate values their families' lives. Others are choosing between Harris and Trump.

TITLE: Trump, using violent language, attacks 'war hawk' Liz Cheney
SUMMARY: "Let's see how she feels about it, you know, when the guns are trained on her face," Trump said while criticizing Cheney's support of the U.S.-led conflicts in the Middle East.

TITLE: Rainbow Girls: 10 Years of Protection and Prejudice
SUMMARY: Through her her independent documentary project <em>Rainbow Girls

TITLE: Questions arise over White House transcript of Biden call to Latino activists
SUMMARY: Sources told AP that protocol was not followed in editing a transcript of a call the president had with Latino activists responding to comments made by comedian Tony Hinchcliffe at a Trump rally.

TITLE: Harris and Trump head West to woo voters. And, U.S. economy sees solid growth
SUMMARY: Harris and Trump look toward undecided voters in Arizona and Nevada as a pathway to the White House. And, the U.S. economy sees solid growth.

TITLE: Boeing’s striking machinists union will vote Monday on a new contract offer
SUMMARY: Boeing’s machinists union leaders are endorsing the company’s latest contract offer, setting the stage for a vote on Monday that could end the seven-week strike.

TITLE: Trump, Harris return to the Blue Wall ahead of the final campaign weekend
SUMMARY: Former President Trump plans to stop in Dearborn, Mich — a city where a majority of people are Arab American. He and Vice President Harris are each holding Friday night rallies in Milwaukee.

TITLE: Montana camper offered his killer a beer -- and it held suspect's DNA, sheriff says
SUMMARY: A bear attack was initially suspected in Dustin Kjersem’s death. But police now say he was killed by a man he had just met — and that a beer can offered by Kjersem provided critical DNA evidence.

TITLE: More than $10 billion has been spent on ads in the 2024 election
SUMMARY: Spending on campaign ads is up $1 billion from four years ago, according to data from AdImpact, analyzed by NPR. The state that's been the target of the most money is Pennsylvania.

TITLE: Employers added only 12,000 jobs in October. That seems bad -- but there's a catch
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added just 12,000 jobs last month — but the number was depressed by a machinists' strike at Boeing and Hurricanes Helene and Milton.

TITLE: Here’s where Trump and Harris stand on 5 issues affecting workers
SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump have both appealed to workers in this year's election. But the candidates’ stances on many issues affecting workers remain far apart.

TITLE: Here's what life is like in a city in the grip of Sudan’s brutal war
SUMMARY: The Sudanese city of Omdurman lives in the shadow of war, facing daily shelling and battered medical services. But some people are trying to eke out a return to life, however precarious.

TITLE: A warden faced discipline over abuse at a prison. Now he runs a prison training site
SUMMARY: Investigators said warden Andrew Ciolli should have stopped abuse of prisoners. He faced disciplinary action. Now he's the director of a federal center that teaches others how to run prisons.

TITLE: Trump is in Dearborn, Michigan, trying to win over Arab American voters
SUMMARY: Former President Trump stopped in Dearborn, Michigan — a city where a majority of people are Arab American. He and Vice President Harris are each holding Friday night rallies in Milwaukee.

TITLE: An 'unprecedented' good news story about a potentially deadly viral outbreak
SUMMARY: The death rate for Marburg virus is nearly 90%. There are no approved vaccines and treatments. So how did Rwanda achieve what one doctor calls an "unprecedented" success in controlling its outbreak?

TITLE: Are Countries Ignoring the Laws of War?
SUMMARY: There are rules and norms in place in conflicts meant to shield civilians from the worst harms of war. But human rights groups say lately they're being ignored or broken. Our correspondent has been covering two wars in which many of the laws of war are being flouted.

TITLE: Trump visits Dearborn, a hub for Arab Americans, in a last-minute bid to sway votes
SUMMARY: Former President Trump stopped in Dearborn, Michigan — a city where a majority of people are Arab American — largely without addressing concerns about the war in Gaza.

TITLE: Trump visits Dearborn, a hub for Arab Americans, in a last-minute bid to sway voters
SUMMARY: Former President Trump stopped in Dearborn, Michigan — a city where a majority of people are Arab American — largely without addressing concerns about the war in Gaza.

TITLE: Supreme Court sides with Democrats in Pennsylvania voting case
SUMMARY: It is hard to estimate how many ballots will be affected by the decision or whether it will ultimately impact the outcome of the presidential election.

TITLE: Pushed by public opinion shift, Democrats adopt immigration restrictions
SUMMARY: President Biden has issued a number of immigration-related executive actions that mimic those of the Trump administration, and VP Harris has promised she’ll continue restrictive policies.

TITLE: Fake videos from Russian propagandists aim to raise tensions ahead of Election Day
SUMMARY: Intelligence officials say the video, which purported to show a Haitian immigrant claiming he had voted multiple times in Georgia, is the product of a Russian propaganda operation.

TITLE: Harris and Trump enter the home stretch with rallies in 2 key Midwest swing states
SUMMARY: The campaigns crisscrossed Michigan and Wisconsin. Trump tried to woo Arab Americans and zeroed in on Friday's jobs data as Harris criticized the GOP nominee for violent comments about Liz Cheney.

TITLE: South Carolina executes Richard Moore despite broadly supported plea to cut sentence
SUMMARY: Three jurors who condemned Moore to death, a former state prison director, Moore's trial judge, his son and daughter, and pastors called for the governor to change his sentence to life without parole.

TITLE: Hundreds are dead in Spain's floods. Scientists see a connection to climate change
SUMMARY: Hundreds are dead after torrential rains devastated Spain’s east. Climate scientists say a hotter planet makes deadly events like it more likely.

TITLE: I went on the new White House tour. This is what you can now see
SUMMARY: About 10,000 people a week come to visit the White House. But until recently, they got a public tour that hadn’t changed in decades.

TITLE: Broadway stars campaign to get out the vote
SUMMARY: The new nonprofit Broadway Votes is corralling musical theater celebrities to help with the effort both both on stage and online.

TITLE: Women sharing personal stories about abortion bans have become a political force
SUMMARY: Women who have suffered unnecessarily after being denied abortions are talking about it publicly, and to support candidates. Could these stories have a political impact in the upcoming election?

TITLE: Susan B. Anthony broke the law by voting in 1872. In 2024, women honor her courage
SUMMARY: More than 150 years after Susan B. Anthony was arrested for voting despite being a woman, Americans take to the polls on the anniversary of her historic ballot casting.

TITLE: We talked politics at the North Carolina state fair — and learned 3 key things
SUMMARY: As election day nears, the races loom large over the state fair in North Carolina, where voters are expressing both apathy and anxiety over their top issues and the candidates.

TITLE: The election in Georgia is tight. Meet 5 groups of voters who will shape the outcome
SUMMARY: In a state decided recently by tiny margins, subtle shifts among any demographic can matter. These five groups  could be key in determining who wins Georgia — and possibly the presidency.

TITLE: On Arizona's campaign trail, there are 22 tribal lands. He set out to visit them all
SUMMARY: Democrat Ruben Gallego says his party has often taken Native American voters for granted. As he competes for an open Senate seat, he has vowed to visit all of Arizona’s federally-recognized tribes.

TITLE: Iran's supreme leader threatens Israel, U.S. with 'crushing response' to Israeli attack
SUMMARY: Iran's supreme leader threatened Israel and the U.S. with “a crushing response” over attacks on Iran and its allies. The Pentagon said Friday that more U.S. forces would be coming to the region.

TITLE: Sikhs march across California urging protections against threats from India on U.S. soil
SUMMARY: Sikh activists marched 350 miles across California in October, marking the 40th anniversary of a massacre and calling for protection from what they say is a growing threat —  transnational repression from the Indian government.

TITLE: At a historic cemetery in the South, a Dia de los Muertos festival takes root
SUMMARY: At a historic Southern cemetery, a Mexican tradition has found a home.

TITLE: Opinion: Don't get 'river-crabbed!' How China's cracking down on punny dissent
SUMMARY: China's government is censoring puns and wordplay on-line. NPR's Scott Simon explains why double meanings are a problem for Beijing.

TITLE: As ACA sign ups start, more Americans have health insurance than ever. Will it last?
SUMMARY: <em>Enrollment in Affordable Care Act health plans has grown every year of the Biden administration, leading to record low numbers of people who are uninsured.

TITLE: U.K. Conservatives pick Kemi Badenoch as their party's new leader
SUMMARY: The party elected Kemi Badenoch as its new leader as it tries to rebound from a crushing defeat that ended 14 years in power. She is the first Black woman to lead a major British political party.

TITLE: Chef Edward Lee reflects on 'Culinary Class Wars', identity and his next chapter
SUMMARY: After three decades in Southern cuisine, Lee's next culinary chapter explores Korean American cooking, moving beyond traditional recipes and fusion concepts.

TITLE: Opinion: Don't get 'river-crabbed!' How China is cracking down on punny dissent
SUMMARY: China's government is censoring puns and wordplay on-line. NPR's Scott Simon explains why double meanings are a problem for Beijing.

TITLE: The election in Georgia is tight. Meet 5 groups of voters who will shape the outcome
SUMMARY: In a state decided recently by tiny margins, subtle shifts among any demographic can matter. These five groups could be key in determining who wins Georgia — and possibly the presidency.

TITLE: We talked politics at the North Carolina state fair — and learned 3 key things
SUMMARY: As election day nears, the races loom large over the state fair in North Carolina, where voters are expressing both apathy and anxiety over their top issues and the candidates.

TITLE: Satellite images show the devastation from Spain's deadly floods
SUMMARY: The images show a devastating transformation of eastern Spain, where at least 205 people have been killed by flash floods.

TITLE: Citing the pandemic, TGI Fridays files for bankruptcy
SUMMARY: The casual dining chain, which saw dozens of its U.S. restaurants close this year, said its financial woes stem from the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: Trump and Harris make last-minute stops in North Carolina
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris and former President Donald Trump are making stops in North Carolina — a state that has been red since 2008 — as the campaigns race toward Election Day.

TITLE: An influencer thought someone dropping off ballots was ‘suspect.’ It was the postman
SUMMARY: Even before Election Day, unsubstantiated rumors about voter fraud are beginning to focus on specific public servants and voters, leading to harassment and threats.

TITLE: Trump detours to blue state Virginia as he and Harris crisscross swing states
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump leaned into the culture wars in his Salem, Va., rally after he and Vice President Harris both made stops in the Charlotte, N.C., area earlier in the day.

TITLE: Kamala Harris is live from New York on 'Saturday Night Live'
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris is the latest in a long line of politicians to appear on the sketch comedy show over its 50 seasons. In 2015, Donald Trump hosted the show.

TITLE: Kamala Harris is live from New York on "Saturday Night Live"
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris is the latest in a long line of politicians to appear on the sketch comedy show over its 50 seasons. In 2015, Donald Trump hosted the show.

TITLE: It's all about North Carolina on the campaign trail with Trump and Harris Saturday
SUMMARY: The key state, that wasn't expected to be in play this election, enjoyed visits from both presidential candidates — two from former President Donald Trump — as he and Harris make their final pitches.

TITLE: Live from New York, it's Kamala Harris: the VP has a cameo on 'Saturday Night Live'
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris is the latest in a long line of politicians to appear on the sketch comedy show over its 50 seasons. In 2015, Donald Trump hosted the show.

TITLE: Native Americans are on ballots at a record high, but more representation is needed
SUMMARY: At least 170 Native American, Native Hawaiians, and Native Alaskans are on ballots this fall, an all-time high. But a group tracking Indigenous candidates says more work needs to be done.

TITLE: 'I have more say': Why Kathryn Hahn feels more powerful than ever
SUMMARY: In this week's Wild Card, Kathryn Hahn says she has more control over her choices and is not as afraid to say what she wants.

TITLE: U.S. says Iranian-American held in Iran as tensions high following Israeli attack
SUMMARY: The imprisonment of Reza Valizadeh, acknowledged to the AP by the U.S. State Department, came as Iran marked the 45th anniversary of the American Embassy takeover and hostage crisis on Sunday.

TITLE: 10 key demographic groups that could decide the presidential election
SUMMARY: From voters young and older to the potentially very wide gender gap, here's what to watch for as the election results come in.

TITLE: A new copyright rule lets McDonald's fix its own broken ice cream machines
SUMMARY: What would a McDonald’s be without its temperamental McFlurry machines? We may be closer to finding out.

TITLE: Jeff VanderMeer painted a grotesque picture of climate change. Now he’s back for more
SUMMARY: Since publishing Annihilation and the subsequent Southern Reach

TITLE: For the formerly incarcerated, voting for the first time is also about those who can't
SUMMARY: Casting a ballot after serving in prison comes with joy and pain for the formerly incarcerated, particularly because not everyone has their rights restored after completing their sentence.

TITLE: One family's frantic race to save their mother as Helene flooded a Tennessee factory
SUMMARY: Bertha Mendoza was one of the Tennessee factory workers swept away in Hurricane Helene's flash flooding. Text messages show a family desperate to save her.

TITLE: What a big Republican win Tuesday could mean for Obamacare
SUMMARY: With the Affordable Care Act once again under fire from Republicans, a leading health care economist explains what a Republican sweep might mean for the health coverage of 45 million Americans.

TITLE: A simple truth is at the root of many false election claims: Voter rolls are imperfect
SUMMARY: At the heart of many election conspiracy theories is a simple truth: America’s voter rolls are imperfect. The U.S. doesn’t have a central voting list. It has a bunch of different lists.

TITLE: Meet the religious leaders shaping the next generation of civil rights activism
SUMMARY: The Yale Center for Public Theology and Public Policy is raising up the next generation of Christian leaders focused on social justice. It's led by Rev. William Barber, after retirement from his longtime congregation.

TITLE: Severe storms hit Oklahoma, causing injuries and leaving thousands without power
SUMMARY: Severe storms and reported tornadoes swept across Oklahoma early Sunday, causing injuries and widespread power outages, according to authorities.

TITLE: Meet the religious leaders shaping the next generation of social justice activism
SUMMARY: The Yale Center for Public Theology and Public Policy is raising up the next generation of Christian leaders focused on social justice. It's led by Rev. William Barber, after retirement from his longtime congregation.

TITLE: Trump and Harris crisscross campaign trail days out from Election Day
SUMMARY: Trump rallies in Pennsylvania, while Harris attends Black church service in Michigan

TITLE: Why more Native Americans are on U.S. ballots than ever before
SUMMARY: At least 170 Native American, Native Hawaiians, and Native Alaskans are on ballots this fall, an all-time high. But a group tracking Indigenous candidates says more work needs to be done.

TITLE: One family's frantic race to save their mother as Helene flooded a Tennessee factory
SUMMARY: Bertha Mendoza was one of the Tennessee factory workers swept away in Hurricane Helene's flash flooding. Text messages show a family desperate to save her.

TITLE: A new copyright rule lets McDonald's fix its own broken ice cream machines
SUMMARY: What would a McDonald’s be without its temperamental McFlurry machines? We may be closer to finding out.

TITLE: After 4 attempts, Abdi Nageeye wins the NYC marathon
SUMMARY: Abdi Nageeye, 35, from the Netherlands, finished first in the men’s race with a time of 2:07:39. Meanwhile, Seila Chepkirui, 33, from Kenya, claimed victory in the women's race with 2:24.35.

TITLE: Severe storms hit Oklahoma, injuring at least 11 and leaving thousands without power
SUMMARY: Severe storms and tornadoes battered Oklahoma early Sunday, tossing cars and ripping roofs off buildings in the middle of the night.

TITLE: Thousands of children in Gaza receive 2nd dose of polio vaccine, with others cut off
SUMMARY: Health workers say they won't be able to vaccinate all the children they had planned to reach because of ongoing fighting.

TITLE: Quincy Jones, pop mastermind and 'Thriller' producer, dies At 91
SUMMARY: The production wizard behind Michael Jackson's <em>Thriller

TITLE: Moldova’s pro-Western president wins vote overshadowed by Russian meddling claims
SUMMARY: Moldova’s pro-Western President Maia Sandu has won a second term in a pivotal presidential runoff against a Russia-friendly opponent, in a race that was overshadowed by claims of Russian interference.

TITLE: The race for the Senate: Here are the top races to watch
SUMMARY: Republicans are favored to take control of the chamber thanks to a 2024 map of races that tilts disproportionately in the GOP’s favor. Here are the races to watch.

TITLE: Near the front line of the Russia-Ukraine war, Ukrainians are bracing for the U.S. election
SUMMARY: In Ukraine’s industrial east, near the front line in the almost 3-year-old war with Russia, Ukrainians are bracing for a U.S. election they fear will have major repercussions for their country.

TITLE: Trump and Harris are in Reading, Pa., today, thanks to a bad joke about Puerto Rico
SUMMARY: The candidates are both spending time on the last day of the campaign in Reading — a majority-Latino city — where that bad joke about Puerto Rico has resonated.

TITLE: Meet the conservative women who are keeping their votes for Kamala Harris a secret
SUMMARY: Polls show a historic gender gap in the 2024 election. Democrats are reminding conservative women: votes are a secret and they can vote for who they want, including Vice President Harris.

TITLE: 'Traitors within': How one group tried to radicalize the American right in the '60s
SUMMARY: In today’s political climate, conspiracy theories are commonplace. But they’re nothing new. In the 1960s, the John Birch Society built a movement around them.

TITLE: A stranger's words have a ripple effect on one man's life
SUMMARY: After Brian Perkins refused a stranger's help, her actions changed his life forever.

TITLE: Anxious at the Portland airport? Beni the Llama is here for you, spreading joy
SUMMARY: The gentle animals are part of Portland International Airport's effort to counter travel stress with soothing elements from nature.

TITLE: Why these women are secretly voting for Harris. And, how to avoid election misinfo
SUMMARY: Trump and Harris are holding their last rallies before Election Day tomorrow. And, meet the conservative women secretly voting for Harris.

TITLE: It's the last day of the 2024 campaign. Here's where Harris and Trump are going
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris ends her day with a concert on the "Rocky Steps" in Philadelphia. Former President Trump will wrap up in Grand Rapids, Mich. — where he also closed out his 2016 and 2020 races.

TITLE: Poll: In tight race, voters split on whether Harris intends to carry out her promises
SUMMARY: What the latest numbers say and what to look for as the election comes to a close.

TITLE: Impossible, you say? Try asking a toddler
SUMMARY: Green eggs and ham? Even toddlers know when an event appears to be impossible, not just improbable.

TITLE: Trump is hoping to win non-consecutive terms. Only one president has done it
SUMMARY: If reelected, Trump would only be the second president to serve non-consecutive terms after Grover Cleveland in the late 1800s. Here's a look at how that happened — and who else has tried.

TITLE: When do polls close in every state? Here's a timeline
SUMMARY: The Associated Press can't call any races until polls close in their respective state. Here's a breakdown of when that will happen.

TITLE: How has the Electoral College survived, despite being perennially unpopular?
SUMMARY: Despite its substantial-sounding name, the Electoral College isn’t a permanent body: It’s more of a process. For decades, a majority of Americans have wanted it to be changed.

TITLE: Thousands of Pennsylvania voters have had their mail ballot applications challenged
SUMMARY: Thousands of last-minute challenges to voters’ mail ballot applications, along with baseless claims by former President Donald Trump, are adding pressure on Pennsylvania county officials.

TITLE: No more fluoride in the water? RFK Jr. wants that and Trump says it 'sounds OK'
SUMMARY: Robert F. Kennedy, Jr.’s claims about fluoride in the drinking water are linked to Cold War conspiracy theories about the substance.

TITLE: ‘Divine Nine' historically Black organizations hope efforts will turn out the vote
SUMMARY: With more than 2 million members, the "Divine Nine" organizations have launched many get-out-the-vote initiatives in this historic election involving one of their members, Vice President Harris.

TITLE: When will mail-in and absentee ballots be counted?
SUMMARY: Various state rules regarding when election officials can process and count mail-in ballots means it will likely take some time after Election Day before the results from these ballots are fully known.

TITLE: States and cities beef up security to prepare for potential election-related violence
SUMMARY: Washington state's governor activated the National Guard to stand by to help local law enforcement as needed. Meanwhile, extra security is in place at locations across Washington, D.C.

TITLE: Puerto Rico holds general election that promises to be historic
SUMMARY: Puerto Rico is holding elections that will be historic regardless of which of the top two gubernatorial candidates wins.

TITLE: Live: 2024 Gubernatorial Election Results
SUMMARY: View live election results for the 2024 governor races.

TITLE: Live: Senate Election Results 2024
SUMMARY: View live results for the 2024 United States Senate elections.

TITLE: Live: House Election Results 2024
Live: Presidential Election Results 2024
SUMMARY: View live results for the 2024 United States presidential election.

TITLE: See live updates on key election results from Texas
SUMMARY: Voting concludes Tuesday in Texas' presidential, Senate and House contests. View the live results.

TITLE: See live updates on key election results from Florida
SUMMARY: View live results for Florida's ballot measures and races for president, Senate and House.

TITLE: See live updates on key election results from Michigan
SUMMARY: View live results for Michigan's races for president, U.S. Senate and U.S. House.

TITLE: See live updates on key election results from Massachusetts
SUMMARY: View live results for Massachusetts' ballot measures and races for president, U.S. Senate and U.S. House.

TITLE: See live updates on key election results from Colorado
SUMMARY: View live election results for key contests in Colorado.

TITLE: Elon Musk’s $1 million-a-day voter sweepstakes can proceed, a Pennsylvania judge says
SUMMARY: Common Pleas Court Judge Angelo Foglietta in Pennsylvania — ruling after Musk’s lawyers said the winners are paid spokespeople and not chosen by chance — did not immediately explain his reasoning.

TITLE: Voters could flip these state legislatures, changing the path for some big issues
SUMMARY: They don’t get as much attention as the presidential election, but state government races play a crucial role in the laws that govern our lives. This year, several state capitols are up for grabs.

TITLE: Stressed at work over the election? 3 ways to minimize political tension on the job
SUMMARY: Political disagreements have sent workplace incivility to an all-time high this year, costing employers some $2 billion per day in lost productivity. Here’s how to cut down on watercooler fights over today’s election – and its aftermath.

TITLE: What happens if local officials won't certify elections? A Nevada case may be a model
SUMMARY: More than two dozen local officials in swing states have refused to certify elections in recent years, including after the primary election in Nevada's Washoe County this summer.

TITLE: Trump and allies have primed supporters to falsely believe he has no chance of losing
SUMMARY: Many of former President Donald Trump’s supporters don’t believe he lost in 2020. Despite a close race again in 2024, Trump and allies still falsely claim the only way he loses is because of cheating.

TITLE: Vice presidents often run for president. Making it there has been a leap
SUMMARY: While the office of vice president is the second-highest position in the government, making it to the Oval Office has historically been a leap.

TITLE: A wild election is coming to a close — and no one is sure how it will end
SUMMARY: From candidate swaps to assassination attempts, the final months of the campaign has been a whirlwind. Here's why the outcome is so consequential.

TITLE: Election Day guide: What you need to know as you wait for results
SUMMARY: The turbulent 2024 campaign has reached its end. Here are some things to keep in mind throughout Election Day and beyond.

TITLE: Here's how NPR will report the 2024 election results
SUMMARY: NPR relies on results and race calls from The Associated Press for presidential races, other federal elections and statewide contests.

TITLE: Everything you need to know on Election Day.  And, how to reduce political stress
SUMMARY: It's Election Day and both presidential candidates have concluded their campaigns. Here's everything you need to know including how NPR calls the races. And, advice on reducing political stress.

TITLE: People in Guam vote in another presidential race, hoping their voices will be heard
SUMMARY: Even though Guam doesn't have a say in the presidential election, its citizens still come out and vote for the country they love.

TITLE: Control of the White House and Congress rest on voters' decisions
SUMMARY: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Democratic Rep. Suzan DelBene of Washington state, chair of the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, about issues voters will consider Election Day.

TITLE: GOP strategist explains Trump's possible path to the White House
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Republican strategist Rob Burgess about former President Donald Trump's messaging and possible path to the White House.

TITLE: The week of devastating floods that Spaniards will never forget
SUMMARY: After a storm devastated parts of eastern Spain last week, survivors are becoming impatient at the steady government rescue efforts. On Sunday, it all went down in the town of Paiporta.

TITLE: Results: A number of states have ballot measures about voting
SUMMARY: A number of states — including Arizona, Montana and Nevada — are voting on far-reaching changes to how their elections are run.

TITLE: Baby Haggis is the new Moo Deng: A pygmy hippo is born in Edinburgh
SUMMARY: The Royal Zoological Society of Scotland's Edinburgh Zoo announced their own tiny pygmy hippo, named Haggis, was born Oct. 30. The newborn, female calf is "doing well," according to zoo staff.

TITLE: Who does Russia want in Washington?
SUMMARY: Russia's Vladimir Putin says he endorses Vice President Harris, with a wink and a nod. “Russia likes that Donald Trump says he wants to improve relations between America and Russia,” one expert says.

TITLE: How are social media preparing for the election? With many guardrails off
SUMMARY: Tech platforms have stepped back from many of the more aggressive measures they took to curb the spread of election rumors and falsehoods four years ago. But some platforms still have safeguards.

TITLE: Voters could make recreational weed legal in a majority of U.S. states
SUMMARY: Voters in three states will decide whether to legalize recreational use. Earlier this year, Pew reported that 88% of U.S. adults said marijuana should be legal for medical or recreational use.

TITLE: Benjamin Netanyahu fires Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, replaces him with Israel Katz
SUMMARY: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed his popular defense minister, Yoav Gallant, in a surprise announcement.

TITLE: Baby black-footed ferrets first to be born to a cloned mom
SUMMARY: Black-footed ferrets are one of the most endangered mammals in North America with only an estimated 370 in the wild, according to the World Wildlife Fund.

TITLE: Follow NPR for 2024 election night coverage
SUMMARY: Tune in to NPR starting at 7 p.m. ET on Nov. 5 as polls begin to close, and stay with us throughout the night as results come in.

TITLE: Hurricane Rafael forms in the Caribbean Sea and expected to enter the Gulf of Mexico
SUMMARY: An active 2024 Atlantic Hurricane season continues as Rafael strengthens into a category 1 storm. It's expected to batter Cayman Islands and Cuba before swinging into the Gulf of Mexico.

TITLE: Republican Mike Braun wins Indiana governor’s race
SUMMARY: The first-term senator’s campaign pitch centered on his experience starting and growing an auto parts business into a multi-million-dollar company.

TITLE: Photos: See what Election Day looked like across the country
SUMMARY: The final day of election season is coming to an end as polling stations around the U.S. close. See what Election Day looked like across the country.

TITLE: Hours are extended for certain Georgia polling places after threats
SUMMARY: Voting hours have been extended by up to 45 minutes at five locations in Georgia's Fulton County, after hoax bomb threats that officials tied to Russian sources.

TITLE: North Carolina’s Josh Stein wins race for governor over Mark Robinson
SUMMARY: <strong> Stein is the current attorney general and he noted his work winning opioid settlements. But it was controversy over Robinson’s inflammatory rhetoric that dominated the race.

TITLE: Russia, Iran and China are all trying to sway American voters this election
SUMMARY: America's geopolitical adversaries, particularly Russia, Iran and China, have been active in trying to influence the election, as part of their larger goals to sow chaos and discredit democracy.

TITLE: Which states are swing states? Here are the results to watch this year
SUMMARY: Seven states have been the focus for pollsters and campaigns in this presidential election: The "Blue Wall" and the Sun Belt.

TITLE: Jim Justice wins West Virginia Senate race, flipping seat for Republicans
SUMMARY: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice has won the state’s open Senate seat, according to a race call by the Associated Press, giving Republicans a boost in their fight to regain control of the chamber.

TITLE: You've heard of swing states. Here are 7 swing counties to watch
SUMMARY: Here seven counties to watch — one in each swing state — that might give some idea how the race is going and why one candidate or the other won:

TITLE: How many electoral votes does California hold? 54. Its polls close soon
SUMMARY: California has 54 electoral votes, the most of any state. It's among the last states to close its polls on Election Night.

TITLE: Colorado voters move to put existing abortion laws into state constitution
SUMMARY: Already a regional hub for abortion access, the vote is an example of states that are trying to strengthen their laws for reproductive rights.

TITLE: New York votes to put abortion rights in the state constitution
SUMMARY: Abortion rights are part of a sweeping amendment preventing various forms of discrimination.

TITLE: Sarah McBride becomes the first openly transgender person elected to Congress
SUMMARY: Delaware state Sen. Sarah McBride is once again making history — she will be the first openly transgender person to serve in the U.S. Congress.

TITLE: Abortion will be protected in the Maryland state constitution
SUMMARY: Abortion is already legal in Maryland. Passing the amendment means that voters have made it much more difficult for lawmakers to restrict abortion in the future.

TITLE: Project 2025 keeps coming up this election. What is it?
SUMMARY: Project 2025 refers to a controversial plan drafted by the conservative Heritage Foundation to overhaul the U.S. government.

TITLE: Florida recreational marijuana measure falls short
SUMMARY: The policy would have authorized the state’s medical marijuana growers and retailers to sell to consumers.

TITLE: Florida amendment to expand abortion access fails. A six-week ban remains
SUMMARY: The vote faced a 60% threshold, and the failure leaves abortion banned across most of the South beyond six weeks of pregnancy — when many still don't realize they're pregnant.

TITLE: FBI reports new hoax videos, after warnings that Russia is trying to undermine election
SUMMARY: The FBI says three statements claiming to be from the agency are in fact a hoax. America's geopolitical adversaries have been active in trying to influence the election.

TITLE: Democrat Bob Ferguson wins Washington governor's race
SUMMARY: Washington state elects Bob Ferguson as governor. Ferguson, a Democrat, rose to national prominence as the state attorney general, suing the Trump administration nearly 100 times.

TITLE: Missouri voters back amendment to end abortion ban
SUMMARY: Missouri’s current law bans abortion with almost no exceptions and this amendment would allow abortion to about 24 weeks of pregnancy.

TITLE: Trump wins North Carolina in sharp blow to Harris campaign
SUMMARY: It is a crucial win for the former president, who carried the state twice before.

TITLE: Republican Kelly Ayotte wins New Hampshire governor
SUMMARY: Republican Kelly Ayotte wins the race for governor in New Hampshire over Democrat Joyce Craig in what was described as the most competitive race for governor in the country this year.

TITLE: Republican Kelly Ayotte wins New Hampshire governor
SUMMARY: Republican Kelly Ayotte wins the race for governor in New Hampshire over Democrat Joyce Craig in what was described as the most competitive race for governor in the country this year.

TITLE: Colorado voters protect same-sex marriage, California and Hawaii still voting
SUMMARY: In Colorado, voters have passed Amendment J, repealing a ban on same-sex unions passed in 2006, according to a call by The Associated Press.

TITLE: Harris wins California and its 54 electoral votes. All eyes are on swing states
SUMMARY: The Associated Press has called California for Vice President Kamala Harris, giving her a sizeable influx of electoral votes.

TITLE: Trump clinches a key victory in swing state Georgia
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has won Georgia and its 16 electoral votes, according to a race call by the Associated Press.

TITLE: Republicans will control the U.S. Senate
SUMMARY: With the race call for Nebraska's GOP Sen. Deb Fischer, Republicans have successfully flipped control of the Senate, which Democrats currently control 51-49.

TITLE: The 'blue wall' is Harris' last hope for a path to victory
SUMMARY: Kamala Harris' narrowing path to electoral victory appears to have come down to the "blue wall" states of Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin.

TITLE: Two Black women will serve together in the Senate for the first time
SUMMARY: Angela Alsobrooks of Maryland and Lisa Blunt Rochester of Delaware, both Democrats, won their Senate races on Tuesday — doubling the number of Black women who have been elected to the chamber.

TITLE: Bernie Moreno clinches Ohio Senate seat in big win for Republicans
SUMMARY: It is a major victory for Republicans and a serious blow to Democrats’ efforts to maintain their majority in the Senate.

TITLE: Former DACA recipient wins New Mexico legislative seat, making history
SUMMARY: Cindy Nava came to the U.S. when she was 7 years old. She says she ran for the Albuquerque-area seat to boost political representation of the state's Hispanic-majority population.

TITLE: Trump has won 2 Sunbelt states. Now, the 'Blue Wall' is Harris' best shot
SUMMARY: Harris' narrowing path to electoral victory appears to come down to the "Blue Wall" states of Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin.

TITLE: Nevadans take first step to protecting abortion in state constitution
SUMMARY: The proposal would guarantee abortion access until fetal viability and to protect the life of the pregnant person. It will need to pass again in 2026 to be fully approved.

TITLE: Arizona voters approve GOP-backed immigration measure
SUMMARY: It’s already illegal under federal law to cross into the United States outside of legal ports of entry. The Arizona measure would allow local police to arrest undocumented migrants.

TITLE: South Dakota rejects effort to protect reproductive rights in the state constitution
SUMMARY: South Dakota voters rejected an abortion rights amendment to the state constitution, according to a call by the Associated Press. Anti-abortion groups called the proposal ‘too extreme.’

TITLE: Trump declares victory in White House race, ahead of AP call
SUMMARY: Flanked by family and staff, Trump spoke to a convention center ballroom crowd in West Palm Beach after Fox News had projected that he had won — but before the Associated Press called the race.

TITLE: Trump wins Pennsylvania, delivering harsh blow to Harris campaign
SUMMARY: Securing the state’s 19 electoral votes is a major victory for Trump and a major blow to Vice President Harris.

TITLE: Arizona voters pass constitutional amendment guaranteeing abortion access
SUMMARY: Arizona’s 15-week abortion ban is expected to fall once the new constitutional amendment goes into effect. But there are dozens of other laws on the books regulating abortion.

TITLE: Nebraska voters opt to keep 12-week abortion ban in place
SUMMARY: Nebraska voters faced opposing abortion proposals on the ballot and chose to keep the state’s current law and enshrine it into the constitution.

TITLE: Donald Trump has won the presidential election and will return to the White House
SUMMARY: Becoming just the second president to be defeated and then reelected to a subsequent term, former President Donald Trump defeated Vice President Harris and will be the 47th president.

TITLE: Most states that considered abortion rights amendments approved them
SUMMARY: Ten states considered adding language guaranteeing abortion rights in their state constitutions during this year’s elections. Voters in seven of the states approved the ballot questions. Three rejected them.

TITLE: Trump wins a second term. And, Republicans reclaim Senate control
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has won a second presidential term. The GOP now controls the Senate, while control of the House remains too close to call. And, 10 states voted on reproductive rights.

TITLE: Montanans vote to codify abortion access in the state constitution
SUMMARY: Despite opposition from Republican Gov. Greg Gianforte, and others, Montanans vote to protect reproductive rights in the state constitution.

TITLE: How Trump won a second term as president in 2024
SUMMARY: Trump’s overall closing focus on the economy and immigration ultimately resonated with enough Americans — more than the message delivered by Harris, who called for unity and warned that Trump was a “petty tyrant” who was obsessed with revenge.

TITLE: Here's how minimum wage and paid sick leave measures fared in the election
SUMMARY: Some red states approved ballot measures to raise the minimum wage and require employers to provide paid sick time to their workers.

TITLE: The Dow Jones jumps over 1,300 points after Trump wins the election
SUMMARY: Wall Street, crypto investors, and shareholders in Trump Media are all cheering the election results.

TITLE: Here's where voters approved a tax hike to help pay for child care
SUMMARY: Voters approved tax hikes to help fund child care for low-income families in the Austin, Texas, and Sonoma County, Calif. A similar measure in St. Paul, Minn., failed.

TITLE: The next Congress will face an urgent to-do list. But how productive will it be?
SUMMARY: The 118th Congress is on track to be the least productive in modern history. If Washington enters a new season of divided government next year, as seems likely, Congress could get even less done.

TITLE: Netanyahu could take steps to end wars after Trump's win, Middle East officials say
SUMMARY: Officials throughout the Middle East welcomed Donald Trump’s victory — amid anticipation and anxiety across the region over how he could change the course of the wars raging from Gaza to Lebanon and beyond.

TITLE: Vice President Harris will deliver remarks at 4 p.m. ET at Howard University
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris will deliver remarks at 4 p.m. ET at Howard University in Washington, D.C., according to the White House.

TITLE: RFK Jr. discusses potential role in the Trump administration and health policy vision
SUMMARY: NPR’s Pien Huang weighs in on RFK Jr.’s skepticism of conventional public health expertise and his recommendation to remove fluoride from the drinking water.

TITLE: Massachusetts voters reject proposal to legalize certain psychedelic drugs
SUMMARY: After Oregon and Colorado legalized the use of certain psychedelic drugs over the past few years, voters in Massachusetts rejected a similar proposal.

TITLE: Bomb threats disrupted what was otherwise relatively smooth voting on Election Day
SUMMARY: Bomb threats that U.S. officials linked to Russian email domains disrupted what was generally a smooth voting experience across America on Election Day.

TITLE: What Trump's first 100 days in office could look like
SUMMARY: Trump’s goal is to unwind Biden’s policies and resume where he left off after his first term. He has promised to close the border and launch the largest domestic deportation operation in U.S. history.

TITLE: Here's what Trump 2.0 means for the economy, from tariffs to mass deportations.
SUMMARY: Trump has promised to cut taxes and government regulations, slap tariffs on imports and order large deportations of immigrants. Here's how that could impact the economy

TITLE: RFK Jr. says that Trump will recommend getting rid of fluoride in drinking water
SUMMARY: In an interview with NPR's Steve Inskeep this morning, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said that the Trump administration, which he will likely be a part of, will recommend removing fluoride from the country’s drinking water.

TITLE: Trump’s victory promises to shake up U.S. energy and climate policy, analysts and activists say
SUMMARY: Despite Donald Trump’s focus on fossil fuels, his return to the White House won’t derail clean energy, analysts and activists say.

TITLE: How health care could change under the new Trump administration
SUMMARY: Trump's victory gives a broader platform to critics of federal health programs. Among other moves, he may try to weaken the Affordable Care Act and cut funding for Medicaid coverage.

TITLE: In New York, immigration weighed heavily and divisively among immigrants themselves
SUMMARY: For months, Donald Trump and his campaign have been promising mass deportations. In a city that has received some 200,000 new migrants in the last two years, that promise has resonated among some.

TITLE: Here's what Trump 2.0 means for the economy, from tariffs to mass deportations
SUMMARY: Trump has promised to cut taxes and government regulations, slap tariffs on imports and order large deportations of immigrants. Here's how that could impact the economy.

TITLE: Harris has called Trump to concede the election
SUMMARY: The vice president called Trump to congratulate him on his victory ahead of planned remarks at 4 p.m. ET at Howard University in Washington, D.C.

TITLE: Special Counsel Jack Smith taking steps to wind down federal cases against Trump
SUMMARY: Special Counsel Jack Smith is taking steps to end both federal cases against Trump before the president-elect takes office, according to a source familiar with the Justice Department deliberations.

TITLE: What’s the world saying about Trump’s win? Here are the leaders who’ve commented
SUMMARY: Leaders from around the world congratulated Donald Trump on his presidential election victory, as governments prepare for his return to the White House and the potential impact that will have.

TITLE: Roughly 160 ballot initiatives were voted on this election. Here's what voters decided
SUMMARY: Measures appeared on the ballot in 41 states and focused on issues ranging from abortion access, to noncitizen voting and marijuana legalization, to legalization of some psychedelics.

TITLE: Where things stand in the race for control of Washington
SUMMARY: Donald Trump will again take the White House, according to calls by the Associated Press in key states, and he appears to be on track to do so with full control of the political levers in Washington.

TITLE: Germany's governing coalition is headed for collapse after Scholz fires finance chief
SUMMARY: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has fired Finance Minister Christian Lindner, paving the way for a confidence vote by parliament in January that is expected to lead to early elections next March.

TITLE: How personality trumped policy in this media election cycle
SUMMARY: President-elect Trump has excelled at creating his own media image, from his earliest days as a real estate baron. His supporters find him entertaining and feisty, and even critics find it difficult not to talk about him.

TITLE: Special counsel Jack Smith taking steps to wind down federal cases against Trump
SUMMARY: Special counsel Jack Smith is taking steps to end both federal cases against Trump before the president-elect takes office, according to a source familiar with the Justice Department deliberations.

TITLE: Thousands in Southern California told to evacuate as wind-fed wildfire spreads
SUMMARY: The Mountain Fire, northwest of Los Angeles, destroyed dozens of homes and forced thousands of residents to flee as forecasters warned of the potential for “extreme and life-threatening” blazes.

TITLE: Amazon ordered to let workers vote on unionizing -- for the 3rd time
SUMMARY: A federal administrative law judge says Amazon interfered in the last election on unionization at its warehouse in Bessemer, Ala.

TITLE: Who's sending Trump back to the White House and why?
SUMMARY:
In the days leading up to election night, news outlets across the country were predicting a historically close race, one that could take days to call.

But as election night progressed, it became clear former President Donald Trump was on a path to victory. So much so, that before anything was official, he thanked his supporters from his campaign headquarters in West Palm Beach.

And then, Wednesday morning at about 5:30, it became official when the Associated Press called Wisconsin for Trump. We're still awaiting final tallies, but it appears Trump is on track to win the popular vote for the first time.

Trump's agenda for a second term will be dissected over and over in the days ahead. Today, we break down how America sent him back to office --- how Trump won in 2024.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: Where things stand in the 2024 election
SUMMARY: Donald Trump will again take the White House, according to calls by the Associated Press in key states, and he appears to be on track to do so with full control of the political levers in Washington.

TITLE: Germany's coalition government collapses as Chancellor Scholz fires his finance chief
SUMMARY: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has fired Finance Minister Christian Lindner, paving the way for a confidence vote by parliament in January that is expected to lead to early elections next March.

TITLE: Cuba's power grid goes down as Hurricane Rafael plows across island
SUMMARY: The Category 3 storm knocked out the country's entire power grid just before making landfall, making it almost impossible for people to receive radio or television updates.

TITLE: Canada orders TikTok's Canadian business to be dissolved but won't block app
SUMMARY: Industry Minister François-Philippe Champagne said the decision to dissolve TikTok of its Canadian business  is meant to address risks perceived to be related to TikTok's Chinese parent company.

TITLE: Australia proposes social media ban for children under the age of 16
SUMMARY: If the legislation is passed, social media platforms including X, TikTok, Instagram and Facebook would have one year to work out how to exclude Australian children.

TITLE: Not going back: how Harris failed to turn the page on Trump in her 107-day sprint
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris started her 107-day race buoyed by Democratic optimism, but came up short against former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: Trump won. Here are 3 Biden priorities under scrutiny
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to roll back some of President Biden's signature policies. Here's what Trump's victory means for Biden policies on climate, the civil service and Ukraine.

TITLE: Australian breakdancer Raygun is retiring from the sport after her Olympics backlash
SUMMARY: Raygun, whose real name is Rachael Gunn, said she had a hard time handling the criticism she received online about her performance. She said she will still dance leisurely.

TITLE: Howard University students disappointed but resilient after Harris' election loss
SUMMARY: Vice President Harris has credited her alma mater Howard University for her achievements,

TITLE: We checked up on the states that promise transparency on opioid settlement funds
SUMMARY: Victims of the opioid crisis, health advocates, and  policy experts have called on state and local governments to clearly report how they’re using the funds they are receiving from settlements with opioid companies.

TITLE: How Trump regained the White House. And, where the federal cases against him stand
