SUMMARY: Abortion restrictions, taxes and everyday issues are among the laws Kansas Republicans have imposed through their "supermajority" in the Legislature. Democrats aim to end its reign.

TITLE: Trump names longtime election attorney Bill McGinley as his White House counsel
SUMMARY: As White House Counsel, McGinley will be the point legal adviser for the president in regards to ethics, oversight and judicial nominations. He served as cabinet secretary during Trump's first term.

TITLE: Georgia counties certify the election, as fraud claims dissipate after Trump win
SUMMARY: Every county in Georgia has certified its general election results. There had been concerns about election certification, but with Donald Trump's victory, those worries have largely gone away.

TITLE: Trump to nominate Fox News host Pete Hegseth to be Defense Secretary
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump has announced he will nominate Fox News host Pete Hegseth to serve as Secretary of Defense. Hegseth is also a combat veteran who has long advocated for veterans.

TITLE: My Little Pony, Transformers, Phase 10  join the National Toy Hall of Fame
SUMMARY: The three 1980s staples are new National Toy Hall of Fame inductees. Hess Toy Trucks, the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the trampoline, and balloons were among the finalists.

TITLE: Trump will nominate South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem for homeland security secretary
SUMMARY: The two-term governor of South Dakota has been a loyal Trump ally. In her new role, Noem would oversee immigration, an issue Trump campaigned heavily on.

TITLE: Trump taps Musk to lead a 'Department of Government Efficiency' with Ramaswamy
SUMMARY: President-elect Trump announced a "Department of Government Efficiency," or DOGE, that will be led by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy, focused on shrinking the federal government.

TITLE: Trump to nominate Fox News host Pete Hegseth to be defense secretary
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump has announced he will nominate Fox News host Pete Hegseth to serve as secretary of defense. Hegseth is a combat veteran who has long advocated for veterans.

TITLE: President-elect Trump names John Ratcliffe as his pick for CIA director
SUMMARY: Ratcliffe previously served as the director of national intelligence during Trump's first term, where he oversaw all 18 of the nation's intelligence agencies.

TITLE: Israeli strikes kill dozens in the Gaza Strip and Lebanon, medics say
SUMMARY: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 46 people in the Gaza Strip in the past day, medics said. In Lebanon, warplanes struck Beirut's southern suburbs and killed 33 people in the country on Tuesday.

TITLE: US prohibits airlines from flying to Haiti after planes were shot by gangs
SUMMARY: The shootings were part of a wave of violence that erupted as the country plagued by gang violence swore in its new prime minister after a politically tumultuous process.

TITLE: U.S. prohibits airlines from flying to Haiti after planes were shot by gangs
SUMMARY: The shootings were part of a wave of violence that erupted as the country plagued by gang violence swore in its new prime minister after a politically tumultuous process.

TITLE: What happens when a vaccine skeptic leads health policy? Ask Florida
SUMMARY: Among the names being floated to head the Department of Health and Human Services are RFK Jr. and Florida Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo. Both are vaccine skeptics, which worries pediatricians.

TITLE: The USS Edsall, sunk by Japanese forces in World War II, has been found
SUMMARY: The USS Edsall was overpowered by a Japanese fleet in the Indian Ocean but fought valiantly to the end, the U.S. Navy said. It was found in deep waters south of Australia's Christmas Island.

TITLE: In Lebanon, residents fear Hezbollah could be hiding among people displaced by war
SUMMARY: A neighborhood watch group in a Christian Beirut neighborhood is on the lookout for militant operatives, which could make the area a target for Israeli airstrikes.

TITLE: 'Jump ball' for Alex Jones' media empire as it hits the auction block today
SUMMARY: Live bidding will be private, and the future owner of Jones' company will be public once court papers are filed. The proceeds will go to pay Sandy Hook families who won defamation cases against Jones.

TITLE: Trump meets Biden in the Oval Office today. It's a tradition Trump skipped in 2020
SUMMARY: President Biden called his predecessor — now, successor — a threat to democracy. Today he'll sit side by side with President-elect Trump as part of the ceremony around a smooth transfer of power.

TITLE: Nintendo has launched a music app, seizing on the appeal of video game playlists
SUMMARY: The Nintendo Music app lets you listen to dozens of hours of music from games like Mario, Zelda and Donkey Kong.

TITLE: Analyzing Trump's cabinet picks so far. And, Biden's intimate view of the White House
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump has made a flurry of announcements about key cabinet members, at least one of which has come as a shock. And, President Biden provides an intimate view of the White House.

TITLE: Pakistan's smog is visible from space. This activist is 'frustrated' but won't give up
SUMMARY: The government in Lahore has closed schools and public spaces and shut down factories. Environmental lawyer Ahmad Rafay Alam shares his perspective: "frustrated" but still fighting.

TITLE: Trump would like to bring back mental institutions, but experts are skeptical
SUMMARY: Permanent tent cities are another idea Trump has for dealing with people who are unhoused. Sequestering people with mental illness or substance abuse in one place has been tried, an expert says, and "it turns into hell on earth."

TITLE: Small fossil has big implications for bird brain evolution
SUMMARY: Birds descended from the dinosaurs, but researchers have known relatively little about how the bird's brain took shape over millions of years. A new fossil sheds light on that mystery.

TITLE: Biden and Xi will meet on Saturday, the 3rd and likely final time during Biden's term
SUMMARY: This is likely to be their final meeting before President Biden leaves office. Biden sees it as a chance to reflect on the "tough relationship" between the two countries, an official said.

TITLE: Republicans choose John Thune as next Senate majority leader
SUMMARY: Senate Republicans have chosen Sen. John Thune, R-S.D., as the next party leader, launching a new era for the GOP after nearly two decades with Sen. Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., leading the party in the Senate.

TITLE: From high tariffs to isolation, what a 2nd Trump term might mean for foreign policy
SUMMARY: With wars raging around the world and high tariffs looming, Economist editor-in-chief Zanny Minton Beddoes says Trump's agenda may be chaotic — but she remains optimistic about possible good elements.

TITLE: Watch Live: Experts testify at UFO hearing in Congress
SUMMARY: A similar hearing last year brought extraordinary moments, including a retired intelligence officer alleging that the U.S. government has recovered nonhuman "biologics" from crash sites.

TITLE: Outside: vinyl siding. Inside: a bear
SUMMARY: In Pittsburgh, entire houses have been converted into individual art installations filled with unusual objects. A new house is now open.

TITLE: 'Apprehensive and fearful': Federal workers await a dismantling under Trump
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to "dismantle government bureaucracy," enlisting the help of billionaires to achieve his goals. Federal workers with memories of Trump's first term are scared.

TITLE: Experts testify at UFO hearing in Congress
SUMMARY: A similar hearing last year brought extraordinary moments, including a retired intelligence officer alleging that the U.S. government has recovered nonhuman "biologics" from crash sites.

TITLE: Trump names former Rep. Tulsi Gabbard for director of national intelligence
SUMMARY: The former Democratic congresswoman has shifted her political allegiance in recent years, going from a candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2020 to a stalwart Trump supporter.

TITLE: Trump announces he will nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz to be attorney general
SUMMARY: In a post on Truth Social announcing the nomination of Gaetz, Trump said: "Few issues in America are more important than ending the partisan Weaponization of our Justice System."

TITLE: "I was shocked." Lawmakers react to Gaetz pick to be Trump's attorney general
SUMMARY: Trump intends to nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general and former Democratic Rep. Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence, surprising many lawmakers who will have to confirm them.

TITLE: University of Rochester investigates 'Wanted' posters accusing staff of Gaza war crimes
SUMMARY: The posters, which appeared across campus, accuse university faculty of being complicit in war crimes against Palestinians in Gaza. The university president condemned the posters as antisemitic.

TITLE: Russia and North Korea Vow to Defend One Another
SUMMARY: North Korea and Russia each ratified a mutual defense treaty within days of each other. The pact means the countries will defend one another if attacked. And some say it may mean more involvement by North Korea in the war between Russia and Ukraine. We hear about the ramifications from our correspondent in Seoul.

TITLE: Fed up with high prices? Here's where things stand with inflation
SUMMARY: Inflation remains substantially lower than it did during its 2022 peak — but Americans are still frustrated with high prices.

TITLE: Trump announces Matt Gaetz as attorney general pick
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump announced his pick for one of the biggest jobs in his new administration: attorney general. And for that job, Trump has chosen Florida Congressman Matt Gaetz.

TITLE: 'I was shocked': Lawmakers react to Gaetz pick to be Trump's attorney general
SUMMARY: Trump intends to nominate Rep. Matt Gaetz as attorney general and former Democratic Rep. Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence, surprising many lawmakers who will have to confirm them.

TITLE: Shaboozey's 'A Bar Song (Tipsy)' hits another pop chart milestone
SUMMARY: "A Bar Song (Tipsy)" added another week atop the chart, making it the longest-running No. 1 of the decade. In two more weeks, it could tie the all-time record, but a seasonal juggernaut approaches.

TITLE: Remembering Ted Olson, a titan of the law
SUMMARY: Ted Olson, the Bush-era solicitor general, has died at age 84. He was a towering figure in the legal profession who argued 65 cases at the Supreme Court as solicitor general and as a private lawyer.

TITLE: Trump to nominate Florida's Matt Gaetz to be attorney general
SUMMARY: In a post on Truth Social announcing the nomination of Gaetz, Trump said: "Few issues in America are more important than ending the partisan Weaponization of our Justice System." Gaetz said he would resign from the U.S. House of Representatives, effective immediately.

TITLE: Republicans retain their hold of the House, clinching full control of Congress
SUMMARY: Republicans have officially won a full trifecta of power in Washington, D.C., following GOP victories in several key U.S. House contests.

TITLE: Australia will require social media platforms to act to prevent online harm to users
SUMMARY: Australia plans to require social media platforms to act to prevent online harms to users such as bullying, predatory behavior and algorithms pushing destructive content, the government said Thursday.

TITLE: 'Dad, is the world going to end?' How to talk to your kids about the election
SUMMARY: Many parents are grappling with how to talk to even to their young children about the election. Experts offer tips on how to start the difficult conversation.

TITLE: When will greenhouse gas emissions finally peak? Could be soon
SUMMARY: Fossil fuel emissions have increased steadily for almost two centuries. Now, the world may soon reach an important turning point for climate change.

TITLE: What a Trump presidency might mean for student loan forgiveness
SUMMARY: Several of President Biden's efforts at loan relief are in jeopardy, including a repayment plan with millions of borrowers waiting in limbo.

TITLE: These matchmakers connect teens and elders. The friendships benefit both sides
SUMMARY: Groups that connect elders and teens — both in real life and online — have a new sense of urgency in the loneliness epidemic.

TITLE: Trump's attorney general pick. And, what if the Department of Education is scrapped
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump has picked Matt Gaetz for attorney general. Here's what we know about him. And, a look at the possible consequences of eliminating the Department of Education.

TITLE: Instead of sodas, these vending machines offer needles and Narcan to fight overdoses
SUMMARY: Groups trying to reduce overdose deaths and the spread of infectious diseases are using vending machines to get clean needles, pipes, wound care kits, Narcan and other safety supplies to drug users.

TITLE: The Onion wins auction for Alex Jones' media company
SUMMARY: The sale must be approved by a bankruptcy judge. Proceeds will go to paying down the $1.5 billion debt that Jones owes families of Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims who won two defamation suits against him.

TITLE: In northern Israel, migrant workers are farming while under fire from Hezbollah
SUMMARY: Foreign laborers, many from Thailand, are tending fields and livestock in an area Israel has declared off-limits to its own civilians amid ongoing military operations against Hezbollah.

TITLE: Any tips on having difficult conversations during the holidays? We want to hear
SUMMARY: The holidays are fast approaching. Some politically divisive conversations could happen after this recent presidential election. What are your tips to help navigate them?

TITLE: Will Spotify's AI DJ make you listen longer?
SUMMARY: The music streamer's AI DJ feature offers personalized playlists with a warm AI voice that gives context to song picks.

TITLE: Lindsey Vonn announces a comeback at 40, saying she's ready to race
SUMMARY: The record-setting skier once notched speeds that would be illegal on most U.S. highways — until knee injuries slowed her down and she retired in 2019. Now Vonn says she's ready to return to racing.

TITLE: Stargazers can see the final supermoon of the year  this weekend
SUMMARY: The next supermoon — which appears larger and brighter than a regular full moon due to its proximity to Earth — will not be visible for nearly a year.

TITLE: Senate Republicans concerned with Gaetz nomination ask to access House ethics probe
SUMMARY: Senators are calling for access to a House Ethics Committee probe into former Rep. Matt Gaetz, R-Fla., following his nomination to be the next Attorney General under president-elect Donald Trump.

TITLE: Florida sues FEMA for discrimination accusing it of denying aid to Trump supporters
SUMMARY: Fla. Attorney General Ashley Moody is suing Federal Emergency Management Agency Administrator Deanne Criswell, and a former FEMA supervisor for violating Floridians' civil rights after hurricanes.

TITLE: They told insurers a bear damaged their car. But it was actually a person in a costume
SUMMARY: Four LA residents allegedly defrauded multiple insurance companies of over $141,000. A wildlife expert who reviewed footage of the incidents said that the culprit was "clearly a human in a bear suit."

TITLE: How the CDC could change under the next Trump administration
SUMMARY: If the new administration embraces proposals to cut the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's budget and its mission, the public health agency could look very different than it does today.

TITLE: Trump picks RFK Jr. for health role
SUMMARY: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. — a former presidential candidate who has a history of spreading conspiracy theories, including about vaccines — is poised to have a key health role in the Trump administration.

TITLE: Targets of Trump's threats brace for the new administration
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump repeatedly promised to investigate, prosecute, imprison or otherwise punish his perceived enemies during his campaign. Now, some of his targets are preparing.

TITLE: 'Historic' drop in U.S. overdose deaths accelerates as fentanyl crisis eases
SUMMARY: A new CDC report shows at least 16,000 lives were saved over a 12-month period. Experts say the U.S. is experiencing the biggest drop in fatal overdoses seen since the opioid crisis began in the 90s.

TITLE: Oklahoma City cop is investigated for slamming 70-year-old man to the ground
SUMMARY: Lich Vu has been in the hospital since the Oct. 27 incident that left him with a brain bleed and a broken neck. The altercation with the police officer involved a dispute over a traffic ticket.

TITLE: Are debt collectors calling you about a zombie 2nd mortgage?
SUMMARY: Old loans that homeowners thought were long dead have been rising from the grave as debt buyers move to collect. Some are allegedly breaking the law. If this is happening to you, tell us your story.

TITLE: Argentina's Leader Celebrates Trump's Election; a Possible New Country in Europe
SUMMARY: In Argentina, President Javier Milei is celebrating both the success of this radical cost cutting in lowering inflation and the re-election of Donald Trump in the U.S. The ultra-libertarian has said that he wants to "make Argentina great again" and is travelling to Florida to congratulate Trump in person. We hear how Argentinians are reacting.

TITLE: Trump picks RFK Jr. to oversee the Department of Health and Human Services
SUMMARY: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. — a former presidential candidate who has a history of spreading conspiracy theories, including about vaccines — is poised to have a key health role in the Trump administration.

TITLE: Trump names former Georgia congressman Doug Collins as his pick to lead the VA
SUMMARY: Collins served in the House from 2013 to 2021 and was a key defender of the president-elect during his first impeachment proceedings.

TITLE: Texas company, supervisor indicted in fatal 2021 trench collapse
SUMMARY: A Bastrop, Texas, man was working in a trench when it collapsed. He died a week later.

TITLE: Trump picks his lawyer, Todd Blanche, as deputy attorney general
SUMMARY: Blanche, a former federal prosecutor, represented Trump in several of his legal cases, including in his landmark federal conviction in New York.

TITLE: Trump picks North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum to lead the Interior Department
SUMMARY: Burgum ran in the 2024 Republican presidential primary. He then became a vocal supporter of Preesident-elect Donald Trump and was shortlisted for the GOP vice presidential nomination.

TITLE: South Africa's government won't help the illegal miners inside a closed mine
SUMMARY: Miners are believed to be suffering from a lack of food, water and other basic necessities after police closed off the entrances used to transport supplies.

TITLE: Masses of residents flee homes in Haiti's capital as gangs ratchet up violence
SUMMARY: Violence has exploded in Port-au-Prince since Sunday when the Haiti's interim prime minister was fired amid political infighting.

TITLE: How to approach the holidays with people you deeply disagree with
SUMMARY: Code Switch weighs in on how to prepare for difficult political conversations and when to draw the line and uninvite yourself from that family potluck.

TITLE: Police welcome Trump's return to the White House
SUMMARY: Police officers backed Trump's reelection, but police reform advocates wonder what that will mean for police accountability

TITLE: The treaty between Russia and North Korea signals a new era on 2 continents
SUMMARY: The recently signed mutual defense treaty could be used to justify thewidening of the war in Ukraine, as the U.S. says North Korean and Russian troops are already battling Ukrainian forces.

TITLE: Outspent 4-to-1, Republicans still made gains in state legislative elections
SUMMARY: Despite outspending Republicans, Democrats didn't achieve some ambitious goals in state legislative races. The GOP continues to control more legislatures, though Democrats notched some victories.

TITLE: Don't give your family food poisoning this holiday season. Follow this illustrated guide
SUMMARY: Protect your loved ones from foodborne illnesses with this refresher course on food safety. Experts offer guidance on how long to leave food out, when to toss leftovers and more.

TITLE: What's behind defense secretary pick Hegseth's war on 'woke'
SUMMARY: The selection of Fox News host Pete Hegseth to lead the Trump Defense Department has renewed scrutiny of his political and religious views and his aggressive criticism of the military he would be leading.

TITLE: Sen. Chris Murphy: Democrats need to listen to working and poor people
SUMMARY: Steve Inskeep speaks with Senator Chris Murphy about how the democratic party rebuilds after its election loss.

TITLE: One thing Trump and Obama have in common: a fondness for 'czars'
SUMMARY: Trump is the latest president to appoint a czar to deal with a particular issue — in this case, the border. But what does that mean? A look at the controversial history of government czars.

TITLE: At Tiananmen Square, tight security with metal detectors reflects a changing China
SUMMARY: There's a police check to exit the subway, another to get in line, a third while standing in line, and metal detectors and X-ray machines before you finally reach the Beijing landmark.

TITLE: RFK Jr. tapped to run HHS. And, the bond market's impact on Trump's economic plans
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump taps RFK Jr. to run the Department of Health and Human Services. Here's why experts are worried. And, how the U.S. bond market could upend Trump's economic plans.

TITLE: He's 14. He loves soccer. He's the sole caregiver for his little twin brothers
SUMMARY: Mahamat Djouma is one of the millions displaced by the civil war in Sudan. He is part of an especially vulnerable group — unaccompanied minors. Here is his story.

TITLE: Is it OK to keep reheating leftovers? Honest questions about food safety, illustrated
SUMMARY: How real is the five-second rule? Am I going to get explosive diarrhea if I keep reheating the same leftovers? A refresher course on food safety ahead of the holiday season.

TITLE: What's going on with the 'magic' drug for malaria?
SUMMARY: The anti-malarial drug Artemisinin is highly effective. It's critical for kids, who are especially vulnerable. A new study comes to an alarming conclusion.

TITLE: What's behind defense secretary pick Hegseth's war on 'woke'
SUMMARY: The selection of Fox News host Pete Hegseth to lead the Trump Defense Department has renewed scrutiny of his political and religious views and his aggressive criticism of the military he'd be leading.

TITLE: RFK Jr. wants to 'Make America Healthy Again.' He could face a lot of pushback
SUMMARY: RFK Jr. wants to tackle chronic disease. Despite controversial views on vaccines, his focus on healthy food and taking on special interests may find broad support — and face political headwinds.

TITLE: Trump picks Steven Cheung to run White House communications
SUMMARY: Cheung, a former spokesperson for the Ultimate Fighting Championship, brought a cage fighter's spirit to speaking on behalf of Trump during the campaign.

TITLE: Animal rescuers evacuate a lion cub from war-torn Lebanon to South Africa
SUMMARY: The group Animals Lebanon says it rescued Sara the lion cub from abuse by a Lebanese social media influencer, kept it safe in Beirut and sent it to a wildlife sanctuary in South Africa.

TITLE: Gophers needed 1 day after Mount St. Helens erupted to bring explosions of new life
SUMMARY: Scientists say the pocket gophers were cranky about being moved into a devastated landscape for a day in 1980. But decades later, their short visit still has visible, and vibrant, effects.

TITLE: Trump claims he can bring peace to the world. In India, many believe him
SUMMARY: The world's most populous country has consistently favorable views of U.S. President-elect Trump. In a Pew Research Center poll, 42% of Indians, including 51% of men, said they had confidence in him.

TITLE: Mike Tyson was a heavyweight champ before Jake Paul was born. Tonight, they face off
SUMMARY: One is a YouTuber-turned-boxer. The other hasn't been back in the ring in nearly two decades. Tonight they'll fight in Texas.

TITLE: RFK Jr. isn't the only one. More than a billion people have parasitic worms
SUMMARY: Earlier this year, a surprising story emerged about RFK Jr. — the newly named nominee for secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services  — and a parasitic brain worm.

TITLE: The Price Israel and Lebanon are Each Paying for Their War on the Border
SUMMARY:
We bring you views from both sides of the conflict between Israel and Lebanon. Israel says they're closer to accomplishing their mission of pushing Hezbollah militants away from the border so that tens of thousands of Israelis can safely return to the area. Our correspondent visits the tense borderland and finds a dramatically changed landscape.

And in Lebanon, intense Israeli airstrikes since September have taken their toll. And recently, strikes have occurred deeper in the country, far away from the fighting, endangering and killing displaced Lebanese civilians. We go to the site of a recent attack.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

TITLE: Murder trial begins for man accused of killing Georgia student Laken Riley
SUMMARY: The 22-year-old nursing student's death fueled an emotional and politically charged debate over immigration and crime after authorities said the suspect was a man who entered the U.S. illegally.

TITLE: Why the White House hasn't benefited much from investing in infrastructure
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is touting the third anniversary of the bipartisan infrastructure law that pumped billions into roads, bridges, airports and more. But there's been little political benefit.

TITLE: Scientific American editor resigns after comments about Trump supporters went viral
SUMMARY: Laura Helmuth announced her resignation from the long-running magazine after her statements on election night regarding Trump sparked outrage among conservatives.

TITLE: Malcolm X's daughters sue the CIA, FBI and NYPD over the civil rights leader's assassination
SUMMARY: A $100 million lawsuit claims the agencies were aware of and were involved in the1965 assassination plot and failed to stop the killing of the civil rights leader.

TITLE: Trump nominates RFK Jr. to remake healthcare.
SUMMARY:
This week President-elect Donald Trump announced Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as his nominee to run the Department of Health and Human Services.

The nomination comes after Trump promised to let Kennedy "go wild on health" during the campaign.

Kennedy holds a number of controversial opinions on health, and promotes a number of scientifically debunked claims like vaccines cause autism, fluoride is poisoning the public water system and AIDS isn't caused by the HIV virus.

Kennedy has long wanted to remake health and healthcare policy in the United States. Soon, he may get his chance.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: Judge blocks Biden administration's rule to expand overtime pay for millions
SUMMARY: A federal judge in Texas has blocked a new rule from the Biden administration that would have expanded access to overtime pay to millions more salaried workers across the U.S.

TITLE: Trump picks Karoline Leavitt to be youngest White House press secretary in history
SUMMARY: Leavitt will be the youngest person to ever hold the job and is expected to deliver press briefings based on Trump's statement late Friday that he has "utmost confidence she will excel at the podium."

TITLE: Hegseth Fox and the Trump WH
SUMMARY: Pete Hegseth has positioned himself as a staunch public defender of President-elect Donald Trump on Fox's airwaves -- and is yet one more example of the Fox-to-Trump pipeline.

TITLE: With Hegseth, Trump finds another administration pick from Fox News
SUMMARY: Pete Hegseth has positioned himself as a staunch public defender of President-elect Donald Trump on Fox's airwaves -- and is yet one more example of the Fox-to-Trump pipeline.

TITLE: Germany's Scholz discusses Ukraine with Russia's Putin in first such call in 2 years
SUMMARY: The new communication between Scholz and Putin — their first since December 2022 — comes at a time of speculation about what the new administration of President-elect Trump will mean for Ukraine.

TITLE: Bullet strikes Southwest Airlines plane at Dallas Love Field Airport
SUMMARY: There were no reported injuries on the plane, which was struck while preparing for takeoff, Southwest Airlines said. The plane safely taxied back to the terminal after the incident.

TITLE: The NWSL rides a 'rocket ship' of interest in women's sports to a record-setting year
SUMMARY: Across the board, 2024 was a record year for women's sports. The WNBA saw record audiences. In college basketball, the women's March Madness tournament outdrew the men's. The NWSL was no exception.

TITLE: Women stock up on abortion pills and Plan B, fearing new restrictions under Trump
SUMMARY: Telehealth providers say requests for the pills have spiked since the election. Patients and doctors worry what a Trump presidency could mean for medical abortion and emergency contraception.

TITLE: Trump is creating team of loyalists after conflicts with Cabinet members in 1st term
SUMMARY: This time, it's all about loyalty. In his second term Trump is surrounding himself with people who can amplify his message and are simpatico with how he wants to remake the Executive Branch.

TITLE: How far can Trump go to get his nominees confirmed?
SUMMARY: If the Senate puts up a fight against President-elect Trump's demand for recess appointments, could Trump force Congress to adjourn and ram his nominees through anyway?

TITLE: Opinion: Uranus was having a bad hair day. Hey, it was the '80s!
SUMMARY: Scientists are reconsidering old information about Uranus. NPR's Scott Simon explains the problem with photos taken of the planet 38 years ago.

TITLE: Jake Paul beats 58-year-old Mike Tyson in a much-hyped Netflix boxing match
SUMMARY: Jake Paul won a unanimous decision over Mike Tyson as the hits didn't match the hype in a fight between a young YouTuber-turned-boxer and the 58-year-old former heavyweight champion.

TITLE: This county is the most religiously diverse in the U.S.
SUMMARY: This stretch of New Hampshire Avenue in Silver Spring, Maryland is so packed with houses of worship, it's been called the Embassy Row of Religions. But locals know it as the Highway to Heaven.

TITLE: Fire engulfs a hospital ward in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies
SUMMARY: A fire tore through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies and injuring 16 others, authorities said.

TITLE: In France, a family reckons with World War II Allies' legacy of rape and murder
SUMMARY: In 1944, as Allied troops celebrated D-Day victory, a French family experienced a trauma that would be felt for generations: a murder and sexual assault so traumatic they are only now coming to terms with it.

TITLE: Sixth beach house collapses in North Carolina's Outer Banks in the past 6 months
SUMMARY: The daily effects of strong winds, large waves, as well as rising sea levels — which are fueled by human-caused climate change — are causing beaches on the Outer Banks to wash away.

TITLE: A derogatory term for Native women will be removed from place names across California
SUMMARY: The word "squaw" was declared derogatory by the Department of Interior in 2021. Since then, hundreds of geographic features have been renamed with input from local tribes and Indigenous communities.

TITLE: Trump announces oil executive Chris Wright as his pick for energy secretary
SUMMARY: Trump announced Chris Wright, the CEO of oil and natural gas fracking services company Liberty Energy, as his pick for energy secretary.

TITLE: Biden and Xi take a first step to limit AI and nuclear decisions at their last meeting
SUMMARY: The leaders agreed that humans should control decisions to use nuclear weapons — not AI. And they talked about the importance of stability during the transition to a new U.S. administration.

TITLE: Scientists find a 35,000-year-old saber-toothed kitten in the Siberian permafrost
SUMMARY: The kitten, which was found in Russia's northeastern Sakha Republic, still had fur and whiskers when it was discovered.

TITLE: Russia launches massive attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Zelenskyy says
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Sunday that Russia launched 120 missiles and 90 drones in a large-scale attack across Ukraine, targeting its energy infrastructure.

TITLE: Some in the U.S. farm industry are alarmed by Trump's embrace of RFK Jr. and tariffs
SUMMARY: President-elect Trump won landslide support in much of farm country, but his embrace of Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his plan for a tariff fight with China alarms many farmers and agriculture experts.

TITLE: Trump picks loyalists for top jobs, testing loyalty of Senate GOP
SUMMARY: Nominees for several key Cabinet posts in the new administration of President-elect Trump caught officials in Washington off guard and ignited a firestorm of criticism — not all of it from Democrats.

TITLE: Local news is in crisis. This paper has a $150 million plan
SUMMARY: Nearly two years ago, the owners of Atlanta's leading newspaper hired former CNN executive Andrew Morse to reverse its steep decline. He's laid out a grand vision.

TITLE: Erykah Badu likes chasing unreachable goals. Here's why
SUMMARY: Erykah Badu opens up on <em>Wild Card

TITLE: The USPS will honor Betty White with her own stamp in 2025
SUMMARY: Having received hundreds to thousands of fan mail each week, it's only fitting to honor White with a postage stamp.

TITLE: Typhoon Man-yi lashes the Philippines, displacing hundreds of thousands
SUMMARY: A powerful typhoon forced hundreds of thousands of people to flee to emergency shelters as it cut across the northern Philippines on Sunday.

TITLE: A rare Israeli strike on central Beirut kills Hezbollah's spokesman, official says
SUMMARY: A rare Israeli airstrike on central Beirut killed Hezbollah's chief spokesman on Sunday, an official with the militant group said. Earlier, Israeli strikes killed at least 12 in the Gaza Strip.

TITLE: Russia launches 'massive' attack on Ukraine energy, killing at least seven
SUMMARY: Russia on Sunday launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine, described by officials as the largest over the past months, targeting energy infrastructure and killing civilians.

TITLE: An Israeli strike in northern Gaza kills at least 30, hospital director says
SUMMARY: A rare Israeli airstrike on central Beirut killed Hezbollah's chief spokesman Sunday, an official with the militant group said.

TITLE: In a first, Biden allows Ukraine to strike Russia with U.S. long-range weapons
SUMMARY: The U.S. is allowing Ukraine to use the powerful long-range weapons to strike in and around Kursk — the same region where some 10,000 North Korean troops were recently deployed.

TITLE: Biden marks his climate legacy during Amazon visit, asserting 'nobody' can reverse it
SUMMARY: "Some may seek to deny or delay the clean energy revolution that's underway in America, but nobody — nobody — can reverse it," Biden said. But Trump has vowed to roll back those plans.

TITLE: From Trump opponent to Trump loyalist: The evolution of Marco Rubio
SUMMARY:
When compared to some of president-elect Trump's other cabinet picks, Senator Marco Rubio for Secretary of State is a pretty conventional choice.

He's a veteran politician who served on the foreign relations and intelligence committees for over a decade, and he's been a loyal Trump backer throughout this year's campaign.

But when you look back at Marco Rubio during his 2016 presidential campaign, there's a striking contrast.

When he ran against Trump in 2016, Rubio called him a con artist, and described his style of leadership as dangerous. Now, he's going to work for him.

Marco Rubio's political evolution is indicative of how the Republican Party has remade itself around Donald Trump, and it gives some clues about how he may operate as the nation's top diplomat.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

TITLE: No planes and no 'spoilers.' How one man trekked from Egypt to Japan without flying
SUMMARY: Omar Nok is at the finish line of a 28,000-mile zig-zag route that began in February. Here's how he approached the adventure, without setting foot on a plane.

TITLE: Bela Karolyi, legendary and controversial gymnastics coach, dies at 82
SUMMARY: Bela Karolyi coached several renowned gymnasts, including Mary Lou Retton, Kerri Strug and Julianne McNamara. But he was known for harsh methods of training.

TITLE: Senior Hezbollah official is killed in Israeli airstrike
SUMMARY: In Lebanon, a senior Hezbollah official has been killed in an Israeli airstrike. The official was head of the militant group's media operations.

TITLE: Author Patrick Radden Keefe talks about the making of the new series 'Say Nothing'
SUMMARY: NPR's Scott Detrow talks to author and journalist Patrick Radden Keefe about turning his best selling book into the brand new limited series "Say Nothing," out now on Hulu.

TITLE: E. coli outbreak linked to organic carrots sickens people in 18 states
SUMMARY: Grimmway Farms recalled an array of its organic whole and baby carrots over concerns of an E. coli outbreak. Recalled carrots were sold at retailers such as Walmart, Whole Foods and Trader Joe's.

TITLE: Trump taps FCC's Brendan Carr to lead the agency
SUMMARY: Carr was seen as a pretty conventional Republican with a pro-corporate outlook for most of his career. More recently, he has embraced Trumpian themes about social media, tech and television companies.

TITLE: 2 killed, 10 wounded in shootings near New Orleans parade route
SUMMARY: Two people were killed and 10 others were wounded in two separate shootings along a New Orleans parade route and celebration attended by thousands on Sunday, authorities said. There were no immediate arrests.

TITLE: 2 killed and 10 wounded in shootings near New Orleans parade route
SUMMARY: Two people were killed and 10 others were wounded in two separate shootings along a New Orleans parade route and celebration attended by thousands on Sunday, authorities said. There were no immediate arrests.

TITLE: They disagree about a lot, but these singers figure out how to stay in harmony
SUMMARY: Members of the North Fork Community Choir in Paonia, Colo., aim to set aside their opinions on big topics when they sing. When differences arise, they figure out creative solutions to stay in harmony.

TITLE: A more severe strain of mpox has been detected in the U.S. for the first time
SUMMARY: The patient was traveling from East Africa, where the mpox disease is endemic. The CDC says the strain does not present a high risk to the general population.

TITLE: Is it the flu or is it COVID? One at-home test can tell you
SUMMARY: If you've got a fever, cough, aches and pains, and you're wondering, 'what virus got me this time?" Now  you can find out, without taking a trip to the doctor.

TITLE: Countries agreed to try to hold global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. Is that still possible?
SUMMARY: In the 2015 Paris Agreement, most countries agreed to try hard to limit global warming to below 1.5 degrees Celsius. Delay and inaction mean that goal is becoming harder to achieve by the day.

TITLE: Philadelphia criticized for how it's spending millions from opioid lawsuits
SUMMARY: Philadelphia has disputed a state ruling that it should not have spent money from opioid-related legal settlements on home repairs and small businesses in an area ravaged by the drug epidemic.

TITLE: Accused of violating worker rights, SpaceX and Amazon go after labor board
SUMMARY: SpaceX and Amazon are asking the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals to find the National Labor Relations Board unconstitutional. The federal agency is tasked with enforcing workers' right to organize.

TITLE: 'You're doing such a good job': A stranger tells a mom just what she needs to hear
SUMMARY: Emma Carlson Berne was at a restaurant, feeling overwhelmed with her three young children. Then a stranger came over with words she's never forgotten: "What a beautiful family."

TITLE: Artist, scientist, polymath — a new documentary uncovers the real Leonardo da Vinci
SUMMARY: We have a lot of labels for Leonardo da Vinci but a new documentary seeks to understand him as a person.

TITLE: U.S. allows Ukraine to use long-range weapons in Russia. And, Trump's fentanyl plan
SUMMARY: Why President Biden changed his stance on Ukraine using U.S. long-range missiles to strike inside Russia. And, experts are skeptical of President-elect Trump's plan to crack down on fentanyl.

TITLE: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection but plans to keep flying
SUMMARY: Spirit Airlines says it will continue flying as it files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Monday's announcement follows years of losses and a failed merger attempt for the low-cost carrier.

TITLE: Biden asks Congress for about $100 billion in disaster relief funding
SUMMARY: The largest chunk of funding — about $40 billion — would be for FEMA's disaster relief fund, so that it has enough money to last through the coming year. But there are requests for 16 agencies.

TITLE: From Chalamet to Styles: Why are celebrity lookalike contests suddenly everywhere?
SUMMARY: After Timothée Chalamet showed up at his own celebrity lookalike contest, similar events have popped up in cities across and beyond the U.S. Here's a look at the winners — and what's behind the trend.

TITLE: Trump cabinet picks offer 'fresh set of eyes,' says America First Policy spokesman
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to America First Policy Institute spokesman Marc Lotter about President-elect Trump's Cabinet picks and policies. The group has been advising the incoming administration.

TITLE: A Pennsylvania court says again misdated mail ballots don't count this year
SUMMARY: The Pennsylvania Supreme Court has directed county officials not to count mail ballots for the general election that arrived on time but in envelopes without current dates handwritten by voters.

TITLE: Artist, scientist, polymath — a new documentary uncovers the real Leonardo da Vinci
SUMMARY: We have a lot of labels for Leonardo da Vinci but a new documentary seeks to understand him as a person.

TITLE: With new safety update, Roblox aims to boost protection for young gamers
SUMMARY: In an effort to address child safety concerns, digital gaming platform Roblox announced Monday that it is rolling out a major update to its safety features and parental controls.

TITLE: Ukraine is Allowed to Fire US-made Missiles into Russia
SUMMARY: Ukraine is granted permission from the Biden administration to fire U.S.-made long range missiles into Russian territory. We hear from two NPR correspondents about this major policy shift by the White House. Our Pentagon correspondent tells us the goals around the move and what it might mean on the battlefield. And our correspondent in Moscow gives us the Russian Government's reaction to the move.

TITLE: Record number of people expected to travel for Thanksgiving
SUMMARY: Nearly 80 million people are expected to travel by car, plane and train for Thanksgiving, according to AAA, thanks to lower gas prices and demand for other modes of travel like cruises.

TITLE: Pope calls for investigation into whether Israel's actions constitute genocide
SUMMARY: Pope Francis has called for an investigation to determine if Israel's military attacks on Gaza constitute genocide. It's the first time he's publicly suggested that Israel may be engaged in genocide.

TITLE: Pennsylvania's high court sides with Republicans on misdated mail ballots
SUMMARY: The Pennsylvania Supreme Court has directed county officials not to count mail ballots for the general election that arrived on time but in envelopes missing the correct date handwritten by voters.

TITLE: Defense pick Peter Hegeth paid accuser to protect his career, his lawyer confirms
SUMMARY: The Fox News host reached a settlement to resolve an accusation against him, but a recently released memo brought the issue back into the public eye.

TITLE: Trump taps Sean Duffy, Fox host and former Congressman, for transportation secretary
SUMMARY: President-elect Trump has picked Sean Duffy, a Fox Business host and former Republican congressman from Wisconsin, to head the Department of Transportation.

TITLE: Defense pick Peter Hegseth paid accuser to protect his career, his lawyer confirms
SUMMARY: The Fox News host reached a settlement to resolve an accusation against him, but a recently released memo brought the issue back into the public eye.

TITLE: Dozens sentenced for up to 10 years in prison in Hong Kong national security case
SUMMARY: A Hong Kong court has sentenced 45 pro-democracy activists to up to a decade behind bars after it ruled in a landmark legal case that they had broken a national security law implemented by Beijing.

TITLE: 42,000 crowd New Zealand's Parliament grounds in support of Māori rights
SUMMARY: Protesters oppose a measure that would reshape the county's founding treaty between Indigenous Māori and the British Crown.

TITLE: Judge strikes down Wyoming abortion laws, including ban on pills to end pregnancy
SUMMARY: The decision marks another victory for abortion rights advocates after voters in seven states passed measures in support of access.

TITLE: Trump taps Sean Duffy, Fox host and former congressman, for transportation secretary
SUMMARY: President-elect Trump has picked Sean Duffy, a Fox Business host and former Republican congressman from Wisconsin, to head the Department of Transportation.

TITLE: A Biden green energy investment in Nevada that could appeal to Trump
SUMMARY: The U.S. has some of the toughest environmental laws in the world and has been content to let other countries mine, and buy many of its critical minerals on the global market. In recent years, there's been a push to get them at home with China and Russia dominating that market.

TITLE: Arthur Frommer, who changed travel with his guidebooks, has died at 95
SUMMARY: Arthur Frommer, who revolutionized travel with his 1957 guidebook <em>Europe on 5 Dollars a Day

TITLE: How to bridge our political divide? A pastor's answer: Do unto others
SUMMARY: A Pennsylvania church just blocks from where then-candidate Donald Trump's would-be assassin lived created a sermon series on the Golden Rule to try to bridge political divisions in its congregation.

TITLE: Beyoncé will perform a halftime show during one of the NFL's Christmas Day games
SUMMARY: Artists featured on her most recent album could make an appearance, some of whom include Miley Cyrus, Post Malone and Shaboozey.

TITLE: Development of Elon Musk's rocket to Mars will likely take off under Trump
SUMMARY: Regulators have slowed the pace of Starship launches over environmental concerns, but that may be about to change.

TITLE: America's first major immigration crackdown and the making and breaking of the West
SUMMARY: Chinese immigrants sacrificed to create America's first transcontinental railroad. Its completion may have  contributed to a backlash that led to the first major immigration clampdown in U.S. history.

TITLE: Nationwide IV fluid shortage changing how hospitals manage patient hydration
SUMMARY: Many U.S. hospitals are conserving critical intravenous fluids to cope with a supply shortage caused by Hurricane Helene. They're changing protocols for administering drugs and hydration through IVs.

TITLE: 1,000 days since Russia invaded Ukraine. And, Trump's proposed plan for your money
SUMMARY: How life in Russia has changed, 1,000 days after its full-scale invasion of Ukraine. And, diving into the consequences of President-elect Donald Trump's proposed tax cuts.

TITLE: We've got a lot of ways to go: Thoughts on World Toilet Day
SUMMARY: On November 19, the United Nations wants toilets to be top of mind — and they don't mean for the Property Brothers on a bathroom reno episode. Here's why toilets get their own international day.

TITLE: How do you protect a species that lives across a continent? Monarch butterfly decision may soon try
SUMMARY: The monarch butterfly is widely recognized and widely dispersed across North America and it's in trouble. Federal officials decide soon whether it gets protection under the Endangered Species Act.

TITLE: Ukraine attacks Russia with U.S.-made longer-range ATACAMS missiles, Moscow says
SUMMARY: Ukraine has fired six ATACAMS into Russia, the Russian Defense Ministry said. If confirmed, it would mark the first attack using the U.S.-made long-range missiles in 1,000 days of war.

TITLE: As Nadal plays his last tourney, Federer sends an emotional note from 'your fan, Roger'
SUMMARY: "You challenged me in ways no one else could," Roger Federer tells Rafael Nadal, who will retire after this week's Davis Cup tennis tournament.

TITLE: Ukraine attacks Russia with U.S.-made longer-range ATACMS missiles, Moscow says
SUMMARY: Ukraine has fired six ATACMS into Russia, the Russian Defense Ministry said. If confirmed, it would mark the first attack using the U.S.-made long-range missiles in 1,000 days of war.

TITLE: Trump's threats of mass deportations lead to hard discussions for families
SUMMARY: About 11 million Americans are related to an immigrant without legal status in the U.S. As President-elect Trump ramps up promises of mass deportations, these families are having hard conversations.

TITLE: The U.S. confirms Ukraine fired long-range ATACMS into Russia for the 1st time
SUMMARY: Ukraine has fired six U.S.-made ATACMS into Russia, marking the first attack using the U.S.-made long-range missiles in 1,000 days of war.

TITLE: Manhattan prosecutors ask for additional pause in Trump hush-money criminal case
SUMMARY: Manhattan prosecutors are asking for a further pause in the criminal trial against President-elect Donald Trump in order to give both sides time to weigh the unprecedented nature of the situation.

TITLE: A 'bomb cyclone' is expected to hit Pacific Northwest. Here is what you should know
SUMMARY: A "bomb cyclone" is forecast to bring heavy snow, high winds and life-threatening flooding to the Pacific Northwest in the next few days.

TITLE: Trump picks Wall Street investor Howard Lutnick as Commerce Secretary
SUMMARY: President-elect Trump picked Lutnick, the CEO of investment bank Cantor Fitzgerald, to be his next Commerce Secretary.

TITLE: A GOP lawmaker introduces a Capitol bathroom rule before her trans colleague arrives
SUMMARY: South Carolina Rep. Nancy Mace says the resolution aims to protect women's rights. Democratic Rep.-elect Sarah McBride, the first out trans person elected to Congress, has slammed it as a distraction.

TITLE: Trump picks Dr. Oz to lead Medicare and Medicaid
SUMMARY: In announcing his pick, Trump said Oz will work closely with RFK, Jr. "to take on the illness industrial complex." Oz, a celebrity physician, ran unsuccessfully for the U.S. Senate in 2022.

TITLE: Traffic on Bluesky, an X competitor, is up 500% since the election. How will they handle the surge?
SUMMARY: Unlike other social media sites, Bluesky allows users to create their own algorithm. The site does not have ads, nor harvest data for artificial intelligence training. But it is still very small, and it does not make money.

TITLE: Is Israel Using New, Deadly Military Technology in Gaza?
SUMMARY: NPR has been collecting eyewitness accounts from Gaza that indicate Israel is using a new type of drone. One that has a gun attached that can shoot people remotely. We hear how Israel is using it in Gaza and what this technology could mean for the future of warfare.

TITLE: The fight for Alex Jones' Infowars company heats up as Jones sues to hold on
SUMMARY: The Onion thought it had the last laugh when it was named the winning bidder after last week's bankruptcy auction. Now, Jones says that bid was "fake dollars" and wants a judge to disqualify it

TITLE: Trump picks business executive Linda McMahon to lead the Education Department
SUMMARY: McMahon is a professional wrestling business magnate and co-chair of President-elect Donald Trump's transition team. She has limited experience working with K-12 public schools.

TITLE: A surge in mass attacks has killed dozens in China in recent months
SUMMARY: Dozens of people have been killed in China in the past three months in a series of mass attacks. The latest on Tuesday saw primary school students injured by a car as they arrived for classes.

TITLE: Residents in Haiti's capital stand with police in a battle to repel gang attack
SUMMARY: Residents have been angered by the latest gang attacks. Violence forced Haiti's main airport to shut down last week after the country swore in a new prime minister.

TITLE: Traffic on Bluesky, an X competitor, is up 500% since the election. How will it handle the surge?
SUMMARY: Unlike other social media sites, Bluesky allows users to create their own algorithm. The site does not have ads, nor harvest data for artificial intelligence training. But it is still very small, and it does not make money.

TITLE: Have a politically divided family? These tips help you talk across the dinner table
SUMMARY: A 2022 survey found growing numbers of Republicans and Democrats think the other side is immoral and dishonest. Psychology and neuroscience research offers tools to help bridge that divide.

TITLE: Drugmakers and pharmacists battle over who gets to make obesity drugs
SUMMARY: The pharmaceutical companies behind Ozempic, Wegovy and other weight-loss meds push to prevent compounding pharmacies from making cheaper copies. They argue they can keep up with demand on their own.

TITLE: U.S. Embassy in Kyiv shuts down due to Russian air attack threat
SUMMARY: Russia promised a response to President Joe Biden's decision to let Ukraine strike targets on Russian soil with U.S.-made missiles.

TITLE: The FDA says it found bacteria and a 'mold-like' substance at a Tom's of Maine plant
SUMMARY: The agency is requiring Tom's to submit several documents, including assessments and remediation plans for its operations, contamination hazards, testing methods and more.

TITLE: He's been nominated 32 times for CMA Musician of the Year -- but never won
SUMMARY: Steel pedal guitarist Paul Franklin set a CMA record as a 32-time nominee for Musician of the Year. Will this year be different?

TITLE: Oarfish keep washing ashore in California. Folklore suggests that could be a bad omen
SUMMARY: A deep sea oarfish washed up in Southern California. Japanese folklore suggests seeing the rare fish is a bad omen, some accounts say.

TITLE: SS United States, record-setting ocean liner, makes its final voyage
SUMMARY: The SS United States, a record-breaking 1950s ocean liner, may soon sail from Philadelphia to the Gulf. NPR explored this ship, a relic of the grand liners that once connected North America with Europe.

TITLE: Western embassies in Kyiv shut due to Russian air attack threat
SUMMARY: Russia promised a response to President Joe Biden's decision to let Ukraine strike targets on Russian soil with U.S.-made missiles.

TITLE: 'Rust' premieres three years after a fatal on-set shooting
SUMMARY: Three years ago, cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed when a gun held by Alec Baldwin went off on set. Her husband settled a wrongful death suit to become a producer of the film, which premieres in Poland on Wednesday.

TITLE: Trump picks lead for Education Department. And, tips to bridge political divides
SUMMARY: What we know about Linda McMahon, President-elect Donald Trump's pick to lead the U.S. Department of Education. And, science-backed tips to bridge political divides.

TITLE: Is Trump pick Pete Hegseth ready to run Defense? A former defense secretary weighs in
SUMMARY: Former Secretary of Defense Chuck Hagel says "a lack of any government experience is an issue" when leading the largest institution in the world.

TITLE: It's a virus you may not have heard of. Here's why scientists are worried about it
SUMMARY: Case counts for Oropouche virus are still low but rising dramatically. What's going on? And then there's a study that raises the possibility that insect bites aren't the only way the virus can spread.

TITLE: He's been nominated 32 times for CMA Musician of the Year — but never won
SUMMARY: Steel pedal guitarist Paul Franklin set a CMA record as a 32-time nominee for Musician of the Year. Will this year be different?

TITLE: After a fatal on-set shooting, 'Rust' continued production. On Wednesday, it premieres
SUMMARY: Three years ago, cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed when a gun held by Alec Baldwin went off on set. Her husband settled a wrongful death suit to become a producer of the film, which premieres in Poland on Wednesday.

TITLE: A man has been convicted of murder in the killing of Laken Riley
SUMMARY: The case over the killing of a Georgia nursing student fueled the national debate over immigration during this year's presidential race.

TITLE: Trump picks Matthew Whitaker for ambassador to NATO
SUMMARY: President-elect Donald Trump tapped Matthew Whitaker as his ambassador to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, which Trump has long criticized for taking advantage of U.S. defense spending.

TITLE: NFL kickers are better than ever from long distance, and that's changing football
SUMMARY: Field goals of 50 yards or longer used to be a rare thing in the NFL. But this season, kickers are hitting them at a record 72% clip — and head coaches are trying them far more often than ever before.

TITLE: How a Sabrina Carpenter song led to a priest's demotion for mishandling church funds
SUMMARY: Officials say Monsignor Jamie Gigantiello was disciplined for mishandling $1.9 million in parish funds. He faced scrutiny last year for letting Carpenter film a music video at his Brooklyn church.

TITLE: Veteran news editor expects Trump 'to go after the press in every conceivable way'
SUMMARY: Former Washington Post executive editor Marty Baron says he thinks Trump is "salivating for the opportunity to prosecute and imprison journalists." New Yorker

TITLE: Gaetz meets with Senate Republicans as House ethics panel considers releasing report
SUMMARY: Former Rep. Matt Gaetz, Trump's nominee to serve as Attorney General, faces an uphill battle as the House ethics panel considers releasing report on allegations involving sex with a minor.

TITLE: Violent Attacks in China Raise Difficult Questions
SUMMARY: A series of deadly attacks within China in recent weeks have killed dozens and left people uneasy. Those who carried out the attacks have been seemingly ordinary people who authorities say became disgruntled or unhappy. Our correspondent brings us to the site of one recent attacks and says these incidents are raising difficult questions about society and the government.

TITLE: The International Space Station adjusts its orbit to avoid space debris
SUMMARY: There are at least 19,000 pieces of space debris in Earth's orbit, not including active satellites, that the U.S is monitoring.

TITLE: Federal courts trumpet steps to protect workers after #MeToo movement
SUMMARY: The federal courts say they have taken "extensive" steps to protect workers from abuse, discrimination and harassment since the rise of the #MeToo movement, but critics say many workers don't trust the internal system for reporting complaints.

TITLE: House Ethics Committee is deadlocked on whether to release Gaetz report
SUMMARY: The U.S. House Committee on Ethics is deadlocked on whether to release its report into former Rep. Matt Gaetz, whose nomination to serve as Trump's attorney general has been plagued by controversy.

TITLE: Witnesses say Israel is using sniper drones in Gaza and they're shooting civilians
SUMMARY:
Last week British surgeon Nizam Mamode testified in front of a committee in the U.K. Parliament. Dr. Mamode had recently returned from working at a hospital in Central Gaza.

He told parliamentary members what he witnessed, including drones that would come down and "pick off civilians, children. And we had description after description. This is not, you know, an occasional thing. This was day after day after day."

For months, NPR has been collecting eyewitness accounts from Gaza that corroborate Dr. Mamode's testimony, saying the Israeli military has been using sniper drone technology and that they're not just shooting enemies, but also civilians.|

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

TITLE: U.S. charges Indian billionaire with defrauding investors, hiding bribery scheme
SUMMARY: One of the world's richest people has been indicted on charges he duped investors in a massive solar energy project in India by concealing that it was being facilitated by an alleged bribery scheme.

TITLE: After a court win, the Justice Department is trying to make Google sell its Chrome browser
SUMMARY: If a judge orders Google to sell Chrome, it could dramatically upend the multi-billion-dollar online search business.

TITLE: A duct-taped banana sells for $6.2 million at an art auction
SUMMARY: A piece of conceptual art consisting of a simple banana, duct-taped to a wall, sold for $6.2 million at an auction Wednesday, with the winning bid coming from a prominent cryptocurrency entrepreneur.

TITLE: The Justice Department is trying to make Google sell its Chrome browser
SUMMARY: If a judge orders Google to sell Chrome, it could dramatically upend the multibillion-dollar online search business.

TITLE: UConn's Geno Auriemma becomes the all-time winningest college basketball coach
SUMMARY: Geno Auriemma has led the women Huskies to 11 championships and nearly two dozen Final Four appearances in his four decades as head coach.

TITLE: Here's how Trump and the GOP may try to weaken Obamacare
SUMMARY: Republican control of the White House and Congress sets the stage for potentially seismic changes including curtailing Medicaid, weakening patient protections, and increasing premium costs for millions.

TITLE: Richer countries are starting to pay poorer ones for climate change damages
SUMMARY: With climate-related disasters getting more extreme, richer countries are piloting ways to compensate developing nations, since they bear the least responsibility for causing climate change.

TITLE: Most of the country shifted right in the 2024 presidential election
SUMMARY: In 2020, President Biden won six of the seven closely watched states. This year, President-elect Donald Trump won all seven — plus he will got a majority of the popular vote.

TITLE: Chinese vessel under investigation after 2 data cables found cut in the Baltic Sea
SUMMARY: Germany's defense minister said damage to two data cables in the Baltic Sea appeared to be acts of sabotage. Several European countries have launched investigations.

TITLE: Sabotage suspected after undersea cables damaged in the Baltic Sea
SUMMARY: A Chinese cargo ship has been stopped off the coast of Denmark. Officials are investigating it for severing underwater telecommunications cables connecting a handful of northern European countries.

TITLE: To hit deep inside Russia, Ukraine has built its own drones
SUMMARY: President Biden has now given Ukraine permission to use U.S. ballistic missiles inside Russia. While it was waiting, Ukraine built its own drones that can strike far across the border.

TITLE: Why the U.S. shifted right. And, the Justice Department wants Google Chrome sold
SUMMARY: Why and where the country shifted right in the 2024 election. And, the Justice Department wants Google Chrome on the auction block.

TITLE: Foreign nationals propel U.S. science. Visa limits under Trump could change that
SUMMARY: The incoming Trump administration is likely to crack down on the H-1B visas used by tech companies and research institutions to hire top talent from other countries.

TITLE: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for Netanyahu and Gallant
SUMMARY: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants on Thursday for Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, for alleged war crimes in the Gaza Strip.

TITLE: Are you a caregiver for an adult? How has it changed you?
SUMMARY: Many who care for family members and loved ones at home say it can be very stressful but also rich in meaning. Share your story and insights.

TITLE: This year's FAFSA is officially open. Early review says it's 'a piece of cake'
SUMMARY: The FAFSA form is now open to students hoping to get help paying for college in the 2025-26 academic year. Students can expect a much smoother process compared to the last cycle.

TITLE: He was stuck in a hospital for 8 months. How states can fail people with disabilities
SUMMARY: In Georgia and other states, the federal government oversees the treatment of people with mental illness and developmental disabilities, because the states have been unable to comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act and the subsequent <em>Olmstead

TITLE: SEC Chair Gary Gensler, who took aim at crypto industry, to step down in January
SUMMARY: Gensler said he would step down on Jan. 20, when Donald Trump will inaugurated as the next president. Gensler took big enforcement actions against the crypto industry.

TITLE: Russia launched an experimental ballistic missile at Ukraine, the U.S. says
SUMMARY: Ukraine raised alarm suggesting Russia may have used an intercontinental ballistic missile to hit the city of Dnipro, but the U.S. National Security Council does not believe it was an ICBM.

TITLE: Former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdraws as Trump's attorney general nominee
SUMMARY: Allegations of sex trafficking and drug use had stirred controversy over Matt Gaetz's nomination as attorney general.

TITLE: Putin says Russia tested a new intermediate-range ballistic missile on Ukraine
SUMMARY: Putin said the new missile, called "Oreshnik," Russian for "hazel," used a nonnuclear warhead and was in response to Ukraine firing longer-range missiles into Russia with NATO's help.

TITLE: Former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdraws as Trump's attorney general pick
SUMMARY: Allegations of sex trafficking and drug use had stirred controversy over Matt Gaetz being attorney general.

TITLE: What is the ICC and can it really arrest Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu?
SUMMARY: The ICC also issued warrants for Yoav Gallant, former Israeli defense minister, and Hamas leader Muhammad Deif. But it doesn't have an enforcement mechanism and relies on states to make the arrests.

TITLE: Former Brazilian president indicted over alleged coup plot
SUMMARY: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro and several others have been charged with attempting to overthrow incoming government of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva in 2022.

TITLE: In Gaza Organized Gangs Make a Bad Situation Even Worse
SUMMARY:
Israel has been accused of using starvation in Gaza as a weapon of war. It's a charge the government denies, however aid groups say too little food is being allowed into Gaza. And making the problem even worse, armed gangs are looting much of the aid that is coming in. We hear more about the issue and what Israel is doing about it.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

TITLE: Police report gives details, timeline of the sexual assault claim against Pete Hegseth
SUMMARY: The woman who accused then-Fox News host of sexual assault in 2017 said that she "remembered saying 'no' a lot," according to a police report. Hegseth is President-elect Donald Trump's choice for Secretary of Defense.

TITLE: Trump names former Florida AG Pam Bondi as his new pick for U.S. attorney general
SUMMARY: After former Rep. Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration, President-elect Donald Trump named Pam Bondi, a former attorney general of Florida, as his next pick for U.S. attorney general.

TITLE: Some Trump cabinet picks are accused of sexual misconduct. What's it mean for #MeToo?
SUMMARY:
If you're tracking Donald Trump's cabinet picks, you may have noticed common threads among them: top jobs are going to people fiercely loyal to Trump, people with experience appearing on TV, but no experience directly relevant to the jobs they would be doing.

There's another thing several share: being accused of sexual misconduct. Secretary of Defense nominee Pete Hegseth, HHS Secretary nominee Robert F. Kennedy, Jr, Elon Musk, who Trump has picked to co-run the Department of Government Efficiency — all these men have faced some variation of accusations of sexual misconduct. All have denied it, or claimed no memory.

Donald Trump's first presidential win helped lay the groundwork for the #MeToo movement. What do his cabinet picks say about the movement today?
